loans.name: United Family Group

texts.en:
Aminata F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Family. She is 43 years old and married. She has four children who range from 15 to 23 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.

For four years, she has been selling charcoal in the Old Road Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as a respectful, determined person.

Her hope is to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Peter Omondi

texts.en:
Peter O.,33  years old, is from Nyalenda town in Kisumu city and is married to Benter Akoth. They have three children: Bridget, 8 years old, Cambeline, 6 years old, and Scoria, 4 years old. 

Peter owns a motorcycle which he uses in his business to transport people from Nyalenda to Kisumu town. He normally has good business during rush hours, i.e., in the morning when people are going to work and in the evening when people are going back home. This is the first loan that he is applying from Kadet Ltd after being introduced by a friend who is a client here and has benefited greatly by the loans offered. He wants to buy some spare parts for his motorcycle to enable him to operate it well.

His main desire is to own a rickshaw in the future.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Zeinap

texts.en:
Zeinap L. is currently in the business of selling fried fish and bread in the evening in the street and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to fry and sell.  Zeinap is 21 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

n 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Macelita

texts.en:
Marcelita M. is a 35-year old woman who lives with her husband in Brgy Bahigan, Dalaguete, Cebu City.  She earns her living by buying and selling dried fish and vegetable. They have one four year old child.  

Marcelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 to help her family.  With her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,600.

Marcelita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to buy and sell fish.

Now she is borrowing for her 6th cycle loan, Php 17,000, to support her business.  Marcelita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta V. tiene 39 años está casada con el señor Ronal Ortiz y tiene tres niños de siete años, de cinco y la más pequeña de tres años, ella vive en Colcapirhua una provincia de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de Sumunpaya, ella se dedica a la producción de leche y elaboración de quesillo.

Benedicta es una persona muy trabajadora hace como dos meses atrás la operaron de varices, porque ella no podía caminar ya que le afectaba a los pies pero su esposo don Ronal decidió que era momento de operarse y verla mejor a su esposa y de esa manera ella podría cuidar a sus niños y guiarlos en su educación, pero ese tiempo de recuperación bajo mucho la entrega de leche y elaboración de quesillos porque su esposo trabajaba y el no podía dedicarse a la producción de leche ella lo hacia lo mejor que podía con ayuda de su hijo.

Ella requiere el crédito para la compra de cascara de soya ya que ahora ella puede trabajar más y si les da una buena alimentación a las  vacas ellas darán más producción y ella podrá aumentar sus ingresos y de esa manera ayudar con los gastos y la educación de sus hijos, porque ellos sueñan con que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor y puedan terminar el colegio y realizar una carrera Benedicta sueña con que su hija pueda ser una excelente doctora y así ayudar a las personas de bajos recursos y en especial a los niños de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Benedicta V. is 39 years old and is married to Mr. Ronal Ortiz. They have three children, ages 7, 5, and 3. She lives in the community of Sumunpaya, in Colcapirhua, in the Department of Cochabamba. She works in the production of milk and fresh cheese. Benedicta is a very hard-working person. Two months ago, she had an operation for varicose veins because she could not walk, as it affected her feet. Her husband, Ronal, decided it was at the point where she needed to have the operation so that she could get better, to care for their children and to guide their education. However, their milk and cheese production has really fallen during her recovery, because her husband has another job and can't dedicate himself to their dairy business. Benedicta has done the best she can, with the help of her son. Now that she is able to work more, Benedicta is requesting this loan to buy soybean husk to feed her cows. If she provides the cows with nutritional food, they will produce more milk and she can increase her income. This would allow her to help with the household expenses and to pay for her children's education. She dreams that her children will have a better future, be able to finish high school, and become professionals. Benedicta imagines that her daughter would make an excellent doctor, and in this way could help low-income people, especially the children of their community.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soy husk (to feed her milk cows)

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 40-year-old member of Faulu Kenya under a group called 'Ikinu Clean Shine'.  He does dairy farming and sells kerosene to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to stock kerosene for sale in his Kwa Solo Kerosene Shop.  Solomon is happy because he was able to open up his kerosene shop with Faulu Kenya's help.  He hopes to open a petrol station in the future.

loans.use: To stock kerosene for sale

loans.name: Karambi Tutungukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Agriculture has, from time immemorial, been the backbone of Uganda’s economy. Different types of agricultural activity have given many Ugandan families an improved lease of life. This story is connected to K. Jesica from Kakinga, Ibanda district.

This married lady has subsisted on growing a variety of agricultural products for the last ten years. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected her gardens, Jesica has managed to consolidate the gains she has made. As a result, her family of four children has enjoyed the benefits. Principally, her children all now attend good institutions of learning.

In a month, Jesica reveals that she makes close to, or even more than, 200,000 Ugandan shillings from selling her farm produce, depending on the season. She is very upbeat that, with this loan, she will be in a position to improve on the mulching and gardening aspects of her farm and also increase the stock of animals on her farm which will help her increase her productivity.

In the photo, the lady with the hand up is Jesica K. and the man standing with the hand raised is one of the executive members of Karambi Tutungukye group.

loans.use: To purchase mulches for her farm and increase her stock of animals

loans.name: Siama

texts.en:
Siama C. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal out of her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcaol to sell.  Siama is 31 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer to design garments

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma B. is a 32 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children, ages 3-16.  She supports her family by making and selling Choco tablets (choco tablet made of cacao). She lives in Brgy Banhegan Cebu City.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000.

Guillerma is now borrowing Php 15,000 of additional working capital for her business.  This will be her 6th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Guillerma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Terencia

texts.en: Terencia V. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a food-vending business and in tailoring. She lives in Brgy. Banhigan, Dalaguete, Cebu City with her husband Lamberto and their four children, who are 21 to 37 years old. Three of their children have their own families, while one is working. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food-vending and tailoring businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (Php). Terencia is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can continue her food-vending business and have additional working capital. This will be her 11th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Terencia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda M. is a widow who lives in the Golden Rosary zone of Jonobjonob village, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. 

Veneranda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Veneranda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000 - uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store, so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Veneranda M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mara A. is currently in the business of selling various drugs at a medical clinic and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell.  Mara is 47 years old and is married to a husband who is a clinical officer. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her medical clinic.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia I. is a married woman who lives in Tuburan village, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses: pottery and passenger transport businesses. Her husband Danilo I., who is 55 years old, works as a driver and pottery maker to earn his living, helping with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are eight and 11 years old. 

Cynthia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cynthia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000 - uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy materials for pottery making so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. 

Cynthia I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Deodima

texts.en:
Deodima H. is a married woman who lives in the Santol zone of Jonobjonob village, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Ronnie, who is 43 years old, works as an auxiliary to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have one child who is six years old. 

Deodima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Deodima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,500 - uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store, so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and expansion of her business. 

Deodima H. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Imyat

texts.en:
Imyat M. is currently in the business of frying and selling local Sudanese bread and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Imyat is 41 years old and is widowed.   She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ciprian

texts.es:
El Señor Ciprian T. P. de 29 años de edad, es soltero y trabaja para mantener a su familia, su madre y a sus dos hermanas menores ya que su padre falleció cuando el tenia 18 años y desde entonces el se hace cargo de su familia.

Ciprian T. P. es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene un lote agrícola  en la colonia palmeras que está a 12 Km del camino a Ivirgarzama.- Puerto Villarroel, Quinta sección, el cultiva solamente cítricos como  mandarina, naranja, el cliente trabaja diariamente para el sustento de su madre y sus hermanas  para que en un futuro ellos tengan y gocen de las comodidades de las que él no gozo en su juventud.

El señor Ciprian se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de un vehículo para así poder facilitar el transporte de sus productos e incrementar la producción de cítricos y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su madre y sus hermanas y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Ciprian T. P. is 29 years old and single. He works to support his family, which is comprised of his mother and his two younger sisters. His father died when Ciprian was 18 years old. He has been taking care of his family since then. Ciprian T. P. is a young man who is very devoted to his work. He has a small plot of farmland in the Palmeras neighborhood. It is 12 kilometers from the road to Ivirgarzama - Puerto Villarroel, Quinta Sección. He only grows citrus like tangerines and oranges. He works everyday to support his mother and his sisters. He does this so that in the future they can have and enjoy comforts that he did not have in his youth. Mr. Ciprian came to the offices looking for a loan to buy a vehicle. This would facilitate product transportation and increase his citrus production. Then he would be able to have greater earnings for his mother and sisters’ wellbeing and a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle to distribute fruit

loans.name: Lenatte

texts.en:
Lenatte S. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: buying and selling livestock (pigs, goats, and cows) and operating a food vending business. She lives in the Sambag zone of Jonobjonob village, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her livestock trading and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 4,000 per month.

Lenatte is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can buy more livestock. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lenatte aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: Madame Mareme D. est une ancienne sociétaire  de la caisse de Ouakam ou elle est membre depuis 8 ans. Elle est  veuve et parent bénéficiaire  qui évolue  dans le commerce et la vente de produits de mer depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité  pour avoir des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (besoins de subsistance quotidienne). Elle sollicite un crédit  de 25 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de produits de mer destine  à augmenter son stock pour mieux préparer l’hivernage.
texts.en:
Ms. Mareme D. is a former associate at the Ouakam branch office, where she has been a member for eight years. She is a widow and a recipient parent whose business has involved selling seafood products for over ten years. Mareme chose this business to have the revenues enabling her to provide for her family (basic daily needs). She is requesting a loan of 25,000 francs meant for buying seafood products for increasing her inventory, so as to prepare for winter.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering funds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. is currently in the business of selling Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, etc. at a market and is requesting a loan to stock hens and cocks to sell.  Rose is 43 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.

texts.en:
Viriginia M. is a widow who lives in Prk. Santol, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and buy and sell (bananaque) businesses. 

Viriginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Viriginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,700!

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy more stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and expansion of her business.  Viriginia M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

Zeinap G. is currently in the business of selling plastic chairs and tables at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock television screens to sell.  Zeinap is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a clerk. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop by stocking mattresses and beds.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos T. tiene 22 años vive  con su esposa hace tres años, vive en la localidad de Tiraque del  Departamento de Cochabamba.

Juan Carlos a estudiado hasta segundo medio (secundaria) y trabaja en Tiraque al sur este del Departamento de Cochabamba a 50 km aproximadamente. El trabaja en construcción como  albañil, mientras la esposa se dedica a trabajos agrícolas en su comunidad donde siembra papa, haba y zanahoria un setenta por ciento vende al mercado y el resto para el consumo familiar.

El señor Juan Carlos y su esposa están solicitando un Crédito para comprar ganado de gorde y hacer  negocio, ósea el objetivo es comprar ganados terneros criarlos hasta que crescan un pocco y venderlos mas caros, de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos T., age 22, lives with his wife of three years in Tiraque in the Cochabamba department. Juan Carlos went to school as far as high school. He works in Tiraque, which is approximately 50 kilometers to the south in the Cochabamba department. He works in construction as a bricklayer. His wife devotes herself to farming work in their community. They plant potatoes, beans, and carrots. They sell 70% of what they grow, and the rest is for family consumption. Juan Carlos and his wife are requesting a loan to buy livestock to fatten in order to start a business. In other words, their objective is to buy calves to fatten. They will raise them until they grow a bit, and then they will sell them for more money. That way they will increase their income and improve their life conditions in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock to fatten

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
El señor Rómulo F. C., es un productor de leche de la zona tradicional de Sumumpaya a 9 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es casado, sólo ha terminado la primaria y desde muy joven por tradición familiar se dedica a la cría de ganado lechero, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos están en edad escolar y uno no llega a los 5 años.

Entrega su producción a la planta industrializadora de leche y  el crédito le servirá como parte de la construcción de  dos habitaciones para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
Su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro poder ver a sus  tres hijos estudiar y salir profesionales así poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rómulo F. C. is a milk producer who lives in the old-fashioned area of Sumumpaya, which is nine kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. His is married, and he only finished elementary school. Following family tradition, he has raised dairy cows since he was very young. He has three children. Two of them are school age, and one is not yet five years old. He delivers his production to an industrialized milk plant. He will use the loan as part of what he needs to build two rooms, which will improve his family’s living conditions. His biggest dream is to be able to see his three children go to school and become professionals in the future. This way they will be able to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House construction

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita M. is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating "buy and sell" ( Bananaque ) and fruits vending businesses. She lives in Prk. Tubod, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP2,500.  

Paulita is now borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks for her "buy and sell" business.  This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Paulita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Petty Traders Group

texts.en:
Victor T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Petty Traders.  He is 28 years old, single and was only able to attend school through 12th grade, due to a lack of financial support.  

For eight years, he has been selling cosmetics in Clara Town Market Monrovia, Liberia. This is his third loan circle.

He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cosmetics.  He describes himself as a God fearing person.

His goal is to improve his business and become a supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en:
Pacifique was born in 1978 and is married with 3 children; the first born is 12 years old, the second is 9, and the last one is one year old. Pacifique takes care of one dependent who is a member of her family. Pacifique owns a small business selling various styles of clothes for men and women. This business is known and organized and she can employ one person as a helper so that her business runs smoothly. This is her second year of successful operation in business. The hours of her business are from 7 in the morning to 6 in the morning every day except on Saturday.

Pacifique is now requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing the bales of clothes. Once this expansion is reached, Pacifique will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
señor Edgar R. de 33 años de edad está casado hace 11 años con la señora Maria Rodriguez de 36 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 1 hijo de 8 años que está cursando el 3er. Grado de la primaria.
El señor Edgar se inició en este negocio de ventas de huevos hace 7 años, empezó a distribuir por los negocios de los barrios de la ciudad en una moto  y con el tiempo transcurrido aumento sus clientelas tuvo la necesidad de cambiar su medio de transporte , por eso motivo compró una  camioneta, mientras él esta afuera su señora igualmente en su casa comercializa los productos que tiene, tambien cubre otras ciudades como Yhú, Vaquería por eso lleva otro producto como fiambres, chorizos, chorizos.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de huevos, salame, chorizos y de esta forma poder aumentar sus ingresos  y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edgar R., age 33, has been married to Maria Rodrigues, 36, for 11 years. The couple has one child, age 8, who is in grade 3. Edgar started this egg sales business 7 years ago. He started to distribute to various businesses in the neighbourhoods of the city in a car. With the passing of time, his customer base expanded and he needed to change his mode of transportation; so he bought a truck. While he is out, his wife sells their products in their home. He also covers other cities such as Yhú and Vaqueria, where he brings other products such as cold cuts and sausages. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of eggs, salami and sausages, to be able to increase his income and satisfy his customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of eggs, sausages, cold cuts, ham.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Poncla Juvet

texts.fr:
Jeune commercant,celibataire sans enfant,age de 32 ans est dans l'exercice de cette activite depuis 1998,il tient un etalage des produits alimentaire dans le marche de plateau ,ou il vend des boites de conserves de differents qualites,lait, petit pois, mayonnaise, haricot vert,macedoine, beurre , margarine, sucre...
Avec ce pret il veut elargir son activite en achetant des produits beaucoup sollicites comme , les cartons de tomates,margarine le lait ecreme; le lait en poudre comme Nido, belle Hollandaise et tous ce qui attirent les clients 
Il vend en moyenne 18000 a 25000f par jour,pour accroitre son activite ,il cherche les meilleurs debouches pour s'approvisionner, et fait des prix abordables pour ecouler ses produits
Pour le futur il pense aller plus loin en construisant une boutique d'alimentation dans la parcelle familiale et employer des jeunes gens pour l'aider dans la vente.Dans son entourage on dit beaucoup de bien de lui, il est tres serviable.
texts.en:
This is a young merchant who is unmarried and without children. He is 32 years old and has been in this business since 1998. He has a display of grocery items at the Plateau market, where he sells different qualities of canned foods, milk, peas, mayonnaise, green beans, mixed fruit and vegetables, butter, margarine, sugar… With this loan, he wants to expand his business by buying high-demand products, such as boxes of tomatoes, margarine, milk, cream, and powdered milk, such as Nido, Belle Hollandaise, and anything that attracts customers. His sales average from 18,000 to 25,000 francs per day. To grow his business, he finds the best outlets for supplying himself. And he offers affordable prices to move his goods. For the future, he is thinking of doing more by building a grocery store on the family plot and employing young people to help with selling. Among those around him, a lot of good things are said about him. He is very helpful.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of tomatoes, milk, butter, canned foods, margarine

loans.name: Big Five Group

texts.en:
Peter Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Big Five.  He is 38 years old, married and has four children who range from five to 20 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For five years, he has been charging mobile phones to make a living, on Johnson Street in Monrovia, Liberia. 

Peter plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more mobile phone chargers. 

He describes himself as very gentle.  Peter's goal is to improve his business, build a house and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: Buy more mobile phone chargers.

loans.name: United Brothers And Sisters Group

texts.en:
Ishmeal B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Brothers And Sisters. He is 38 years old, single and has three children who range in age from 6 to 11 years old. He was only able to attend school through the 11th grade due to lack of financial support. For 8 years, he has been a tailor on Benson Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He sews garments and school uniforms. He describes himself as a humble man.

Ishmeal plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more cloth. His plan is to become a successful businessman and educate his children for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Sikiya

texts.en:
Sikiya is 27 years old, married with 2 children who are 2 and 3 years old.  Sikiya has owned a shop for a long time but his capital is still low.  The hours for Sikiya to start the business are from are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.  In this shop, he sells a variety of goods including cosmetics, breads, biscuits, etc. 
 
Sikiya is now requesting his second Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  This loan will allow him to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs, which are highly demanded by a large number of his customers.  The sale of these foodstuffs will allow Sikiya to earn more profits than previously and he will start saving for a better future as well as for the stability of his business.

loans.use: A large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Nantiebe

texts.en: Mr. Nantiebe K. is 34 years old and works in Lome, his hometown. He has a store called "Kisi Techno" where he sells electronics such as cellphones, laptops, irons, vacuums, and other goods. He's been in business since 2007. He's married to a cleaning woman and they have two children. He's in the process of taking his third loan from WAGES in order to purchase laptops and portable irons. He has requested 400,000 CFA.

loans.use: To purchase appliances like laptops and irons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of silk thread of different colours

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
K. Samuel is 24 years old and single. At his young age, he is already into business instead of a better proposition like being at school. He has no regrets, however, as he says circumstances did not allow for his continued education.

Samuel now has an experience that stretches to five years and, though the positives outweigh the negatives in his banana-selling business operations, he says he has always been plagued by pests that constantly destroy his bananas at his stall. He reckons that with this loan, he will be able to buy drugs that can destroy these bugs.

In a week, Samuel says he makes profits that add to 100,000 shillings. In Kyeikucu, Ibanda, his hard work has always been lauded by his fellow business people who thought somebody of his age could not live up to the pressures of doing this kind of business. With this loan, he wants to buy more bananas that he will later resell.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Robila

texts.es: Robila, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy dedicada y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor de 36 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El cultivo de papa y arveja es la actividad que realiza diariamente Robila. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, eso ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y le resulta muy agotador. Más adelante, desea tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en estos meses.
texts.en:
Robila, age 36, is a very dedicated and kind mother. She lives in her own house with her 36 year old husband, Víctor, and their five beloved children. Her children are her primary motivation for all of her efforts. Robila farms potatoes and peas everyday. Through much effort she has made her land very productive. This has generated very good quality crops, and they are very much valued in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops. She has been doing this activity for 18 years. The most difficult part is transporting her products to the wholesale market in the city. The sacks that she takes are very heavy, which is exhausting to her. Later, she wishes to have a stand in the wholesale market in order to improve her earnings. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She plans on being very punctual with her payments as she does not want to cause problems in her communal bank. She is very happy in her communal bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy pea seeds. This vegetable plant is selling very well in these months.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 30 years old, married with 4 children.  Marie Claire earns her living by selling a variety of goods in her shop and this is her second successful year in this business.  Marie Claire's shop hours are from 7 am until 7 pm every day.

After realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Marie Claire is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Marie Claire will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.  In addition, she will also improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: A variety of foodstuffs

loans.name: Afi Elise

texts.en:
Madame Afi K. is 44 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. She is married to a welder and they have four children. Afi K. is an experienced entrepreneur who runs a business selling general grocery items as well as charcoal out of her home. With her income she is able to provide for her husband and four children. She's been working at this business since 1994. 

Madame K. has requested her sixth loan from WAGES of 500,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs. She will use half for her grocery business and the other half to purchase charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and goods for her general store

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en:
Josepha was born in 1971 and is married with four children.Josepha's husband helps her in order to serve their customers on time. This business is profitable because in her place of residence there are many people who need cakes, especially during the morning. Josepha has an experience of 3 years in this business. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 to 8 in the morning and during the evening from 5 PM to 9 PM every day.

Josepha is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more sacks of flour which will allow her to make more cakes for her customers. When she makes more cakes, Josepha will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Groupe 1 De Bogoba Togo

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe 1 de l’association Bogoba de Togo sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de cultures et de pouvoir recruter des hommes (manœuvres) pour le labour et le sarclage au cours de la saison des pluies, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne, le premier fut correctement remboursé.  Elles cultivent du mil,  de l’arachide  et du haricot.
 Madame Fatoumata  Tata Sangaré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’engrais, 50 kg de semence  d’arachide et recruter la main d’œuvre masculine pour les activités de labour et de désherbage. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences et en engrais à la foire de Ségou (au grand marché). Elle espère sur sa superficie de 2 hectares pour produire 9 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil, 300kg deharicot et des fanes de haricot destinées à faire des bottes. 
Les bottes de haricot sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est destinée à la vente. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour acheter les condiments hebdomadairement dans les foires et les soins de santé des enfants. 
Elle a comme objectif à l’instar des autres membres du groupe d’assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
The eight members of Group 1 of the Bogoba de Togo association are married women, mostly from large extended traditional families, who average 43 years of age and 3 children. They all live in the village of Togo, in the country commune of Sakoïba in Ségou Region (4th administrative region of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship and marriage. In order to expand their farming lots and to be able to hire laborer for plowing and weeding during the rainy season, they're seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. The first farming loan was repaid without problems. They grow millet, peanuts, and beans. Mrs. Fatoumata Tata Sangaré intends to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of fertilizers, 50 kg of peanut seeds, and to hire male workforce for plowing and weeding. She gets her supplies of seeds and fertilizers at the fair in Ségou (at the grand market). On her area of 2 hectares, she hopes to produce 9 sacks of peanuts, 4 sacks of millet, 300 kg of beans, and bean stalk leaves to make sheaves. Beans sheaves are stored and sold during the off-season. Part of the harvest is for their own consumption, whereas the other half is for selling. The achieved profit is used to buy food condiments on a weekly basis in fairs, and to pay for children healthcare. Like the other members of the group, her goal is to secure food self-sufficiency in the village.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for workforce

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino, de 39 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Verónica de 41 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con el apoyo de su esposa, Sabino ha logrado que sus chacras se vuelvan muy fértiles y productivas. Y esto se debe a que todos los días trabajan juntos en sus tierras, haciendo que sus cultivos cada vez sean mejores. Durante la temporada de cosecha, se dispone a llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde generalmente recibe muy buena paga. Lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus arvejas y papas, y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado para su esposa, de esa manera podrá aumentar sus ganancias si vende su propia producción. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos que tienen en su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja y papa, ya que estos son los productos que mejor se están vendiendo.
texts.en:
Sabina is 39 years old and the father of a simple and hardworking family. He lives in his own house with his wife, Veronica who is 41, and his two dear children, for whom he wants to provide a better life. With the support of his wife, Sabino’s farms have become very fertile and productive. And this is because everyday they work together on their land, making their crops better each time. During the harvest season, they prepare to bring their products to the wholesale market in the town of Tarma, where they usually get paid well. He has been doing this for 21 years and what he likes best about his job is growing his peas and potatoes. He believes that the hardest part is having to transport their crops to the place where they are sold. Over time, he hopes to put a small selling post at the market for his wife, that way they can increase profits by selling their own production. This is his ninth MFP loan. He has been very punctual in his previous loans and expects to be again. In his community group he is a very responsible partner and is always aware of the agreements they have in their group. With the 1500 soles he is requesting, he will buy pea and potato seeds since these are the the products that are selling.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea and potato seeds

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 29 years old, married with two children who are 3 and 6 years old.  Alice owns a shop where she sells cosmetic goods and this is her 5th successful year in this business.  Alice's shop hours are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Alice needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and she hopes that it will allow her to expand her shop through purchasing additional cosmetics and starting selling foodstuffs as they are highly desired by a large number of her customers.  If she experiences success with this loan, Alice will start saving and keep reinvesting for better financial stability in her future.

loans.use: Additional cosmetics and start selling foodstuffs

loans.name: Groupe 2 De Bogoba Togo

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe 2 de l’association Bogoba de Togo sont des femmes mariées dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition au début de la saison des pluies et de pouvoir utiliser des hommes (manœuvres) pour le labour et le sarclage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne.
Elles cultivent du mil, de l’arachide et du haricot. 
Madame Nana  Fané compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’engrais, 100 kg de grains d’arachide, 30 kg de haricot de semence et recruter la main d’œuvre (hommes et femmes) pour les activités de labour et de sarclage. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences et en engrais à la foire de Ségou (au grand marché). 
Avec sa  parcelle de 3 hectares, elle espère produire 15 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil, 600 kg de haricot et des fanes de haricot destinées à faire des bottes pour le bétail. 
Les bottes de haricot sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est destinée à la vente. 
Elle a comme objectif à l’instar des autres membres du groupe de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants et d’assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
The six members of the Group 2 of Bogoba Association of Togo are women married in polygamous families; on average, they are aged 41 and mothers of three children. All of them live in the village of Togo, in the rural community of Sakoïba in the region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali). They got acquainted through links of kinship and marriage. In order to have agricultural inputs at their disposal at the beginning of the rain season and to be able to hire men (laborers) for plowing and weeding, they sought help from Soro Yiriwaso. They are currently into the 2nd cycle of a farming loan. They are growing millet, groundnuts and beans. Mrs. Nana Fané intends to use her loan to purchase 2 bags of fertilizer, 100 kg of groundnut seeds, 30 kg of bean seeds, and to hire manpower (men and women) for plowing and weeding. She purchases her seeds and fertilizer at the Ségou fair (large market). With her 3 acre parcel, she hopes to produce15 bags of groundnuts, 4 bags of millet, 600 kg of beans, as well as bean vines intended to make bales for the cattle. The bean bales are stored and sold during the period of shortage. One part of the crop is self consumed while the other half is intended for sale. Mrs. Nana Fané, like the other members of the group, aims to breed small ruminants and to ensure food self-sufficiency in the village.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers, seeds, and taking on workers for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 36 years old, married with four children who are between 1 and 7. Christine's husband is also a businessman; they both work hard to support their family. Christine herself sells construction materials which is very profitable in the city where they are needed every day. She has an experience of five years. The hours of her daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day.

Christine is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more materials which will allow her to earn more profit. With extra money Christine will be able to sell even larger quantities of materials.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Oubaidatou

texts.en:
Madame Oubaidatou O. is 38 years old and sells beauty products along the streets of Lome. She was born in neighboring Ghana and is married to an electrician. They have two children. 

Madame O. has been selling cosmetics since 2007. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES of 300,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs in order to purchase more products to sell. She works hard to repay her loan and sell her products so that she can care for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase different beauty products

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.fr:
Ildephonse N.  est âgée 46 ans, née à Gisenyi, province de l’Ouest du Rwanda.Il est marié et possèdent trois enfants, le moins âgée a 2 mois et le plus âgée à 12 ans, deux sont allés a l’école. Ildephonse avec sa famille habite Gisenyi.

Concernant son activité, il est commerçant des produits alimentaires qui est la farine de maïs, il a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine de commerce et il a fait des épargnes qui lui ont aidé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.il épargne dans ACB avec laquelle il est client, il y a 4ans. Le prêt qu’il vient de contracter, c’est pour acheter dix sacs de farine de maïs, appelé communément FUFU. Il les vend en détaille et en tirer les bénéfices et rembourser son prêt. 

Le prêt contracté avec ACB est  le premier, les intérêts  tirés de son business, il les utilisera pour payer le minerval des ses enfants et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.

Dans l’avenir, après avoir terminé de rembourser le prêt, il pourra augmenter un niveau de prêt, et il deviendra grossiste de cette farine.
texts.en:
Ildefonse N. is 46 years old and was born in Gisenyi, a province in western Rwanda. He is married and has 3 children, the youngest being 2 and the oldest 12 years old. Both go to school. Ildephonse lives in Gisenyi with his family. His business is selling food products such as corn flour and he has been doing this for 10 years. He saves money, which has helped him improve his living conditions and those of his family. He has been saving money with ACB for the past four years. The loan he has just taken out will be used to buy 10 sacs of corn flour, commonly called FUFU. He retails the flour and the profits will allow him to repay his loan. The loan he has taken from ACB is his first, and the profits he will make will be used to pay school fees for his children and to increase the volume of his business. In the future, after repaying his loan, he will take out a larger loan, and will become a flour wholesaler.

Translated from French by Kathy Guis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat pieces de rechanges pour reparer sa moto

loans.name: Groupe 1 De Djekafo Togo

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe 1 de l’association Djekafo de Togo sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition à temps et de pouvoir utiliser la main d’œuvre dans le village (hommes et femmes) pour le labour et le sarclage pendant l’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne.
Elles cultivent du mil, de l’oseille de Guinée, du haricot et de l’arachide. 
Madame Alimata  Fané compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’engrais, 60 kg de grains d’arachide, 5 kg de semence d’oseille de Guinée et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences et en engrais à la foire de Ségou (au grand marché). 
Avec une superficie de 3 hectares, elle espère produire une tonne d’haricot, 20 sacs d’arachide, 200 kg de grains d’oseille de Guinée et des fanes d’haricot destinées à faire des bottes. 
Les bottes d’haricot sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est stockée et vendue afin de faire face aux petites dépenses du foyer, à l’entretien et aux frais scolaires des enfants. 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, Madame Alimata  Fané a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants pour s’équiper en matériels agricoles.
texts.en:
The five members of the group #1 of the Djekafo Association of Togo are all married women, mainly living in traditional extended families; on the average, they are 50 years old and have four children. They all live in the Togo village in the rural community of Sakoiba in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other as relatives or neighbors. In order to be able to carry out their agricultural activity and to be able to hire laborers (both men and women) available in the village for working the fields and weeding during the winter season, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second group loan. They grow millet, Guinea sorrel, beans and peanuts. Mrs. Alimata Fané plans to use her loan to purchase two bags of fertilizers, 60 kg [130 lbs] of peanuts , 5 kg [11 lbs] of Guinea sorrel seeds and to recruit laborers for working the fields and weeding. She purchases sees and fertilizers of Ségou (at the big market). On a plot of 3 hectares [7.5 acres], she hopes to be able to grow one ton [2200 lbs] of beans, 20 bags of peanuts, 200 kg [440 lbs] of Guinea sorrel and the tops of the beans (the leaves of the bean plant) that will be made into bundles. The bundles of leaves are put into storage and are sold in between harvesting seasons, when stocks are low. A part of the harvest is consumed by their families while the other part is put away and sold in order to help meet various daily household expenses and the children’s needs and school fees. Just as other group members, Mrs. Alimata Fané plans to start raising small livestock in order to have access to agricultural products.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers, peanut and Guinea sorrel seeds and  paying the cost of field labor

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japeth M. M. is 36 years old and married. He has two children, aged 6 and 4 years old. His business is located at MaasAi market in Kisumu city along the Kisumu-Nairobi highway. He has been selling curios, necklaces and bangles to the local and international tourists. He has been in this business for the last 11 years. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints due to high transportation costs. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy beads to make the bangles and necklaces to grow his business.  

In the future, he hopes to open a tours and travel company, which is his passion. He describes himself as hardworking, persuasive and outgoing.

loans.use: Beads

loans.name: Groupe 2 De Djekafo Togo

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe 2 de l’association Djekafo de Togo sont des femmes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs parcelles de cultures et d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition à temps en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne.
Elles cultivent du mil, de l’oseille de Guinée, du sésame, du haricot et de l’arachide. 
Madame Satou Fané  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3sacs d’engrais, 50 kg de grains d’arachide de semence et recruter avec le reste d’argent de la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences et en engrais à la foire de Ségou (au grand marché). Avec une superficie de 3hectare, elle espère produire 800 kg d’haricot, 18 sacs d’arachide, 4 sacs de mil et des fanes d’haricot destinées à faire des bottes. 
Les bottes d’haricot sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est stockée et vendue petit à petit pour des besoins de condiments et  cas sociaux (mariage, baptême et funérailles). 
Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, Madame Satou Fané  a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants pour s’équiper en matériels agricoles.
texts.en:
The five members of group 2 of the association Djekafo of Togo are married women in major traditional families with an average of 42 years in age and 4 children. They all live in the village of Togo in the rural neighborhood of Skoïba in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other from relationships, marriages and the neighborhood. With the goal of expanding their farm land and having agricultural fertilizer ready in time for the beginning of winter, they resorted to Soro Yiriwaso and are in their 2nd cycle of a farm loan. They cultivate millet, hibiscus flowers, sesame, beans, and peanuts. Ms. Satou Fané intends to use her loan to buy 3 sacs of fertilizer, 50kg of seed peanuts and recruit, with the rest of the money, workforce for the jobs of plowing and weeding. She gets fresh supplies of seed and fertilizer at the Ségou faire (at the big market). With an plot of 3 hectares, she hopes to produce 800 kg of beans, 18 sacs of peanuts, 4 sacs of millet and bean stocks to make bales. The bales of beans are stored and sold during the off-season. A part of the harvest is consumed by herself, while the other half is stored and sold little by little for condiment needs and social occasions (marriage, baptisms and funerals). Like all the other members of the group, Ms. Satou Fané has as a goal to raise small ruminants to equip herself with agricultural materials.

Translated from French by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, seed peanuts, and paying for labor.

loans.name: Jean-Claude

texts.fr:
Il est dans la vente  des cartes téléphonique, marié,il est père de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 21ans et 16ans né au Congo à Brazzaville, avec un niveau d'étude sécondaire, il est dans la vente des cartes et appels Téléphoniques depuis 5ans.
En améliorant sa cabine, il va attire plus de clients en: achetant un para-pluies ou para-soleil, en peignant sa cabine avec des couleurs vivent, il va faireplus dev bénéfices.
le prêt va lui permettre de réaliser ses projets comme  rélancer son activité prémière qui la ménuisérie, car ses recettes journaliere son comprises entre 20000f et 35000f.
En ayant comme vision d'être compter parmis les leaders de votre institution,il va ajouter d'autres cabines pour atteindre son but.
il veut que ses enfants évoluent dans les études et initier son fils au métir de ménuisérie.Il est l'écoute surtout des vieux de son quartier.
texts.en:
This is a man who sells phone cards.  He is married and the father of two children, aged 16 and 21.  He was born in the Congo in Brazzaville and has a middle school education.  He has been selling phone cards and phone calls for five years.  By improving his phone booth, he is going to attract more customers by buying an umbrella or parasol and by painting his booth with bright colors.  He is going to make more profit.  The loan will enable him to realize his plans, such as revitalizing his first business, carpentry, because his daily receipts amount to 20,000 to 35,000 francs. Envisioning being a recognized leader of your institution, he will add more phone booths to achieve his goal.  He wants his children to advance in their studies and his son to be introduced to the carpentry trade.  He is especially attentive to the elderly in his district. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving the phone booth and buying phone cards

loans.name: Beltran

texts.es: Beltrán, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y alegre, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Siendo aun muy joven, Beltrán sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica en la siembra de papa y arveja, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus productos, le compran rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar su cosecha hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Con el tiempo espera comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro préstamo en el futuro. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, así mismo comprará abono para aplicar a su nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Beltrán, age 21, is a very straightforward and cheerful young man. He lives in his parents' house, and what he desires most is to get ahead in life. Even though he is still very young, Beltrán knows that he needs to apply all of his efforts to be able to earn a living. His work is growing potatoes and peas, and when harvest time comes, he takes his crops to sell at the wholesale market in Tarma. His customers know the quality of his products and buy them quickly. What he likes most about his work is protecting his crops from pests. He has done this work for 5 years, and he thinks the hardest part is taking his crops to market to sell, since the sacks he carries are very heavy. In the future, he hopes to buy more land to expand his fields. This is his third loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make his payments punctually if he wants to have access to another loan in the future. In his communal bank, he is a very participative member. With the 1,500 Peruvian new soles he is requesting, he will buy potato seedlings and pea seeds, as well as fertilizer to apply to his new crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pea seeds, potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mibame

texts.en: Mademoiselle Mibame B. was born in Tsevie, Togo, about an hour north of where she currently lives and works in Lome. She is only 21 years old but has a successful store where she sells groceries and infant health and care products. She's had this business for two years. Now she is requesting her first loan from WAGES for 300,000 West African CFA francs, in order to restock her store with more groceries and baby products.

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes for her general store

loans.name: Benkadi  6 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi  6 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide et le petit mil. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Bintou F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 3 hectares.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten member of the group Benkadi 6 are married women averaging 43 years of age and four children each.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Nangola, a village of Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of winter.  The crops include peanuts and pearl millet.  The group members are on their fifth farm loan.  All the previous ones have been repaid.  With this new loan, Bintou F. intends to buy supplies before prices rise and sundry equipment and also to cover the labor costs for maintaining three hectares.  After the harvest, the produce is sold in and around the village of Nangola and in the city of Dioïla. The customer base is composed of women and men.  The women plan on making an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA per planting season. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm supplies, equipment, and the cost of labor

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa María de 42 años y sus 5 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Víctor, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia. Los productos que cosecha son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, puesto la calidad que tiene su producción es buena logrando comercializarlos a buen precio. Lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas, ya que éstos perjudican su cosecha, por otro lado el tener que transportarlos en sacos, le es muy difícil y agotador. En adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para aplicar a su siembra, para que pueda mejorar su productividad.
texts.en:
Víctor is 42 years old, and is a very happy and hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife María, who is also 42 years old, and his five young children, to whom he hopes to bring a better quality of life. The crop-bearing fields which with much effort Victor was able to achieve, are the principal source of sustenance for the family. The products he cultivates are in high demand in the biggest market in Tarma, and thanks to the quality of his products, he can sell them for a good price. He has been doing this activity for 23 years, and what he likes most about his work is protecting his fields from pests, which threaten his crops. On the other hand, transporting his products in sacks is very difficult and it wears him out. Going forward, he hopes to buy a car, with which he will make transporting his products easier.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he knows that this contribution will be very helpful in the development of his work. In his community bank, he is a very happy member and always brings order to the meetings. With the 2,000 Soles he seeks, he will buy fertilizer for his fields, so he can improve their productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Margie Audrey

texts.es:
Margie de 43 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (perímetro periurbano, toda la gente que vive hay son pobres). Ella vende productos Yambal ( empresa que da oportunidades a mujeres emprendedoras para vender productos a un bajo precio) . 

Margie comenzó a trabajar porque los ingresos de su esposo no le alcanzaban para mantener a sus tres hijos. Con esfuerzo y dedicación empezó a vender a sus conocidos perfume, maquillajes y productos de uso personal por catalogo Yambal. Ella sale todos los días a promocionar sus productos por catalogo a sus conocidos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, maquillaje para seguir con sus ventan en Yambal. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos vivan de una manera cómoda y tener ya un local de su negocio.
texts.en:
43-year-old Margie lives in the Perimetral of Guayaquil (A peri-urban area along the Perimetral Highway where everyone that lives there is poor). She sells Yambal products (a company that gives opportunities to entrepreneurial women to sell products at a low price). Margie began working, because her husband’s income was not enough to support their three kids. With effort and dedication she began selling to her acquaintances the perfumes, make-up and personal use products from the Yambal catalogue. She goes out every day to promote her products via the catalogue to the people she knows. With the loan, she wants to buy perfumes and make-up to continue her sales with Yambal. In the future, she hopes that her children live comfortably and to have a local for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, make-up

loans.name: Boukari

texts.en: Madame S. Boukari is 27 years old and works selling shoes. She sells her shoes at the Agoe Market where she's worked since 2007. Madame Boukari is married to another merchant, and they have two children. She is requesting her second loan, of 500,000 West African CFA francs, from WAGES in order to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Cira

texts.fr: Madame Cira N. est une femme de 38 ans qui habite à Guediawaye. Elle est membre de la caisse du centre de sauve garde de Pikine  depuis avril 2010. Elle évolue  depuis plus de 7 ans dans le secteur de la  restauration.  Elle vend le petit déjeuner  et le dimer dans le quartier ou elle habite. Elle a choisi cette activité  car elle a le gout de la cuisine comme toute bonne saint-louisienne  qu’elle est. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs pour renforcer son restaurant. Son objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices  pour pouvoir prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses 2 enfants mais aussi augmenter son  niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. Cira N. is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Guediawaye. She has been a member of the credit association at the Pikine youth center since April 2010. She has been in the restaurant sector for over seven years. Cira sells breakfasts and dinners in the district where she lives. She chose this business because she likes to cook, as does any good person from Saint-Louis such as herself. Cira is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for bolstering her restaurant. Her goal is to make her business more profitable and to increase her profits, so as to cover the schooling costs of her two children but also to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements: the purchase of Zinc sheet metal and additional family expenses

loans.name: Big Five Marketers Group

texts.en:
Daniel S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Big Five Marketers.

He is 39 years old, married and has eight children who range from 4 to 22 years old. He was only able to attend school to 12th grade due to lack of financial support.  He cares for two siblings. 

For 8 years he has been selling red palm oil in Old Road Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. 

He plans to use his 14,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 46,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of red palm oil. 

He describes himself as a hard-working man.

His goal is to improve his business and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red palm oil.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 55 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Serapio de 54 años y sus 5 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Con mucho esfuerzo Pilar ha logrado trabajar en sus campos agrícolas, convirtiéndolas muy productivas, es así que cultiva, papa, producto que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, logrando comercializarlas al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que le pone todo el esfuerzo para salir adelante en este negocio. Lleva 38 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar de sus productos una vez sembrados, sin embargo debe tener mucho cuidado para que la plaga ataquen dichos cultivos, asimismo la variación del clima afecta la producción pero confía que todo saldrá bien, por otro lado, le es difícil tener que transportar su cosecha al mercado, por ser muy pesados. Con el tiempo espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores préstamos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una compañera muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Pilar is 55 years old. She is a mother and has a very simple, hard-working family. She lives in her own house with her husband Serapio, 55, and their 5 young children, to whom they want to give a better education. Pilar has put a lot of effort into making her farm very productive. She grows potatoes, a product that is in high demand in the Tarma wholesale market, where she sells them. Her crops have given her the income necessary to provide for her family. For this reason she puts all of her effort into getting ahead in this business. She has been working her farm for 38 years and what she likes most about her job is caring for her crops once they are planted. However, her crops require a lot of care to keep pests from attacking them. Also, the variation in climate affects production, but she is confident that everything will turn out well. Transporting her produce to the market is also difficult for her because it is very heavy. In time, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her production. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her past loans and hopes to do the same with this loan. She is very involved in her communal group and is always aware of the agreements made by the group. With the 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting, she will buy more fertilizer, which she hopes will improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Djado Jeanette

texts.en: Djado D. sells used clothing at the Hedzranawoe Market in Lome, Togo. She is 35 years old and married to another merchant. They have three children. Madame D. has been selling used clothing at the market for about 20 years. She has also been working with WAGES for some years. She has now requested her third loan from WAGES, of 500,000 West African CFA francs, in order to purchase more used clothing to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Soutien Plus Group

texts.en:
Charlotte N. is the leader of the group named “Soutien Plus” that consists of 24 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Charlotte is 53 years old. She is a widow and the mother of nine children between the ages of 16 and 37. Charlotte sells corn and manioc flour. She has been in business since 1971.  

After learning through her friend about Hope’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in July 2008. Charlotte has already received six loans from Hope that she repaid correctly. 

Currently, her business brings in a profit of $45 per week. With her next loan she is planning to purchase four 35kg sacks of manioc and corn and two cartons of fresh fish to increase the inventory of her business. 

Charlotte’s dream is to be a provider of those products in her area. She runs her business in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: Purchasing four 35kg sacks of manioc and corn and two cartons of fresh fish to increase her inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mujeres De Tierra Colorada Group

texts.es:
Doña Julia X. C., es una persona que ha superado Elaborando canastas, y luego venderlos en los distintos días de plaza, en los diferentes municipios, por lo tanto ella se dió cuenta que elaborando y vendiendo las canastas a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos de su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea de formar un grupo de señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por trece integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza de animales, venta de ropa, venta de artículos de consumo diario, elaboración de canastas, elaboración de mochilas. 

Las integrantes del Banco Comunal, Mujeres de Tierra Colorada , Momostenango, están conformados por MUJERES todas se conocen bien desde hace más de doce años, decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia ya que estas personas son de escasos recursos y es de gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital de negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
