Julia X. C. is a person who has succeeded through making baskets and selling them on market days, in different towns. She found that through making and selling baskets she has been able to maintain her family and cover all of the household costs. For this reason she had the idea of forming a group of women so that they also could succeed. This group is composed of thirteen members, women who work in various areas such as the raising of small animals, clothing sales and sales of basic staples, basket-making and backpack-making. The members of the Mujeres de Tierra Colorada ("Women of the Red Earth") are in Momostenango. It is a group made up of women, all of whom have known each other well for over two years. They decided to request a loan from ASDIR in order to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their families, since they are women of limited resources and this is a great help for them to expand their business capital and improve their sales and their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Zansi

texts.fr: Z. Zansi est née en 1958 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Zansi est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont encore à sa charge. Zansi vit avec ses deux enfants au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou. Zansi subvient seule aux différentes charges familiales. Zansi n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Zansi mène comme activité, la vente de maïs et aussi de crevettes à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Zansi prépare et vend de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs). Zansi s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Zansi désire renforcer son activité et augmenter ses stocks de produits, en vue de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est donc pour élever le niveau de son activité que Zansi sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Zansi Z. was born in 1958 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Zansi is a widowed mother of three children, all in school, of whom two are still in her care. Zansi lives with her two children in the Agbodjèdo area in Cotonou. She provides for the family by herself. Zansi never went to school. To meet her various needs, she runs a business selling maize, as well as shrimp, at her home. As a secondary business, Zansi prepares and sells akassa ( a local food made from cornstarch). She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained four previous loans that were all repaid properly. Zansi wants to strengthen her business and increase her stock of products, in order to better meet requests of her clientele. It is thus to raise the level of her business that Zansi is seeking a fifth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Datevi Delali

texts.en:
Datevi K. is 25 years old and has a garage where he fixes cars and sells used car parts. His garage is called "Garage Trinité." He is a mechanic who buys crashed and broken-down cars and extracts their salvageable parts to fix other people's cars. Datevi has had this garage since 2006. 

He is requesting a loan of 300,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs to purchase more car parts to use and resell.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour and yeast

loans.name: Kafayatou

texts.fr: A. Kafayatou est née en 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Kafayatou n'est pas encore mariée et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Kafayatou vit donc seule depuis une douzaine d'année au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, et assure seule ses différentes charges. Kafayatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Kafayatou  vend des vêtements pour femmes à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé au Togo, que Kafayatou achète ses produits. Kafayatou exerce cette activité depuis près de cinq ans et a déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle, Kafayatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
A. Kafayatou was born in 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is not yet married and still has no children. So she has been living by herself in the Hlacomey district of Cotonou and covers her various expenses on her own. Kafayatou did not attend school. To support herself, she sells women's clothing at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She purchases her goods in Lomé, Togo. She has been in this business for nearly five years and has already had four loans, which have all been repaid at ALIDé. With the goal of bolstering her business and growing her customer base, Kafayatou is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ladies' clothing

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Adama Kouyaté  est âgée  de 31 ans et habite dans la localité  de Guediawaye. Elle est membre de la caisse de  CSP depuis 2006 mais n’a jamais contracte de crédit. Elle exerce l’activité  de vente de denrées  alimentaires et d’accessoires de téléphones  depuis plus de 3 ans. Grace au soutien de sa sœur elle s’est lancée  dans le commerce pour l’acquisition de revenus qui lui permettent de faire face à ses besoins d’étudiante. Elle dispose d’une alimentation générale  et sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs dans le but de la renforcer en produits  et aussi procéder  a l’achat de quelques accessoires de téléphones  portables. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices   afin de pouvoir mieux gérer  ses études  supérieures.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama Kouyaté is 31 years old and lives in the Guediawaye locality. She has been a member of the CSP group fund since 2006, but has never drawn any loans. She has run a business selling food staples and telephone accessories for more than 3 years. Thanks to her sister's support, she started this business to generate an income that allows her to meet her needs as a student. She sells general foodstuffs and is seeking a loan of 250,000 frs with the goal of increasing her product stocks and also buying several mobile phone accessories. This loan will allow her to increase her profits in order to better manage her higher education.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Del Complejo Group

texts.es:
Doña Bárbara Isabel X. C., es una persona que ha superado, Preparando y vendiendo alimentos por lo tanto ella se dio cuenta que preparando y vendiendo los Alimentos  a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por doce  integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. alimentos,  elaboración D. Chamarras, elaboración D. mochilas. Las integrantes del Banco Comunal, Mujeres D. Tierra Colorada , Momostenango, están conformados por MUJERES todas vienen trabajando y se conocen bien desD. hace más D. trece años.

Las integrantes del grupo decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia ya que estas personas son D. escasos recursos y es D. gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital D. negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Doña Bárbara Isabel X. C. is a person who has overcome many challenges. Through her work preparing and selling food, she has been able to support her family and cover household expenses. As a result, she had the idea of forming a group of women so that they too could get ahead in life. The group is comprised of twelve women. They have a variety of jobs such as raising animals, selling clothing, selling food, making jackets and backpacks. The group has formed a community bank called Mujeres D. Tierra Colorada, Momostenango. They get together to work and have known each other for more than thirteen years. The group members decided to seek a loan from Kiva partner ASDIR so they could improve their standard of living both for themselves and their families. They have little money so the loan is a great help providing financing for their businesses, improving sales, and also increasing income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Madame Antoinette C. is 28 years old and works selling charcoal out of her home in Lome. She is married to a tennis player and they have two children. 

Madame C. sells charcoal in order to make money. She has had this business since 2006. She usually is able to purchase the charcoal up north in the interior of Togo, but to ease her burden this month she has requested a microloan of 150,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs in order to purchase more charcoal. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her son’s school fees and other family expenses

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder, de 23 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad vida. Desde muy joven Wilder aprendió de sus padres a trabajar en la chacra, todos los días ayudaba en el trabajo, ya que era consiente que de ello dependía el bienestar de su familia. Actualmente tiene sus propias tierras, en donde cultiva papa, que con muchas ganas realiza este trabajo, ya que de eso depende para que pueda dar su propio sustento.  Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo el tener que llevar la cosechado hasta el mercado le es muy difícil, por ser muy pesados y varios los sacos que tiene que cargar. Su mayor anhelo es comprar nuevas tierras para que pueda aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlos, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su grupo comunal en donde es un compañero muy solidario y responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, ya que estos productos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Wilder is 23 years old. He is a simple and hard-working young man. He lives alone in his own house and what he wants more than anything is to improve his quality of life. Wilder learned how to work on the farm from his parents at a very young age. Every day he helped with the work which was consistent and the family’s well-being depended on it. He currently owns his own land where he grows potatoes. He looks forward to this work since he supports himself this way. He has been doing this for 6 years. He enjoys taking care of the crops the most. Nevertheless it is diffictult taking the harvest to the market since it is very heavy and he must load various sacks. He biggest wish is to buy new land in order to increase production. This is his second loan with MFP. He knows he must pay all his payments on time and he is prepared to do it. He doesn’t want to get his communal group into trouble. He is a very caring and responsible co-worker. He will buy potatoe and pee seeds with the thousand five hundred PEN he applied for since these products are in big demand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoe and pea seeds.

loans.name: Akuavi Abui

texts.en: Madame Akuavi N. has a store where she sells traditional Togolese cloth like pagnes and bazins, as well as children's clothing and other clothes. She is very successful and has had this boutique in her home since 2004. She lives in Lome and is requesting her first loan from WAGES of 400,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs in order to purchase bazins, pagnes and children's clothing.

loans.use: To purchase bazins, pagnes, and other clothing

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata A. est âgée de 62 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs ménages au quartier Sokala de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école par refus de ses parents qui voyaient en l’école une porte de déperdition de la fille, elle débuta  tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits en cotonnade. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière, elle a pu maîtriser les rouages du commerce. Ainsi, elle finit par évoluer seule pour mener le commerce du jus de fruits et  de la glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis 17 ans  et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. Elle reçoit constamment des commandes lors des grandes cérémonies (mariage, baptême, décès etc).
Pour faire son jus elle utilise du sucre,  du gingembre,   du Tomi (fruit exotique) très prisé, des  sachet de sucres valines et  poudres de jus (banane et orange). Le tout est mélangé dans 3 litres d’eau  afin d’avoir le goût recherché.  Le breuvage ainsi obtenu est mis  dans des bidons soigneusement lavés  qui seront  finalement dans le réfrigérateur pour refroidissement. 
Dans  le but d’acquérir un nouveau réfrigérateur afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle demande un nouveau prêt Soro Yiriwaso.  Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis  4 ans,  elle a  déjà obtenu 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels,  tous bien remboursés. 
Elle  est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 nouveau réfrigérateur. Elle s’approvisionne en cet équipement sur place. 
Madame Fatoumata A. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à payer ses factures d’électricités. 
Son ambition est de développer son commerce et d’initier ses petits enfants dans ce secteur d’activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata A. is 62-years old, married and the mother of eight children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband, her children, and several households in the Sokala neighborhood of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She never went to school due to the refusal of her parents, who felt that school was the road perdition for the girl. She started early on to work with her mother selling cotton clothes. After several years at her mother’s side, she was able to master the mechanics of the business. She started running her own shop selling fruit juice and ice. She has been doing this for 17 years and enjoys great reputation and recognition. She is constantly getting orders for important ceremonies (weddings, baptisms, deaths, etc.). She makes her juices using sugar, ginger, tomi (very popular exotic fruit), and packets of vanilla sugar and juice powders (banana and orange). Everything is mixed into three liters of water to achieve the desired flavor. The beverage is then poured in thoroughly washed drums and placed in the refrigerator to chill. In order to get a new refrigerator to meet customer demand, she is seeking a new loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She has been associated with the organization for four years, and has already received four group loans and two individual loans, all repaid without incident. This will be her third individual loan, which she plans to use to buy a new refrigerator. She can acquire the equipment locally. Mrs. Fatoumata A. sells cash or credit to a clientele consisting of both men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and pay her electricity bills. Her goal is to expand her business and train her grandchildren in this industry.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Fatoumata Tété

texts.fr:
Madame   Fatoumata  Traoré  est âgée de 30  ans, mariée et  mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants au  quartier Sido Soninkoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle abandonna l’école en classe de 5ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour mener le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments  alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle jouit d’une très grande expérience dans le commerce d’articles divers tels, la vente du bois  de chauffe, du charbon de bois etc. Elle mène cette activité depuis 4 ans, et est la seule vendeuse de bois de chauffe dans son quartier. Elle bénéficie d’une grande clientèle et réaliser un bon chiffre d’affaire.
Dans le souci de toujours mieux mener son activité dont la clientèle est constante, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec  Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 42 mois. Elle a déjà obtenu 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels qui ont   tous été  correctement remboursés.  
Elle  est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 chargements  de camion en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans agrées,  dans le village  de  Kélékou derrière Bamako.
Madame Fatoumata  Traoré  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes parmi ses clients figurent quelques hommes qui sont des rôtisseurs.
Avec ce prêt elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA, ce qui lui permettra de rembourser de se prendre en charge (achat de médicaments, d’habillements et de nourritures).
Son ambition est de travailler d’avantage afin d’avoir beaucoup et de préparer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband and children in the Sido Soninkoura neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She left school after her fifth year of primary school (in the Malian system) to start a business alongside her mother who sold condiments. After several years of training alongside her mother, she has enjoyed a very great experience selling various goods, such as firewood, charcoal, etc. She has run this business for 4 years, and is the sole saleswoman of firewood in her neighborhood. She enjoys a large customer base and high sales. In the interest of constantly improving how she runs her business, of which the customer base is consistent, she is requesting this new loan. She has worked with Soro Yiriwaso for 42 months. She has already received 3 group loans and 2 individual ones which she has always paid back properly. She is on her third inidividual loan, which she expects to use to buy 2 truckloads of of firewood. She restocks through registered small farmers, in the village of Kélékou behind Bamako. Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré sells for cash or credit to her customers, who are for the most part women but amongst which are several men who sell roast meat for a living. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 FCA, which will allow her to pay for those in her care (purchase of medicine, clothes, and food). Her goal is to work more in order to have a lot and to make a good future for her children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Enriquelme

texts.es:
El señor Enriquelme González de 27 años de edad es soltero y empezó este negocio hace 3 años que está ubicado a metros del mercado municipal de Caaguazú.
El señor Enriquelme se inicio   trabajando como empleado por un tiempo de dos años, al salir de su trabajo formó una sociedad con un familiar teniendo en cuenta que tiene experiencia en el rubro, esta sociedad duró 1 año y 6 meses y a partir de ahi comenzó a manejarse solo, gracias a la experiencia acumulada su negocio crece cada dia en volumen y clientelas porque le da un trato personalizada a todos.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de camperas para damas y caballeros, buzos, frazadas, guantes, medias, edredones para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientelas por el cambio de temporada y con eso cumplir con todos, por ende aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
27-year old Sr. Enriquelme González is unmarried. He began his business three years ago; it is located close to Caaguazú’s municipal market. For the first two years of his working life he worked as an employee, but on leaving the job, he started a store with one of his relatives who had experience in this line of work. This partnership lasted a year and six months, and then Enriquelme ran it by himself. Thanks to the experience he had gained, the business gradually grew and he gained more customers because of the personalized service he provided to all. He is seeking a loan to buy the men’s and women’s jackets, sweatsuits, blankets, gloves, socks, and quilts that have been requested by his customers now that winter is coming. By fulfilling these orders, he will increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stock for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He is going to use the money for construction materials for his home, he is going to build a wall.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy N. est sociétaire  à la caisse de CSP. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants. Elle est engagée  comme femme de ménage  dans une école  privée  dans la localité  de Guediawaye. Elle a choisi cette option pour pouvoir aider son mari et sa famille dans les dépenses  quotidiennes. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs. L’objet du  prêt est d’acheter un lit pour son foyer conjugal. Ce financement constituera  un soutien  pour son mari a équiper  leur chambre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy N. is a member of the CSP group fund. She is married and has 2 children. She is employed as a housekeeper at a private school in the Guediawaye locality. She chose this option to be able to help her husband and family meet their daily expenses. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs. The goal of this loan is to buy a bed for her household. This loan will help support her husband in furnishing their room.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Social needs

loans.name: Peter

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tuyishime Peter est un jeune de 25 ans, qui est née dans le district de Rubavu de l’ancienne ville de Gisenyi en province de l’Ouest. Il est célibataire, il vit avec ses parents il a un diplôme de niveau A2 en informatique de gestion.
Informaticien qui a monté un Studio de musique pour graver les CD, DVD, VCD de musique et films. Son IMF est Amasezerano COmmunity Banking sa.
Il prend un prêt aujourd’hui pour acheter un outil de musique appelé SOUND CARD pour élever la capacité de son studio et améliorer les qualités de ses services ainsi satisfaire les clients. C’est son premier prêt, il veut à la longue prendra un prêt pour le minerval car il compte étudier l’université l’an prochain 2011, en faculté de computer science ou informatique de gestion car ils sont des facultés promu par le gouvernement Rwandais, il pourra aussi se marier et avoir des enfants par les épargnes continuelles qu'il effectu.
texts.en:
Mr. Tuyishime Peter is a young man of 25 who was born in the Rubavu district of the old city Gisenyi, Western Province. He is single and lives with his parents. He has a level A2 diploma in administrative data processing. A computer specialist, he has created a music studio to burn CDs, DVDs, and VCDs, both music and films. His microfinance institution is Amasezerano Community Banking S.A. He is seeking a loan to buy a sound card to raise the capacity of his studio and improve his quality of service, in order to satisfy his customers. This is his first loan. Over the long term he would like a loan to pay his tuition fees. He plans to study at the university next year (2011), either computer science or administrative data processing. These are the departments encouraged by the Rwandan government. He would also be able to marry and have children thanks to his regular savings.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sound card to burn CDs, VCDs, and DVDs

loans.name: Graciella

texts.es:
La  señora Graciela de 44 años de edad, es separada, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales los mayores están casados  y ella  vive con dos hijos una de 19 años y otro de 10 años.
   Ña Graciela  se inició con el trabajo de vendedora ambulante  aproximadamente en el año 1.990, ella era ama de casa pero con la necesidad de ayudar a su familia y poner su granito de arena con el dinero que tenia ahorrado compro varias mercaderías y empezó a dedicarse a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad.
   Actualmente lleva un total de 20 años en el rubro y abarca la zona de San Joaquin y sus alrededore, saliendo todos los dias de su casa a vender sus ropas. 
   Solicito el crédito para la compra de camperas en cantidad por que tiene varios pedidos.
   La cliente tiene proyectado alguna vez  poner un salón exclusivo para venta en un lugar estratégico, y espera un futuro mejor para nuestro país con mucho trabajo y progreso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de camperas de varios tipos de cuero, jeans, lana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela is 44 years old, separated, and has four children, the grown ones are married and she lives with two of them, one 19 years old and the other 10. Mrs. Graciela started in approximately 1990 as a street vendor. She was a housewife but because of the need to help her family and the desire to contribute, she bought merchandise with the money that she had saved and started to sell basic items. At this point she has been in this business for 20 years and covers the San Joaquin and surrounding areas. leaving her house every day to sell her clothing. She is requesting the loan to purchase jackets because she has various orders for them. This customer is planning to someday open a shop at a strategic location and expects a better future for the country with hard work and progress. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of jackets of various types; leather, denim, wool.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets of  leather, denim, wool.

loans.name: Mèmèdé Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Mèmèdé Clarisse est née en 1978 à Ganvié au Bénin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais Clarisse ne vit plus avec son mari. Clarisse vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les différentes charges familiales. Clarisse s'est installée depuis près de douze ans au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Clarisse a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. IL y a près de douze ans que Clarisse vend divers produits (conserves de tomates et de sardine, lait, mayonnaise, petits pois, café, couscous, huile d'arachide, savons, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Clarisse  vend de l'eau fraîche, de la glace et du jus de bissap. Clarisse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Clarisse sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mèmèdé Clarisse A. was born in 1978 in Ganvié, Benin, and is the mother of three children, all in school. But Clarisse no longer lives with her husband. She lives alone with her children and provides for the family by herself. For close to twelve years, Clarisse has lived in the Ayélawadjè area in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She ended her studies in secondary school. For close to twelve years, Clarisse has sold various products (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, mayonnaise, peas, coffee, couscous, peanut oil, soap, etc.) at a store located in her home. As a secondary business, Clarisse sells fresh water, ice, and hibiscus flower tea. She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. This is the first time Clarisse is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), with the goal of increasing her working capital and better responding to the growing demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, peas, couscous, pasta, peanut oil, soap)

loans.name: Seidou

texts.en:
Monsieur Seidou A. is a chauffeur who also owns a general store. He is 37 years old and married to a woman who also works as a merchant. They have four children. 

To make extra money to help feed his family, Msr. A. runs this general store. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs to increase his store's stock. He's had the store since 2003, but this is his first time taking a loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To reinforce his commercial activities and purchase items to sell in his general store

loans.name: Nuevos Horizontes Group

texts.es: Manuela es casada, curso el sexto grado D. primaria, tiene dos hijas, ella y su esposo se  dedican a la Tejeduría, (Elaboración del Cortes Típicos), tiene 5 años con este negocio. Viendo la necesidad D. capital para poder ampliar su negocio, conjuntamente con otras vecinas se organizan para poder formar un grupo el cual se denomina NUEVOS HORIZONTES. Este Banco Comunal cuenta con doce socias, estas señoras se dedican a la tejeduría, algunas otras tienen tiendas D. consumo diario. El préstamo ellas lo utilizarán para compra D. materia prima y así podrán incrementar el volumen D. las ventas que realizan. Dicho grupo resiD. en el Cantón Xecanchavox, San Cristóbal, Totonicapán, esperan obtener mejores ganancias y contribuir al desarrollo D. se fanilia y D. Guatemala.
texts.en:
Manuela is married with a sixth graD. education ,and for the past 5 years has worked alongsiD. her husband in Tejeduria (confection of traditional clothing). Recognizing the need for greater capital to expand her business she joined with her neighbors to form the Nuevos Horizontes group. This community bank has 12 female partners, most of whom work in Tejeduria while some have small shops selling daily use items. They will use the loan to buy raw material to increase their sales volume. This group is from the Xecanchavox canton of San Cristobal, Totonicapan, and hopes to increase their profits and contribute to the development of their families and Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by SolS. Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 41 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y jovial, comparte su vida Con su hijo de 19 años y del cual viven juntos en una casa que le fue heredada por su madre. El trabajo al que se dedica Teresa, es la venta de joyas en fantasía fina.  Conoce bien su trabajo, puesto que sabe sobre el mantenimiento y el cuidado que debe darles, es así que toda mercancía como: aretes, anillos y collares los guarda en franelas, de esa manera evita el deterioro de estas joyas. Sus principales clientes son sus compañeras de trabajo y las adolescentes de los centros de estudios, donde suele ir a ofrecer. Anteriormente vendía estas joyas mediante catálogos, pero no le resultó, desde entonces los lleva consigo para que sus clientes no duden en seleccionar y comprar su mercancía.  Le gusta su labor y la modalidad de sus ventas, además es muy precavida para evitar que sea asaltada. Lleva 5 años en este trabajo y su mayor anhelo es aumentar la cantidad de joyas que posee actualmente, así como ampliar su negocio vendiendo cosméticos. Este es su dieciochoavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas como lo estuvo haciendo con los demás préstamo, puesto que sabe que es de mucha utilidad para el incremento de su capital. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará cosméticos de belleza, puesto que le es más rentable, además pueda aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que vende y poder cumplir con los diversos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Teresa is 41 and a hard-working and cheerful mother who lives with her 19 year-old son in a house inherited from her mother. She sells high-quality costume jewelry. She know her work well, especially how to care for the jewelry. She sells items such as earrings, rings, and necklaces that she wraps in flannel and thus avoids damage to the stones. Her main customers are people she works with and teens from the schools where she used to go to sell. In the past she sold the jewelry through catalogs but that wasn’t profitable. From that time on she has been selling by taking the items with her so that her customers always select and buy her merchandise. She likes to sell this way and it’s prudent since this is how she can avoid being robbed. She has worked like this for the past 5 years and her main goal is to increase the quantity of gems that she currently has and to grow her business by selling cosmetics. This is her eighteenth loan with MFP and she promises to make all the payments as she has done with the past loans. She knows the loans are very important to increase her capital. With this loan that she is requesting she will buy cosmetics, since they are the most profitable. She will also be able to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells and fill all the different orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Byabasita Tukwatanise Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
In Byabasita, Ibanda, business can blossom if one summons up those two, always-neglected, business winning factors: planning and hard work. He has been a wise planner and as a result, 42-year-old N. Willy is basking in the glow of his ten-year-old commercial agriculture business.

Willy has been banking on this business to cater for all his family’s needs. That is a clear testimony that hard work pays. He also mentions good customer handling skills as a requisite factor that should not be glossed over if one is to fully succeed. This he says creates good rapport with his clients.

Willy has mostly been selling maize, beans, cassava and millet. His dream is to expand his business further with the acquisition of this loan. He also wants to see to it that all his children are all in good schools. With this loan, he wants to buy more crops like coffee that he will later resell, but he also wants to expand his trading activities beyond Ibanda town.

loans.use: To buy more lucrative crops to sell like coffee

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Née en 1958 en Côte d’Ivoire, Etat voisin du Bénin, A. Béatrice est mariée à SOGNIGBE Emmanuel et est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement, deux des enfants sont encore à la charge du couple. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Agongbomè à Cotonou. Béatrice s’est installée dans ce quartier depuis neuf ans. Le couple le partage les différentes charges familiales. Béatrice n’est pas allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Béatrice vend divers produits (sucre, lait, piles, conserves de sardine et de tomate, papier hygiénique, produits pour cheveux, savons, et des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Béatrice achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Béatrice a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés, mais avec quelques difficultés, vu qu’elle a été malade. Aujourd’hui, Béatrice désire renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est donc pour rehausser le niveau de ses produits que Béatrice sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1958 in Ivory Coast, a country bordering Benin, Béatrice A. is married to Emmanuel Sognigbe and is the mother of six children, all in school. Only two of the children are still in the care of the couple. Béatrice lives together with her husband and children in the Agongbomè area in Cotonou. She has lived in this area for nine years. The couple share the various family expenses. Béatrice did not go to school. To provide for herself and her children, she sells various products (sugar, milk, batteries, canned sardines and tomatoes, toilet paper, hair products, soap, and plastic kitchen utensils) at a store in her home. Béatrice buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), both of which were repaid properly, but with some difficulty because she was sick. Today, Béatrice wants to strengthen her business and better respond to the demands of her clientele. It is thus to raise the level of her products that Béatrice is seeking a third loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products (sugar, milk, batteries, canned sardines and tomatoes, toilet paper, and plastic kitchen utensils)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements and to pay some personal family expenses.

loans.name: Nelly Teodolinda

texts.es:
Nelly de 57 años,  vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (perímetro periurbano, toda la gente que vive hay son pobres). Ella tiene un comedor donde vende almuerzos a partir de las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm todos los días.

Ella trabajaba en un comedor pero como quería independizarse y tener sus propio dinero decidió invertir sus ahorros. Por esa buena decisión ha podido mantener a sus cinco hijos y ayudo a su esposo. Para tener mas arreglado su local ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una carpa, mesas y sillas.    

En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo para entregar a domicilio los almuerzos a las empresas.
texts.en:
Nelly, 57, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (urban perimeter, all the inhabitants there are poor). She has an eatery where she sells lunches from 8am until 3pm every day. She used to work in a restaurant but wanted to become independent and earn her own money so she invested her savings. This wise decision has made it possible for her to support her five children and help her husband meet household expenses. In order to have her eatery better furnished, she wants to use the loan to buy a tent, tables and chairs. In the future, she’s like to buy a vehicle so that she can home deliver her meals to firms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a tent, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
N. Marie  est une femme de 38 ans, née à Gisenyi, province de l’Ouest du Rwanda. Elle est mariée et à cinq enfants, le moins âgée a 4 ans et le plus âgée à 17 ans, ils sont tous à l’école. Marie avec sa famille habite Gisenyi.

Concernant son activité, elle est commerçante des produits alimentaires qui sont les pommes de terre, bananes, elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans ce domaine et elle a fait des épargnes qui lui ont aidé de payer les minervals de ses enfants. Elle épargne dans ACB avec laquelle elle est client il y a 3ans. Le prêt qu’elle vient de contracter c’est pour acheter dix sacs de pommes de terre pour les détailler et en tirer les bénéfices et rembourser son prêt. 

Le prêt contracté avec ACB est  le premier, les intérêts  tirés de son business, elle les utilisera pour payer les minervals des ses enfants et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.

Dans l’avenir, après avoir terminé de rembourser le prêt, elle pourra avoir un nouveau prêt, et elle pourra ravitailler sa maison.
texts.en:
Marie N. is a 38-year old woman born in Gisenyi, a Western Province of Rwanda. She is married with five children aged 4 to 17, all in school. Mary and her family live in Gisenyi. Her activity is the retail sale of food products, namely potatoes and bananas. She has five years experience in this area and her savings have allowed her to pay for her children’s school fees. She keeps her savings at ACB where she has been a customer for three years. The loan she has requested will be used to buy ten bags of potatoes for sale at retail, make a profit, and repay the loan. This loan with ACB is her first. She plans to use the profits derived from her business to pay her children’s school fees and increase her sales. Afterwards, once the loan is fully repaid, she will be able to apply for another loan and supply her household.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ten bags of potatoes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La  señora Juana de 35 años de edad, esta casada con el Señor Baleriano Franco, tiene dos hijos uno de 10 años que esta en el 3er grado y el otro es de 3 meses.
   Ña Juana tiene una despensa donde trabaja diariamente y al mismo tiempo tambien le ayuda a su marido quien se dedica a la carpinteria por lo cual tambien se dedica a la venta de  muebles.
   Hace poco la Sra. Juana dio a luz a su hijo Arturo. Mientras tanto su marido se dedico fuertemente a la muebleria abandonando más el rubro de la despensa, pero piensan nuevamente incursionar en la venta de artículos de primera necesidad.
    Solicito el credito para la compra de Terciadas, Tela , Espuma, etc.
texts.en:
Juana, 35, is married to Baleriano Franco and has two children, a ten-year-old who is a third-grader and a 3-month-old. Juana has a grocery store where she works daily. She also helps her husband who is a carpenter so she also sells furniture. A short while ago Juana gave birth to her son Arturo. In the meantime, her husband focused more strongly on the furniture business neglecting the grocery store. However, they plan to once again invest in stock items for the store. This loan will be used to buy three ply, fabric, foam, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three ply, fabric and foam.

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Céline est mariée à ADDIDJI Corneille, un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a environs quinze ans que Céline s'est isntallée au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, et y vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Céline a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Céline prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce aux poissons et de l'oeuf, etc.) à la devanture de sa maison. Céline s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Céline sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'accroître sa part de marché ; ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Céline A. is married to Corneille Addidji, a mechanic. The couple have three children, all in school. Céline moved to the Ayélawadjè area of Cotonou about fifteen years ago, and lives there with her husband and children. The couple provide for the family together. Céline has had very little schooling. To meet her needs, Céline prepares and sells food (rice accompanied by a sauce made of fish and eggs) at the front of her house. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. This is the first time Céline is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which will be used to raise the level of her business and increase her market share, which will allow her to make a larger income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and condiments for sauce

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr:
B. Joseph est un homme  de 36 ans, marié, née à Rubavu  un des districts de la province de l’Ouest du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a cinq enfants, le plus âgée a 14 ans et son cadet a 1 an. Un de ses enfants est en troisième année secondaire.
Il est motard c'est-à-dire chauffeur de taxi moto. Client d’ACB depuis janvier 2009, il sollicite un prêt qu’il a très bien remboursé. C’était pour acheter la moto pour taxi.il a contracte un autre nouveau crédit pour les pièces de réparation de ladite moto.son ambition et son souhait et que dans l’avenir et d’avoir deux moto, une à louer et l’autre qu’il utilise comme taxi. Les deux motos vont verser, une partie du revenu sera épargné et l’autre parti améliorera les conditions de vie de la famille en payant les frais de scolarités pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
B. Joseph is a 36-year-old married man, born in Rubavu, Western Province, Rwanda. He has an elementary-level education. He has five children, ranging in age from 1 to 14 years. One of the children is in the third year of secondary school. Mr. B. is a motorcycle taxi driver. A client of ACB since January 2009, he took out a loan to buy his motorcycle taxi, a loan which he fully repaid. He has taken out a second loan for motorcycle parts. His ambition and his desire is to have two motorcycles, one to rent and the other to use as a taxi. The two motorcycles will generate income; part of it will be saved, and the other part will improve his family's living conditions by financing his children's education.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplement the purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa M. est une couturière  qui exerce en même  temps l’activiste  de commerce. Elle est âgée  de 41 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse de Camberene depuis 2008. Elle a déjà  rembourse un prêt antérieur. Elle a une expérience  de plus de 10 ans dans la couture. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs qui sera destine a l’achat de tissus prévus  pour la confection de certaines commandes. Ce financement lui permettra d’élargir  ses activités et de maximiser ses gains.
texts.en:
Awa M. is a dressmaker who also runs a retail business. She is 41 years old and has been a member of the Camberene group fund since 2008. She has already repaid one previous loan. She has more than 10 years' worth of experience in the field of dressmaking. She is seeking a loan of 250,000 frs, which will be used to buy fabric intended to make several dresses that have been ordered. This loan will allow her to enlarge her business and maximize her earnings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stall in the Oriental Market.

loans.name: H. Antoinette

texts.fr: D. H. Antoinette est née le 23 Mars 1972 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mariée à LAWANI Arsel, un enseignant, Antoinette est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a près de quinze ans que Antoinette  vit au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette réside dans ce quartier avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux diverses charges de la famille. Antoinette n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire, mais a appris la couture. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Antoinette exerce cette activité. Mais de façon secondaire, Antoinette vend des tissus et divers autres produits (sucre, lait, biscuits, bombons, conserves, savons, papier hygiénique, etc.) devant son atelier de couture. Antoinette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Antoinette avait obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Antoinette désire agrandir davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Antoinette  sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
DOUCHE H. Antoinette was born March 23, 1972, in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé administrative district of Benin. Married to LAWANI Arsel, a teacher, Antoinette is the mother of one child, who is in school. For almost fifteen years she has lived with her husband and child in the Kpondéhou neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. The couple jointly pay the family's expenses. Antoinette did not go to school, but learned to sew, and she has been doing that for about fifteen years. As a secondary activity, Antoinette sells fabric and various other products (sugar, milk, cookies, candy, canned goods, soap, toilet paper, etc.) in front of her workshop. Antoinette buys her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. She has already received one loan from ALIDé and repaid it in full. She wants to expand her business and better satisfy her clientele, which is the reason she is seeking financial help from ALIDé a second time.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (sugar, milk, cookies, candy, canned goods, soap, toilet paper, etc)

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is a seamstress and also sells zips, thread and other sewing materials at Abura. Beatrice has no educational background.  She is married to a driver and they have three children. 

Beatrice has been sewing for some time now. She helps her husband in paying the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more sewing materials for making clothes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop in the marketplace where she can sew her clothing.

loans.use: buy more sewing materials to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Oretan

texts.en:
Madame Oretan A. sells cereals out of her home in Hedzranawoe, Lome. She is 30 years old and married to a man who works as a machinist at the local beer and soda factory in Lome. They have one child. 

Madame A. has been working in this business since 2005. She normally purchases her merchandise at markets in the northern Togo and has asked for a loan of 250,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs to help make her purchases. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase corn, rice, and beans

loans.name: Franklin Vicente

texts.es:
Frankiln de 50 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (perímetro periurbano, que tiene una ecología en disolución). Cuando era joven no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar y tuvo que trabajar en una zapatería, poco a poco aprendió y con sus ahorros decidió independizase y tener su propio negocio. 

Aunque al principio fue muy difícil el continuo con su pequeña zapaterías, arreglando zapatos, cosiéndolos y fabricándolos. Ahora toda su familia le ayuda en al zapatería, trabajan desde muy temprano. 

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo suelas, goma y moldes para los zapatos. En el futuro quiere tener otra zapatería para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Franklin, 50, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (an urban perimeter in ecological decline). When he was a young man he wasn’t able to study and had to work in a shoe shop. Gradually he learned the skills and decided to use his savings to set up his own business. Although it was very difficult at the beginning, he continued with his small shoe shop, repairing shoes, sewing them and manufacturing them. Now, his entire family helps out in the shop; they work from very early in the day. To continue with his business he needs funds to buy soles, glue and shoe forms for the shoes. In the future, he’d like to have an additional shoe shop for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For soles, glue, shoe forms.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años, es una madre  de familia muy trabajadora y noble, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de18 años teje chompas, siendo éstas exportadas al extranjero. Desde siempre teje y mas por las madrugada, horario en donde se concentra más para realizar los puntos y deja que su imaginación le ayude a elaborar lo mas hermosos diseños y formas. Después de una revisión acuciosa del tejido por parte de la empresa que compra su mercadería, es reconocida por el matiz y el acabado que tiene dichos tejidos. En esta silla cubierta de frazadas, como a vemos en la foto, se alista para empezar a tejer sin parar. Se siente a gusto con su labor, aunque últimamente tiene problemas visuales, es por ello que en adelante piensa retomar su venta de productos nutricionales, que los había dejado para tener ingresos adicionales a su economía. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas, puesto que sabe y valora lo beneficioso que es, y se siente contenta de trabajar  con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos nutricionales al por mayor, para que de ese modo amplíe su negocio y capte más rentas, pero sin dejar de elaborar prendas tejidas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and a mother of a very hard-working and dignified family. She lives with her husband and their three children in their own home. For more than 18 years she has knitted sweaters that are exported out of the country. She has been knitting her whole life and does it mostly during the early mornings, when she concentrates on making her stitches and lets her imagination help her make the most beautiful designs and forms. After a painstaking review by the company that purchases her merchandise, Rosa has been recognized for the hue and quality of her items. The chair covered with blankets in the photo is where Rosa knits nonstop. She enjoys her work, although lately she has had some problems with her eye sight, which is why in the future she plans to renew her business of selling nutritional products, which she had done to earn additional income. This is her ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She knows and values the benefits of these loans, and she enjoys working with her fellow members of her community bank. With the loan she is requesting, Rosa plans to purchase nutritional products at wholesale so she can expand her business and capture more revenue, but without giving up her knitting business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional products to earn additional income

loans.name: Christelle Mireille

texts.fr: J. Christelle Mireille est née le 15 Février 1970 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin. Mariée à KPADONOU Médard, Christelle Mireille est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Christelle Mireille vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Christelle Mireille vit dans ce quartier depuis huit ans. Le couple se partage les diverses charges familiales. Christelle Mireille a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. A côté de cette activité qu'elle exerce passionnément, Christelle Mireille vend également des mêches et des produits pour coiffure dans son atelier situé à Kpondéhou. Christelle Mireille s'approvisionne au Nigéria et à Lomé au Togo, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. Christelle Mireille exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans environs et a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Face à la clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Christelle Mireille désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et se faire plus de revenus, pour mieux épargner. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre crédit. Christelle Mireille désire plus tard acquérir sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
Christelle Mireille J. was born on February 15, 1970 in Parakou, in the Norht of Benin. She is married to Medard Kpadanou and is the mother of one child who attends school. Christelle Mireille lives with her family in the Kpondehou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living with in this district for eight years. The couple takes care of the family expenses jointly. Christelle Mireille left school at the secondary level, and later learned the hairdresser’s trade. In addition to practicing this trade, for which she has a passion, Christelle Mireille also sells hairpieces and accessories in her salon in Kopdehou. She stocks up in Nigeria and in Lome in Togo, the two countries neighboring Benin. Christelle Mireille has been in this line of business for about 15 years and had previous obtained a loan from ALIDé; the loan was duly repaid. Facing the growing increase in her customers' number, Christelle Mireille would like to increase the stock of her products in order to achieve a higher income and be better able to put aside some money as savings. This is what makes her seek another loan. At some future point, she would like to purchase her own land plot.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing hairpieces and hairdresser's supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise like: bags, umbrellas, knapsacks, slippers and shoes.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is married and sells foodstuffs and provisions at Abura. She has six dependents. She has no educational background. Aba responsibly helps her husband in taking care of the entire family. She will use the loan she anticipates to purchase more foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Aba plans to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Baye Ndaraw

texts.fr: Monsieur Baye Ndaraw B. est un jeune artiste peintre de 33 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene.  Il est membre de la caisse depuis novembre 2006 et n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt dans l’institution. Monsieur B. est en même  temps décorateur  de faux plafond. Il pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Il sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs pour l’investir dans son activité. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses gains financiers et de mieux subvenir a ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mr. Baye Ndaraw B. is a young painter, 33, who lives in the Camberene area of Dakar. He has been a member of the U-IMCEC since November 2006 and has never received a loan from the institution. Mr. Baye is also a dropped ceiling designer. He has been doing this for more than ten years. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to invest in his business. This financing will allow him to increase his financial gains and better meet his personal needs.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Essobio

texts.en: Mrs. Essobio A. lives and works in Lome where she sells charcoal. She works at the N'Kafu market. Mrs. A. is married to a mechanic and they have one child. She has been selling charcoal since 2005, though this is her first loan from WAGES. She has requested 400,000 CFA to ease the burden of purchasing more charcoal while providing for her family.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: H. Delphine est née le 02 Mai 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Delphine vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou. Delphine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais Delphine ne vit plus avec son mari. Delphine vit seule avec ses enfants. Mais Delphine apporte une aide financière à son mari en assurant avec lui les diverses charges des enfants. Delphine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Delphine prépare et vend du "Monyo" (akassa : fait à base d'amidon de maïs, accompagné de sauce aux poissons) à la devanture de sa maison. Delphine exerce cette activité depuis six ans environs et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Delphine s'approvisonne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle, Delphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit qui lui servira à augmenter le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
H. Delphine was born on May 2, 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Since birth, she has been living in the Sègbèya district in Cotonou and is the mother of three children who are all in school.  Delphine no longer lives with her husband.  She lives alone with her children.  But she helps out her husband financially while she and her husband ensure that the different expenses for the children are covered.  Delphine did not attend school very much.  To support herself, she makes and sell "Monyo" (akassa:  made with corn starch) at the entrance to her house.  She has been in this business for about six years and has already had five loans from ALIDé that she repaid.  She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  For purposes of increasing her working capital and satisfying further the strong demand from her customers, Delphine is requesting another loan from ALIDé that will be used to increase her stock of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn, some fish, and condiments

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Lorenzo De la Ciudad De Caaguazú, donde cada integrante realiza una actividad dependiendo de la facilidad con que cuentan.
La señora Zulma quien es la presidenta del  grupo es una mujer muy activa y realiza varias actividades para ayudar a su comunidad y a su familia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas en un salon que ella posee en su casa, en el salon atiende su hija mientras ella realiza otras actividades.
Doña Zulma alienta a todas sus amigas a trabajar y salir adelante y al mismo tiempo aprovechar la oportunidad del credito para comenzar con algun trabajo que pueda ayudar  a su familia.
Ella solicita  el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su roperia especialmente para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
This committee organized itself in Caaguazú’s San Lorenzo neighborhood; each group member is involved in a different activity according to her means. Zulma, who is the group leader, is a very active woman who’s involved in a variety of activities to help her community and her family. She sells clothes in a room she has in her home for this purpose; her daughter tends to the store while Zulma is busy doing other things. Zulma encourages all her friends to work and get ahead and she uses the opportunity provided by the loan to start some work that will benefit her family. She is asking for funds to buy stock items for her store, especially winter items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets, sweatshirts, sweaters, jeans and other clothing items.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 50 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y de buen carácter, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace mas de 15 años, se dedica en la confección de polos, buzos, casacas y demás prendas de vestir. Su taller es un espacio pequeño que tiene y es apropiado para confeccionar, mientras que los trazos lo realiza en otro ambiente de su casa. Las prendas que más confecciona son para niños y niñas; puesto que sus compradores le solicitan estas prendas. Anteriormente trabajaba sola, pero ahora la demanda continua de su trabajo no le da abasto, es así que su sobrina la apoya en el trabajo y así lograr entregar a tiempo los pedidos que tiene pendiente. María esta muy contenta con su labor, además tiene la facilidad de realizarlo dentro de su casa, sin descuidar el bienestar de su familia, sólo que, para remallar los polos tiene que salir a una empresa que le haga ese trabajo. En adelante piensa equiparse con esta maquina remalladora. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que éste aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversas telas, hilos cierres y demás accesorios de costura, para que continúe cosiendo sus habituales prendas.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old. She is a working mother and good-natured. She lives in her own house with her husband and their 2 children. She has worked making t-shirts, sweatshirts, jackets and other clothing articles. Her workshop is a small space she has and which is appropriate for sewing, while she does the decorating in another part of her house. She makes mostly children’s clothing since her customers ask for these. Previously she work alone but now she can’t keep up with the continuous demand for her work. That is why her niece helps her with the work and this way she can deliver the pending orders on time. María is very happy with her job and on top of it she can do it at home without neglecting her family’s well being. She only has to go to a company to get the t-shirts darned. She plans on getting a darning machine in the future. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows this contribution will be very beneficial in increasing her working capital. That’s why she is committed to paying all her payments. She will buy different cloth, thread and other sewing accessories with the loan she is applying for so she can continue to sew clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase different cloth, thread and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en:
Constantine is a 58-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married and his wife is not employed or in business. He is a father to seven children, a number very common in the rural areas of the country and they live in a semi-permanent house but he hopes to construct a permanent house and also educate his children. 

Constantine is in cocoa buying and selling as his business and has been in it for seven years though he says sometimes prices for the cash crop fluctuate, thus affecting his cash flow. He also plans to open up a retail shop in future to increase his avenues for income. He intends to use the loan funds to buy cocoa from farmers for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing cocoa for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: Doña Cristina  tiene 46 años de edad, casada de oficios Domésticos, tiene 5 hijos y tres únicamente viven con ella, se dedica a Bordar Güipiles a mano, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia. Con otras once señoras entusiastas conforman el  Banco Comunal llamado EMMANUEL, el préstamo recibido lo invertirá como capital de trabajo adquiriendo  materia prima, ya que con este tipo de negocio se necesita de una buena inversión para poder surtir colores en cada Güipil. El mismo ayudara a poder incrementar la demanda y su mayor anhelo es tener empleados y expandir su producto en el mercado guatemalteco.
texts.en:
Cristina is 46 years old, married, and a stay-at-home mother. She has five children, three of whom live with her. She works hand-embroidering güipiles (a type of poncho), and has 15 years experience of doing this. She formed the community bank called "Emmanuel" along with 11 other enthusiastic women. The received loan will be used for business capital to acquire raw materials as, in this type of business, you need good investment to be able to stock all the colors used in each güipil (poncho). This will also help to increase demand and her greatest desire is to have employees and expand her sales in the Guatemalan market.

Translated from Spanish by AliS. Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba A. sells kitchen equipment such as knives, perforated spoons, strainers, cups and others by moving from one area to the other in and around Abura. Araba has no formal education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver and she has been in this business for about three years. She assists her husband in supporting the household. 

Her loan which is going to serve as additional capital will be used to buy extra kitchen equipment to resell. She hopes to reinvest back into her business, should there be any increase in income.

loans.use: buy extra kitchen equipment to resell

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura S. de 32 años de edad esta acompañada desde hace 16 años con el sr. Edgar Zena, la pareja cuenta con dos hijas de 15 y 16 años, la primera está cursando el 9no. Grado y la otra está en la 1ra. de la media.
La señora Laura se dedica a la venta de ropas nuevas y usadas desde hace 4 años, tiene su puesto de trabajo dentro del mercado municipal de Caaguazú y cuenta con clientela formada. 
Mediante eso esta creciendo y ampliando su negocio, su pareja es transportista y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos familiares y asi poder ofrecerle a los hijos un bienestar mejor, que sigan con sus estudios y que puedan estudiar carrera superiores.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de abrigos en general, championes, pantalones para ambos sexo, medias, guantes  , y con eso cumplir con su clientelas.
texts.en:
Señora Laura S. is 32 years old has been married to Sr. Edgar Zena for 16 years. The couple has 2 daughters that are 15 and 16 years old. The first is in the 9th grade and the other is in her first year of secondary school. Señora Laura has been selling new and used clothes for 4 years now. She has a spot in the Caaguazú city market and has steady customers. Because of this her business is growing and expanding. Her husband is in the transportation business and they both contribute to the household expenses so that they can give their children a better life. This way their daughters can continue their studies and they can study to have high ranking careers. She is requesting a loan to buy coats, athletic shoes, pants for men and women, hosiery and gloves so that she can satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter coats, pants, jackets gloves for her business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba R. sews dresses at Abura.  Araba has received junior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a prison officer. 

Araba has been sewing for five years. She responsibly helps her husband in providing the basic needs of the family such as food, clothing, and shelter. Her loan will be used to buy cloth for sale and sewing materials to aid her in sewing some clothes to display for sale in front of her shop. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy cloth for sale and sewing materials

loans.name: Pepertual

texts.en: Pepertual A. moves around in Abura to sell jewelry and children’s panties.  Pepertual has been educated up to the senior high level.  She is a widow living with her two children. With the income she makes from her sales, she takes care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra items and a variety of jewelry for sale. She wishes to use the new revenue from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy extra items and a variety of jewelry for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. operates a provisions shop at Abura.  Agnes has received senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Agnes has been in this business for five years. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the fresh profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 40-year-old man, married with seven children. He is the head of a family of eight people and they live in a house Hassan has managed to construct through his hard work. 

Hassan deals in cutting timber and also has a grinding mill for maize and cassava. He has been in the timber-cutting business for the last 15 years and he says so far, so good despite high transport costs. Like many people in his area, Hassan also wants to establish a retail shop to supplement his income. The purpose of the loan is to buy a power saw for his timber-cutting business.

loans.use: Buying a power saw for cutting timber

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Luis de la Ciudad de Caaguazú,  se conformó mediante el deseo de los integrantes de formar un grupo solidario para trabajar por el bien comun de todas.
Una de la integrantes es la señora Emiliana quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella con su marido construyeron una casilla frente a su casa para exponer los productos con que cuentan. 
Muchas de las frutas que ella ofrece son de produccion de las demas integrantes y de su produccion tambien.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de frutas y verduras para la exposicion y venta en su casilla.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the San Luis neighborhood, located in the city of Caaguazú. It was born out of the desire of it's members to establish a communal bank to work for the common good of all. One of it’s members is Emiliana, who sells fruit and vegetables. She and her husband built a stand in front of their home to display the goods they sell. Much of the fruit she sells was cultivated by her personally, as well as by other group members. Emiliana is requesting the loan in order to purchase fruits and vegetables to be sold at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
In the small township of Bundibugyo, Uganda lives a young man who goes by the name of Bonny. He is 25 years old, married with one child aged one year. He is the breadwinner for his small and young family. Like many Ugandans, he dreams of seeing his children educated to university level. 

Bonny operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the last two years having first been involved in the motorcycle transport business. He also wants to transform his small shop into a wholesale one in the future. This is Bonny’s first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to purchase cell phone air time, soap, and boxes of biscuits to sell.

loans.use: Purchase air time, soap, boxes of biscuits to sell

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es: Angelina cuenta con treinta y seis años de edad, tiene seis hijos. Actualmente trabaja como operaria confeccionando delantales típicos. Ella tiene el anhelo de iniciar un negocio propio el cual por falta de capital no ha podido realizarlo.  En su comunidad con otras vecinas organizan un grupo para poder solicitar financiamiento el cual es integrado por once señoras y se llama LOS PINOS, y así podrá comprar una máquina de coser y materia prima, para poder empezar. Lo que espera de su  negocio propio es contar con capital suficiente y darle estudio a cada uno de sus hijos  y superar junto al grupo que forma.
texts.en:
Angelina, 36, has six children. She works making traditional aprons. She wishes to start her own business but has not been able to due to lack of capital. She and other neighbors in her community form a group to raise funding comprised of eleven women called Los Pinos. As such, Angelina will be able to buy a sewing machine and raw materials so that she can begin her business. What she wishes to gain from her own business is enough money to allow each of her children to study and to succeed along with her group.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Machinery

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl G. de 40 años de edad, es separado, el tienen a su cargo 2 hijas que están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
 Don Raúl se inició en este rubro aproximadamente en el año 2.008; con el capital que adquirió con la venta de un automovil, dicho dinero lo invirtió en compra de artículos deportivos como: remeras, pantaloncitos, rodilleras, busos, y diferentes tipos de championes;  en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada.
   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (remeras, pantaloncitos, rodilleras, buzos, y championes); teniendo en cuenta que  en esta temporada tiene muchas ventas.
texts.en:
Raúl, 40, is separated and cares for his two daughters who are attending secondary school. Raúl began selling clothes around 2008 with the capital that he acquired through a car sale. He invested this money in the purchase of sporting goods such as t-shirts, shorts, kneepads, track suits and different types of sneakers, all the while developing a customer base. Raúl will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise (t-shirts, shorts, kneepads, track suits and sneakers) keeping in mind that he does a lot of sales in this season.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise (sporting goods and clothes)

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: El Señor Benito M. es un hombre trabajador que se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y quiere darle a su esposa e hijos una mejor calidad de vida, poco a poco le ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda, la cual es de interés social, El Señor Benito necesita este préstamo para colocar un techo en la parte frontal de su vivienda, para que sus pequeños hijos por salud  no se expongan al fuerte sol cuando estén jugando afuera de la casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Benito M. is a hardworking gentleman who is concerned about the welfare of his family. He wants to provide his wife and children a better quality of life. Over time, he was able to make improvements to his house that was acquired with the help of government subsidies.

Sr. Benito needs a loan to install a roof over the front part of his home for the sake of his young children’s health. He does not want them to be exposed to the heat of the sun while playing outdoors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a roof over the front part of his house

loans.name: Tomasa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Tomasa C. de 38 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Anibal Rojas de 37 años de edad, ellos tienen 4 hijos que estan cursando sus estudios secundarios.
   Doña Tomasa se inició en este rubro aproximadamente en el año 1.995; con el capital que juntaron con el sueldo que percibe mes a mes su cónyuge, después de varios años decidieron abrir para su propio negocio de fabrica de remeras, buzos, etc, atendiendo que el señor tenía ya años de experiencia en este rubro porque estaba trabajando en una de las  empresas más grandes del país fabricando ropas. 
En la actualidad en su negocio ya tiene muchos contactos y clientela formada.
   Ella invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (telas, sierres, hilos, etc) teniendo en cuenta los pedidos que acarrea esta temporada de frio.
texts.en:
Sra. Tomasa C. is 38 years old and married to Sr. Anibal Rojas, who is 37 years of age. They have four children who are enrolled in high school.

Doña Tomasa started sewing in 1995 with capital accumulated from her husband’s monthly salary. After several years, she decided to open her own business making T-shirts, sweatshirts, and other items since her husband has years of experience working for one the largest clothing manufacturers in the country. Her business currently has several contracts and an established customer base.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of more sewing supplies (fabrics, zippers, thread, etc.) to account for the orders she has received for this winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, thread, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Alfonso R. trabaja en una maquiladora como obrero, y pasa la mayor parte del día trabajando para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, su esposa se queda al cuidado de sus hijos en el hogar, al Señor Alfonso le preocupa mucho la seguridad de su familia, ya que su vivienda no cuenta con  ninguna protección en la parte frontal de su vivienda, es por eso que necesita este prestamos para colocar una barda y sentirse mas seguro el y su  familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfonso R. is a factory worker who spends most of his day working so that he can give his family a better quality of life. His wife stays home to look after their children.
