Sr. Alfonso is greatly concerned about the security of his family since there is not any protection in front of his home. For this reason, he needs this loan to put up a fence so that he and his family feel more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put up a fence in front of his house

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Señor  Blas G., tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero.

Para poder comenzar con esta actividad, en el 2007, recibió la ayuda de su madre, quien como muchos paraguayos trabaja en España y le envió el dinero para la compra del negocio, que ya estaba establecido y era propiedad de su primo quien le vendió en forma completa.

El negocio tiene mucho éxito, porque ofrece la mayor variedad de repuestos, y además posee un taller en donde realiza el cambio de los repuestos.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de repuestos de mayor demanda, como ser fibras de frenos, cabos de embragues y frenos, corona, cadena, piñón, amortiguadores, etc.

El deseo del Señor Blas es ampliar su sección taller, para ofrecer un mejor y más completo servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Blas G. is 24 years old and single. He started this venture in 2007 when he received assistance from his mother who, like many Paraguayans, works in Spain and sent him the money to buy a business and take full ownership of it from his cousin.

His business has been very successful because he offers a wide variety of spare parts. He also has a workshop where he can change parts on-site.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy parts that are in great demand such as brake pads, clutch and brake cables, plates, chains, sprockets, shock absorbers, etc. Blas wants to expand a section of his workshop so that he can offer better and more complete service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various motorcycle parts

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es: El Señor Sabas B. es un hombre muy trabajador y perseverante el es el sustento de su familia, cuenta con una tortillería y sale a trabajar desde muy temprano todos los días  para repartir los pedidos de tortillas que le hacen sus clientes, El Señor Sabas esta preocupado por la seguridad de su familia por eso tiene la necesidad de pedir este préstamo ya que la casa que avita  no cuenta con ventanas ni protecciones, la mayor preocupación del señor es cuando el tiene que salir a trabajar y dejar a su esposa e hijos solos. En la fotografia se aprecia al Señor Sabas con su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Sabas B. is a hardworking gentleman who perseveres as the breadwinner of his family. He works for a tortilla factory and leaves early for his job every morning so that he can make tortilla deliveries to his customers. Sr. Sabas is concerned about the security of his family, so he is requesting this loan because his house does not have windows to protect them. His greatest worry is leaving his wife and children alone while he is at work. In the photograph, Sr. Sabas appears with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install windows in his home

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina es oriunda de la ciudad de  Ybycuí, actualmente reside en la compañía la Cñía Zanjita de Acahay, es una madre soltera con una hija, la hija tiene 16 años, está siguiendo sus estudios en la ciudad de Ybycui.

         Desde temprana edad la señora Cristina viajó hacia la capital en busca de mejoras, encontró trabajo y se quedo allí , con todo lo que ha ahorrado regresó a su ciudad natal con el fin de montar una despensa.
       Lo hizo y tuvo un excelente resultado, pero ahí surgió un problema, la cual era que la cantidad de mercadería que poseía no le abastecía completamente a sus clientes. 
 
         En busca de ampliar su negocio y en consecuencia sus ganancias se acercó a nuestras oficinas con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías como fideos, arroz, aceite, carne, panificados, embutidos, lácteos, y agradece a la fundación el crédito otorgado ya que con eso pudo cargar nuevas mercaderías a su stock y a la vez lograr la satisfacción en las personas que se van a comprar allí.
texts.en:
Sra. María Cristina is a native of the city of Ybycuí, but she currently lives in the neighborhood of Cñía Zanjita de Acahay. She is a single mother of a 16 year old daughter who is continuing her studies in the city of Ybycuí.

At an early age, Sra. Cristina traveled to the capital in search of a better life. She found a job and ended up staying there. After all that, she saved enough money so that she could return to her hometown and open a food pantry. Her business experienced excellent results, but she faced one problem – she did not have enough merchandise to completely meet the demand of her customers.

In order to expand her business and increase her profits, Cristina came to the offices of Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan so that she could buy merchandise such as noodles, rice, oil, meat, baked goods, sausages, and dairy products. She is thankful for the loan that has been provided because she will be able to add new products to her inventory and satisfy everyone who comes to her business to shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, oil, meat, baked goods, sausages, and dairy products

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL UNION POR EL PROGRESO

L. Alcancía Comunal “UNION POR EL PROGRESO” cursa el ciclo 7 demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Ceci es una socia entusiasta y alegre que convoco a sus amigos hace varios años, todos son socios comprometidos ya que se dedican a diferentes giros D. negocios informales y estos les  permiten atender las necesidades básicas D. sus familias. Ceci se dedica a L. venta D. jugos tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado en L. zona alta D. Huaycan, ElL. tiene un pequeño hijo por el cual debe D. trabajar, su objetivo es poder brindarle una buena educación  además le sueña con estudiar, para poder desempeñarse en otras actividades. El grupo agradece los préstamos a KIVA y EDAPROSPO.
texts.en:
Union por el Progreso Communal Bank The Union por el Progreso Communal Bank is in its seventh cycle, and they are demonstrating punctuality and responsibility with their payments. Ceci is an enthusiastic and happy member who organized her friends several years ago. They are all committed members. They devote themselves to different lines of informal businesses, which allow them to see to their families’ basic necessities. Ceci sells juice. She has a small stand in a market in the high zone of Huaycan. She has a small son for whom she needs to work. Her objective is to be able to give him a good education. Also, she dreams of going to school to be able to do other activities. The group is grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité  Virgen de Fatima está integrada por mujeres del barrio Santa Rosa de la zona urbana de la ciudad de Ybycuí, departamento de Paraguarí, está compuesta  por 15 miembros  entre ellas se encuentran mujeres quienes tienen actividades  como , ventas de remedio naturales, comidas , frutas, carne de cerdo, ropas usadas y otras  se dedican a la ventas de lencerías; entre ellas también existen  mujeres  quienes desean emprender otras actividades ya que todas son  de escaso recursos.
          El comité demostró la intención de trabajar  para salir adelante,  se han comprometido en ser solidarias  y responsables ante las situaciones que se puedan presentar. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Francisca quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ya el consumo de los mismos es bastante alto especialmente en las épocas de invierno.
Primeramente ella realiza la compra de los remedios en bolsas de 20 kg. Luego lo empaqueta en bolsitas más pequeñas para venderlo.
Sus productos ella los ofrece en varios negocios de la zona así ella consigue un ingreso periódico para ayudar a su familia,
Solicita el crédito para la compra de varias bolsas de remedios naturales.
texts.en:
The Virgin of Fatima Committee consists of women from the urban neighborhood of Santa Rosa in the city of Ybycuí, department of Paraguarí. This group consists of 15 members. These women have businesses selling natural remedies, food, fruit, pork, used clothing, and lingerie. The group also includes women who want to pursue other business activities since they all have limited resources.

The Committee members have demonstrated their intention to work in order to get ahead. They have promised to cooperate with one another and be responsible in all situations that are presented before them.

One of the members is Sra. Francisca, who sells natural remedies. The consumption of these products is especially high during the winter season. In order to sell these remedies, she must first purchase them in 20kg bags and then package them in much smaller bags before making them available to her customers. Her products are sold to different businesses in the area and generate a regular income to help support her family. Francisca is requesting a loan to buy bags of different natural remedies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural remedies in 20kg bags

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La   Sra. Brigida F. de Zaracho  es de San Estanislao, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos  y tiene casa propia.
 
           La Señora es propietaria de  una despensa que funciona en su domicilio,  con clientela formada, tiene buenos ingresos, y buenas referencias comerciales y personales, hace un tiempo que también realiza repartos de mercaderías  en su vehículo con su hijo.
           Su marido se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 10 has de tierra en donde tiene sus cultivos diversos y también animales vacunos.
            Este crédito utilizó para la compra de maderas y chapas para construcción de un galpón para su deposito de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Sra. Brigida F. de Zaracho is from San Estanislao. She is 46 years old, married, has four children, and lives in her own home.

Brigida is the owner of a food pantry that she operates out of her home. She has an established customer base, earns good income, and has excellent business and personal references. In addition, she makes deliveries with her son using her vehicle. Her husband is a farmer and has ten hectares of land on which he grows different crops and raises cattle.

This loan will be used to buy lumber and boards in order to build a storage shed for keeping her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lumber & boards to build a storage shed for her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 47 años, comparte su vida con su pareja y sus dos hijos, Joel de 17 años y Jaquelin  de 14 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 1 año se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, negocio al cual incursionó gracias al consejo de sus amigas, quienes frecuentemente le comentaban las buenas ganancias que obtenían con esta labor. Es así que Gladys decidió trabajar en este rubro, logrando obtener experiencia, además sus amigas y vecinas continuamente le hacen variados pedidos de sus productos, por lo que espera tener muchas ganancias. Por otra parte, también se dedica al tejido a mano de prendas de vestir como: ropa de bebe, chalinas guantes, entre otros, generándole un ingreso extra a su economía. En un futuro desea instalar otro negocio, como una librería y bazar a la vez, pero dentro de su propia casa, pues cree que es un negocio fijo y mucho más rentable y seguro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizo por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar variados productos de belleza, para que pueda tener en stock.
texts.en:
Gladys is 47 years old. She shares her life with her husband and two children, Joel 17 years old and Jaquelin 14 years old. They live together in their own house. She has been selling beauty products for more than 1 year, a business she got into thanks to the advice of her friends. They often mentioned the good earnings they got from this job. That is how Gladys decided to work at this trade and got experience. Her friends and neighbors continually give her orders for her products that she hopes to earn a lot from. On the other hand, she also works hand knitting clothing, baby clothes and gloves among other things, to generate additional earnings. She would like to start another business in the future, like a bookstore and shop together but inside her own house. She thinks it is a more stable business and more profitable and safer. This is her first loan with MFP. She has always been known to be responsible with her payments. She would like to buy varied beauty products to have in stock with the loan she is applying for.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase varied beauty products.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a single mother of five children all of school-going age. At 37 years of age, Topista is the head of her family and is responsible for the welfare and education of her children. She currently lives in a rented house in Bundibugyo, Uganda and she sells cocoa, beans, and rice as her business activity for income generation. 

Topista has been in this business for six years having been a pure farmer before. She says she hopes to open up a retail shop in the future to increase her sources of income and to keep the needs of her family like education and construction of her own family home in sight. Topista intends to use the loan funds to purchase cocoa for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing cocoa for resale at her stall

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "LAS MARAVILLAS"
 
Gregoria es una socia que con muchos años D. esfuerzo consiguió un lugar donD. vivir, primero trabajo en un M. mayorista D. frutas donD. revendía frutas para obtener algunas ganancia, esto le costaba mucho trabajo pero tenía que hacerlo para alimentar a sus hijos, luego consiguió un puesto en un M. D. huaycan en forma ambulante, ahora se dedica al rubro D. verduras esto la ayudo a poder comprar algunos artefactos  para su casa, actualmente colabora con un comedor popular en la zona Q D. Huaycan  y es solidaria con sus compañeras. 
Otra D. nuestras socias es Gina ella tiene hijos pequeños, que aun necesitan cuidado, asi que consiguio la concesion D. un pequeño cafetin D. un colegio en huaycan y esto le le permite obtener ganancias. Su esposo es albañil asi que tambien contribuye con los gastos. Gina desea arreglar su casa ese fue uno D. los motivos por los cuales ingresa a la Alcancia Comunal. La Alcancía Comunal Las Maravillas cuenta con socios responsables que se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas, son participativos y personas D. bien, mes a mes lo demuestran realizando sus pagos oportunamente.
texts.en:
COMMUNAL GROUP “LAS MARAVILLAS” Gregoria is a member that found a place to live through many years of effort. She first worked at a wholesale fruit market where she resold fruit to earn something. This was a lot of work for her but she needed to do it in order to feed her children. Then she got a stall in the Huaycan market as a street vendor. Now she works selling vegetables. This has helped her buy household articles. She currently helps at a public lunchroom in zone Q in Huaycan and she is sympathetic to her co-workers. Gina is another member. She has small children that still need care. Therefore she got the license for a small cafeteria in a school in Huaycan and this allows her to make an income. Her husband is a mason worker and her also helps with expenses. Gina would like to fix her house. That is one of the reasons she joined the Communal group. The Communal Group Las Maravillas has responsible members that work at different economic activities. They are good people who participate and show it month by month by paying their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE GOODS AND PRODUCTS

loans.name: Sady Mabel

texts.es:
La solicitante es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, esta casada y tiene casa propia.
Es propietaria de una despensa que tiene en su casa, tiene 4 hijos todos en edad escolar.
La señora es una persona muy trabajadora responsable, y honesta. Nos comento que empezo a vender mandioca y carbón en una carretilla por la ciudad de Santani, y que siempre soñaba con tener una despensa bien surtida, por ahora su mayor deseo es aumentar sus ventas diarias y surtir con mercaderías su negocio.
Para eso esta solicita un credito para su capital operativo, es decir desea comprar carne, harina, azucar, arroz, fidoes, aceite, ya que carece de suficientes recurso económico.
texts.en:
Sady is from the city of San Estanislao. She is married and has her own home. Sady manages a store in her home and has four children, all of whom attend school.

She is a hardworking, responsible, and honest person. Sady says she began selling cassava and charcoal from a wheelbarrow in the city of Santani and had always dreamed of having a well-stocked store, but now her greatest wish is to increase her daily sales and restock her business with more merchandise.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to use as operating capital. Sady says she wants to buy meat, flour, sugar, rice, noodles, and oil because she lacks sufficient financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, flour, sugar, rice, noodles, oil, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba D. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Samba 15ans 1 depuis le 19 juillet 2002 et a reçu 15 fois de suite des crédits qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse de chaussures et de tissus. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'aller à la capitale, Dakar, et acheter ces produits pour les revendre dans son quartier et les villages environnants. l'objet de son crédit est de promouvoir son activité de vente de chaussures et de de tissus et son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de sa famille tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Diénaba D. is a 51-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Samba 15ans 1 since July 19, 2002 and has received fifteen consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid without difficulty.  Diénaba is a seller of shoes and cloth.  Her new loan will enable her to go to the capital, Dakar, and buy these goods to resell in her district and the surrounding villages.  The purpose of her loan is to advance her business selling shoes and cloth.  And her goal is to take part in meeting the needs of her family while increasing her savings. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and reselling shoes and cloth

loans.name: Alfa Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LILIANA TIEN 41 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES Y UNO MAYOR D. EDAD, UNIVERSITARIO. HACE DOS AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO "ALFA" JUNTO 8 PERSONAS MAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON RECIENTEMENTE COMO PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. LILIANA SE DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO D. PREPARACIÓN D. ARREGLOS FLORALES TANTO NATURALES COMO ARTIFICIALES, TRABAJA A BASE D. PEDIDOS, ANTERIORMENTE ALQUILABA UN LOCAL PERO AL ENFERMARSE SU HIJA MENOR D. ASMA TUVO QUE TRASLADARSE A SU CASA PARA PODER TRABAJAR Y AL MISMO TIEMPO CUIDAR D. SU HIJA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYA A SU PAREJA CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES Y SOBRETODO AYUDRA A SU HIJA EN SUS ESTUDIOS.
SU PROXIMA META A LOGRAR ES APERTURAR UNA TIENDA EN UNA ZONA MUCHO MAS COMERCIAL.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES PARA LA PREPARACIÓN D. SUS ARREGLOS FLORALES.
texts.en:
Liliana is 41 years old and has 2 minor children and 1 who is adult, a university student. Two years ago the Alfa Group was formed with 8 people who lived in the Carabayllo district. Liliana's companions recently elected her president of the group's directive committee. Liliana dedicates herself to her natural and artificial flower-arranging business. She works on the basis of orders. Previously, she rented a stand but when her minor child contracted asthma, Liliana had to move the business to her house, to be able to work and take care of her daughter. Liliana's work has enabled her to contribute, along with her husband, to paying family expenses, and above all, to help her daughter in her studies. Liliana's next goal is to be able to open a store in a much more commercial zone. The requested loan will be invested in purchasing supplies and materials for preparing her flower arrangements.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS TO PREPARE HER FLOWER ARRANGEMENTS

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, comparte su vida con sus hijos Geraldine de 18 años y Luis Ángel de 4 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Gracias a sus habilidades y gran creatividad, desde hace cuatro años se dedica en la elaboración de collares, pulseras, que son elaboradas a base a semillas de plantas. Desde entonces elabora todos los días estas artesanías en cantidad, pues deben ser exportados a Bolivia, país vecino que de donde le hacen mucho pedidos. Gracias a su gran carisma y espontaneidad, María tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por tal motivo desea instalar un negocio más estable, pero aún no tiene suficiente capital para concretar sus objetivos. Por el momento desea dedicarse íntegramente a continuar elaborando objetos artesanales. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP siendo siempre muy puntual con todos sus pagos. 
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas, material que necesita constantemente, pues se le acaban rápidamente al realizar sus objetos artesanales.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and shares her life with her children, Geraldine (age 18) and Luis Ángel (age 4). They live together in their own home. Thanks to her skills and creativity, she started making necklaces and bracelets made of plant seeds four years ago. Since then, she has spent every day making these crafts in mass quantity. Her products are exported to Bolivia, a neighboring country from where she receives many orders. Thanks to her charismatic and spontaneous personality, María has been able obtain a large number of customers. For this reason, she wants to establish a more stable business, but she does not have enough capital to achieve her goals. At the moment, she wants to devote all of her time to making her handcrafted objects.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. María has been prompt with all of her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more seeds. She is in constant need of these materials since she quickly runs out of them when making her crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for making handicrafts

loans.name: Clely Esteher

texts.es:
doña Clely F. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca, Clely se dedica a la venta de golosinas enfrente de una empresa empacadora de camarones. Clely es bien trabajadora, se lavanta todos los dias a las 4 de la mañana para preparar sus comidas y luego llevarla a vender, ademas  en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la crianza de gallinas en su casa de habitacion.  
Tiene una hija  que es la que le ayuda a preparar las comidas.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para fabricar sus golosinas ya que las ventas estan muy buenas y se queda rapido sin comida. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Clely F. is 50 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Las Arenas in the city of Choluteca. She sells sweets in front of a shrimp packing company. Clely is a good worker. She wakes up every day at 4am to prepare the foods that she will sell. During her free time, she raises chickens at home. Clely has a daughter who helps her with preparing food.

This loan will be used to buy more ingredients for making sweets. Her sales have been very good and she stays away from offering fast food. The income she generates is needed to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en:
Jamali is a 30-year-old man living in the small town of Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married with four children aged 11, 10, 8, and 4 years. His wife sells chapatti and together they look after a family of nine people, an extended family typical of the African setting. 

Jamali operates a small food centre which he calls a restaurant and also has a motorcycle business as he has done for 11 years now. He dreams of constructing a bigger house to accommodate his family in a comfortable way. This is Jamali’s first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to use it to buy rice for use in his restaurant business.

loans.use: Purchasing rice for use in his restaurant business.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
El señor Hermogenes A. es de Bº Navidad, es soltero con casa propia, tiene 51 años de edad, y tiene una hija.  

 Se dedica a la venta de articulos de mercerias en general y tambien articulos farmaceuticos, cuenta con una motocicleta en el cual se desplaza para realizar las ventas por todas las zonas aledañas.

  

  Solicita el credito para la compra de articulos de merceria como medias, guantes, maquillajes en general, accesorios para criaturas, juguetes, y ademas vende remedios naturales.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermogenes A. is from Bº Navidad. He is 51 years old, single, lives in his own home, and has a daughter.

Hermogenes sells haberdashery items as well as pharmaceutical products. He has a motorcycle which he uses to travel to all of the neighboring areas to make his sales. Hermogenes is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as socks, gloves, make-up, baby accessories, toys, and natural remedies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & natural remedies to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos O. A. tiene 34 años de edad y vive en el barrio Florida de la ciudad de Tarija. Juan aun no se caso y vive en casa de su madre, Juan  desde hace mas de 5 años que se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros y es socio del  sindicato de taxi trufis el Chapaco.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                   Juan quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos, el nos cuenta que la casa donde vive es de adobe, construcción que es muy antigua y quisiera construir algunas habitaciones donde puedan vivir cómodos sus hermanos y su madre. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo, para de ese modo seguir trabajando con su taxi.  
              
Juan nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus hermanos y su madre. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para la compra de otra movilidad de esa forma poder mejorar las condiciones  económicas en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos O. A. is 34 years old and lives in the Florida neighborhood of the city of Tarija. He is still not married and lives at his mother’s house. For more than five years, Juan has been providing passenger transport services and is a member of the Chapaco taxi drivers union.

Juan wants to start a family, have children, and see future grandchildren. He says he lives in an adobe house that was constructed a long time ago, so he wants to build additional rooms so that his siblings and his mother will be more comfortable.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy spare parts for his vehicle so that he can continue working as a taxi driver. Juan says that his greatest wish is to provide all the comforts for his siblings and his mother. In addition, he indicates that the next loan he requests will be used to buy another vehicle so that he can improve the financial conditions of his household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: En la comarca las mariitas sector el espino, municipio de somotillo, el señor Carlos José V., es uno de los muchos productores agropecuarios de la zona, este señor se dedica al desarrollo de actividades tanto agrícolas  como pecuarias dentro de las cuales destaca un sin numero de rubros los que constituyen su base económica y a su vez también parte de su seguridad alimentaria para su familia, la que se compone de 5 hijos, de los cuales solo tiene una niña de 16 años de edad y el resto son varones de 4 a 12 años de edad respectivamente, este señor junto a su esposo y estos pequeños realizan el establecimiento de sus cultivos dentro de los que se destacan Maíz, Sorgo, Ajonjolí, frijoles entre otros, también rubros pecuarios como la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, aviar y caprino los que son la base fundamental para la mantención de su familia. Este señor solicita un crédito para comprarse una manzana más de terreno para poder proveer mejores condiciones a su hato ganadero, con el que pretende mejorar la situación alimentaria de su ganado.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of El Espino in the town of Somotillo, Las Mariitas region, Sr. Carlos José V. is one of many agricultural producers in the area. He engages in various farming activities that form the financial base on which he can support and feed his family. Carlos has five children, which includes a 16 year old daughter and four sons between the ages of 4 and 12 respectively. With the help of his wife and children, Carlos grows crops such as corn, sorghum, sesame, beans, and other items. He also raises cows, pigs, chickens, and goats to support his family.

Carlos is requesting a loan in order to buy additional land that measures 1mz (approximately 1.74 acres) for his herd of cattle in hopes of improving feeding conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional land for his cattle to graze

loans.name: Maoundé

texts.fr: Maoundé S. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOOULATA depuis le 26 avril 2008 et y a reçu 04 prêts qui lui ont permis de développer une activité de petit commerce de savon et des détergents pour la lessive. Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra renforcer son capital d'investissement et acheter plus de savons d'eau de javel et d'autres détergents. Elle achète la marchandise en gros et le revend au détail dans son quartier. Les bénéfices que génère son activité lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Maoundé S. is a 29-year-old married woman with four children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sinthiang Hooulata since April 26, 2008, and has received four loans which have allowed her to develop a small business selling soap and laundry detergents. With her new credit she will have more capital to invest and will be able to buy more bleach, soaps and other detergents. She buys the products in bulk and re-sells them on a retail basis in her neighborhood. The profits from her business allow her to help improve living conditions for her family and ensure that her children can attend school.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario G. M. es de la ciudad de  Santani, con casa propia, soltero, tiene 36 años de edad.
 
           Es propietario de una gomeria con 11 años de funcionamiento, tambien vende cubiertas nuevas y usadas, esta muy bien ubicado, al costado de la ruta 3.

               Es su tercera operación de creditos con esta institución, canceló en forma excelente sus creditos anteriores, y solicita nuevamente el credito para la compra de cubiertas e infladores.
texts.en:
Señor Mario G. M. lives in the city of Santani in his own house. He is single and 36 years of age. He is the owner of a tire store with 11 years of experience. He also sells used and new wheel covers. His business is in a good location, next to route 3. This is his third loan with this institution, having repaid his previous loans in excellent fashion. He again requests a loan for the purchase of wheel covers and pumps.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheel covers and pumps for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 46 años, vive con su hija Amy de 7 años en su casa propia. Hace mas de dos años se dedica en la venta de Bebidas como gaseosas y cerveza, resultándole muy rentable este negocio, y esto se debe al esfuerzo que le pone a su trabajo. la ventas lo realiza dentro de su casa, en donde los años y la experiencia han hacho que este negocio le sea estable y a la vez conocida por toda la gente que viven dentro de su localidad. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, puesto que siempre termina la venta muy rápido y se queda con las botellas vacías, entregándolas al camión distribuidor de bebidas. En un futuro desea mejorar su negocio poniendo una gran tienda. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her seven year old daughter named Amy. For more than two years she has been selling beverages such as sodas and beer. Her business has become highly profitable as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Gloria sells her products out of her home. Due to her years of experience, she has been able to make her business stable and is now known among everyone living in her neighborhood. She enjoys her work and always tries to make quick sales. At the end of the day, she collects the empty bottles to leave for the beverage distribution truck. In the future, she wants to improve her business by converting it into a large store.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Gloria is always known for being very responsible with her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy large quantities of beverages to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas to sell

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es:
Rolando de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, los 2 menores estudian la primaria, labora como operario especializado desde hace 10 años para el INTA de Nueva Guinea. Su esposa se encarga del cuido de la casa y de la familia. 

Don Rolando esta solicitando su 7mo crèdito para cambiarle el zinc a su pequeña casa, se ha caracterizado por ser un cliente bien responsable con sus compromisos, honesto y muy querido por sus jefe.   

Su mayor sueño es que su tres hijos estudien y trabajen para que sean peronas de bien ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Rolando is 43 years old and has three children. The two youngest are elementary school students. He has worked as a specialized operator for ten years for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute for Agricultural Technology). His wife is in charge of looking after the home and the family.

Don Rolando is requesting his seventh loan to replace the zinc sheeting of his small house. He is known for being a responsible client with all of his commitments. Rolando is honest and appreciated by his boss.

His greatest wish is to see his three children study and work to become good people since he did not have the opportunity to receive an education due to a lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets of zinc

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Don Gustavo  de 42 años de edad , labora para el INTA desde hace 10 años como operario de campo, tiene 3 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la Escuela Rigoberto Cabezas de Nueva Guinea.  Su esposa se encarga de los  quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de sus hijos.

Gustavo esta solicitando su 5to credito para hecharle el piso a una habitaciòn, es importante mencionar que este cliente siempre se le apoyado con estos pequeños creditos, ya que su ingreso es poco pero ha sido un cliente excelente. 

Sueña con tener su vivienda bonita y darle las comodidades basicas a su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 42 years old and has worked for INTA (Nicaragua Department of Agriculture) for the past 10 years as a field operator. He has three children who are studying at Rigoberto Cabezas School in Nueva Guinea. His wife is in charge of the household chores and taking care of the kids. Gustavo is requesting his fifth loan so he can put down a floor in his home. It's important to mention that this client is always supported by these loans, since his income is meager, but he has been an excellent client. He dreams of having a beautiful home and providing his family with basic commodities.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put down a floor in his home

loans.name: Raki

texts.fr: Raki B. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge et tutrice de 02 autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULATA depuis le 26 mai 2009 et a reçu 02 fois de suite de crédit, elle en est à son troisième. Elle fait la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide et d'huile de palme. Elle s'approvisionne en grande quantité dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone pour revendre dans les régions nord du pays. avec son prêt elle va renforcer son approvisionnement en huile de palme et en arachides pour la transformation en pâte. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Raki B. is a 50-year-old married woman. She has five children of her own in her care, and is also guardian to two others who were entrusted to her by people close to her. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Sinthiang Houlata since May 26, 2009, and has received credit twice before; this will be her third loan. She processes and sells peanut paste and palm oil. She buys in bulk in her area's weekly markets in order to re-sell in the northern part of the country. With her loan she will increase her supply of palm oil and peanuts to make into paste. Her goal is to support her husband in the care of the family.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital

loans.name: Tierra Linda Group

texts.es: Doña Carmelita Elena Chutá G., tiene 52 años de edad con tres hijos, de los cuales  una esta a su cargo, se dedica al comercio de repuestos  de maquinas de conturar y de esa forma ha trabajado diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder incrementar el volumen  de ventas. Son 5  señoras  que conforman el grupo denominadas  Grupo “Tierra Linda”, las señoras se dedican a diversas actividades productivas  tales como, comercio, la crianza de animales, bordado de blusas. En el Canton Pahaj, Santa Lucía Utatlan, Sololá. Eperan onbtener mejores ganacias al adquiririr el prestamos con esta institucióin.
texts.en:
Doña Carmelita Elena Chutá G. is 52 years of age with three children, of which one is still in her care. She is dedicated to the sale of refurbished sewing machines and works in this business daily. She has organized a group jointly with other neighbors to be able to increase their sales volume. There are 5 ladies that form the group called "Pretty Land". The ladies are dedicated to diverse productive activities such as sales, the breeding of animals, and embroidering blouses in Canton Pahaj, Santa Lucía Utatlan, Sololá. They hope to obtain better profits after acquiring the loan from this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for various businesses, including selling sewing machines, animal breeding, and embroidery

loans.name: Donilda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Donilda  tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos: la niña  de 12 años de edad estudia 6to grado de primaria y el niño de 14 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria.  Donilda trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 16 años.  

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo credito con el objetivo de comprar un solar y esto le vendra ayudar para asi poco a poco ir comprando algunos bienes para ir heredando a sus hijos.      

Doña Donilda se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy responsable, honesta, trabajadora, y con muchos deseos de superacion, pues actualmente està cursando el tercer año en la de la carrera ciencias de la Educacion en la Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea, su mayor sueños en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y que sus hijos estudien para que en el futuro sean excelentes profesionales.
texts.en:
Donilda is 48 years old and has two children: a 12-year-old daughter in sixth grade and a 14-year-old boy in high school. Donilda has worked as an elementary school teacher for the past 16 years. She is requesting her seventh loan in hopes of purchasing a plot of land, which will come in helpful little by little as she keeps buying goods for her children to inherit. Donilda is known for being a very responsible, honest and hard-working woman with a strong desire of moving up in life. She is currently in her third year of pursuing an educational sciences degree from the university in Nueva Guinea, and her biggest dream is to have job stability and for her children to continue their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Jose Simeon

texts.es:
Jose Simeon de 52 años de edad, labora para el Minsa desde hace 22 años, tiene dos  hijos la mayor de 18 años de edad la cual esta estudiando su segundo año en la Universidad URACCAN  y el niño menor de 14 años de edad estudia su segundo año de secundaria.   

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para realizarle un anexo a la cocina de su casa y asi tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones como todo cuidadano aspira.
                                                                                    
Don Simeon  se ha desempeñado con mucha responsabilidad en sus funciones laborales y compromisos, ya que es un cliente honesto, muy trabajador, lo ha demostrado en el pago de sus siete creditos anteriores en tiempo y forma, su mayor sueño es tener un porvenir mejor y que a sus hijos no le haga falta nada.
texts.en:
Jose Simeon is 52 years old and has worked for the ministry of public health for the past 22 years. He has two children, the eldest of whom is 18 and is in his second year at the university, and the youngest is 14 and in high school. Jose is requesting his eighth loan to build an addition in his home's kitchen and thus improve his living conditions, as anyone would want to do. He has carried out his work and commitments with great responsibility and is an honest and hard-working client, as he has demonstrated with his payments on his previous seven loan. His biggest dream is to have a better future so his kids do not lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an addition to his kitchen

loans.name: Rogelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Rogelio de  labora para el MINSA, desde hace 12 años como tecnico de ETV,  tiene 2 hijos ambos estudian su primaria en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina, su esposa  se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de los niños.    

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para comprar un solar que esta contiguo a su terreno y esto vendra a darle mayor valor  a su casa y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, es importante mencionar que don Rogelio es un excelente cliente lo ha demostrado en sus creditos anteriores.
texts.en:
Rogelio has worked for the ministry of public health and for the past 12 years as a technician for a television company. He has two children, both of whom are studying at Mauricio Cajina School. His wife is in charge of the household chores and caring for the children. He is requesting his eighth loan to purchase a plot that is adjacent to his land to add more value to his home and in this way improve the living conditions for his family. It is important to mention that Rogelio is an excellent client, which he has demonstrated in his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land adjacent to his home

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
Juan Enrique tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia en el Asentamiento Humano 18 de Febrero, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, la zona tiene un movimiento comercial moderado y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros), el brinda su servicio dentro de la ciudad de Lambayeque, su periferia y anexos cercanos durante todo el dia, este negocio es su unica fuente de ingreso, por lo que siempre se esfuerza por mantenerse en su actividad del mejor modo posible.

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas en el motor que requieren de urgente reparación para que pueda seguir trabajando con normalidad, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Juan Enrique es una persona tranquila y que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar a su familia adelante. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien responsable y respetuoso con los demás.
texts.en:
Juan Enrique is 27 years of age, married and has a son. He lives with his family in the Human Settlement 18th of February, a marginal urban zone of the city of Lambayeque. The zone has moderate commercial development and is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For six years he has been dedicated to offering transportation services in a mototaxi (a modified motorcycle with an enclosed cabin to transport a load and passengers). He offers his service inside the city of Lambayeque, its periphery and nearby suburbs every day. This business is his only source of income, which is why he always endeavors to maintained his vehicle in the best way possible. The continuous use of his mototaxi has done some harm to it, including some problems with the motor that require urgent repair so that he can continue working as usual. Because of this he has requested a loan of 400 new soles from Edpyme Alternative for the first time, which he plans to use for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle. Juan Enrique is a tranquil person and always works his hardest to get his family ahead. In the zone where he lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider him someone responsible and respectful with others.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and maintain his mototaxi

loans.name: Francisca Graciela

texts.es:
Doña Graciela de 55 años  de edad, labora como supervisora de enfermeria desde hace 36 años en hospital de Nueva Guinea,  tiene 2 hijos los dos mayores de edad viven en su propia casa, de ella depende economicamente solamente 1 nietecito de 3 añitos de edad al que cuida como su propio hijo. 

Graciela esta solicitando su primer credito para comprar piedras canteras y cemento para realizar mejoras en la vivienda, ya que una pared de la cocina se encuentra en mal estado y necesita cambiarla, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y salud.
texts.en:
Graciela is 55 years old. She has worked as a nursing supervisor for the past 36 years at a hospital in Nueva Guinea. She has two children, both of whom are grown and live in their own home. Only one little grandson, 3 years old, is economically dependent on her, and she cares for him as if he were her own child. Graciela is requesting her first loan to buy quarry stones and cement to make improvements to her home, since one wall of her kitchen is currently in bad shape and needs to be replaced. Her greatest dream in life is to see her family remain united and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Antigua Ixtaguacán 1 Group

texts.es: Doña CATARINA EDUVIGIS A. X., tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, los cuales estan a su cargo. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, helados de varios sabores en una tienda que tien rentada en la comunidad, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 12 años atrás y C. el afan de mejorar su calida de vida y la de su familia, deciden organizarse C. otras vecinas de la comunidad, para solicitar un credito que les servira para incrementar el capital de cada persona, y así generar mas ingresos para cada familia, teniendo en cuenta que las integrantes del grupo se dediC. a varias clases de actividades productivas como: Elaboracion de ropa típica de la región, venta de comidas a travez de un comedor, y siembra de hortalizas, frijoles, el cual los venden en las comunidades de Antigua IxtahuaC. y Nahuala del Departamento de Solola.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catarina Eduvigis A. X. is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children whom she takes care of. She sells groceries and various flavors of ice cream in a store she rents in her community. She has been working in that shop for twelve years with desire of improving her family's standard of living. She decided to get together with neighbors to each request a loan. That way each individual C. purchase more materials and in turn each family C. make more profits. The group members are each dedicated to different jobs such as: the production of traditional clothes, selling food in a cafeteria, and growing vegetables and beans which are sold in the Antigua, IxtahuaC., and Nahuala communities of the Solola Department.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more materials.

loans.name: Maria Daysi

texts.es:
Doña Maria Daysi de 43 años de edad, labora como cajera desde hace 3 años, desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad en sus funciones, tiene  un hijo de 14 años de edad el que actualmente esta cursando su primer año de secundaria.  

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el cual pretende construir una habitacion para asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, ya que en su casa solamente cuenta con una habitacion. 

Su sueño para el futuro es ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda con los creditos y espera seguir siendo beneficiada por AFODENIC y que su hijo siga estudiando para que llegue a ser un profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Daysi is 43 years old, and she has worked as a cashier for the past 3 years, performing her duties in a highly responsible manner. She has one son, age 14, who is currently in his first year of secondary school. She is requesting her second loan, with which she plans to construct a room to provide more comfort in her home, since her house currently only has one room. Her dream for the future is to continue improving her home little by little with the loans, and she hopes to continue benefiting from AFODENIC and to see her son continue studying so that he can become a professional someday.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a room

loans.name: Triunfadoras Sin Límites Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Triunfadoras sin Límite” y está conformado por 12 socias, pertenecientes a la comuna de La Florida.
Ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de artículos de aseo, ropa, mermeladas y manjar caseros, gorros, comida, papas fritas, sopaipillas, costuras y peluquería.
La socia entrevistada fue Katherine, quien es la  delegada de educación. En la foto se encuentra en la 2º fila, en 2º lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste suéter azul. Ella vende productos de chocolatería, principalmente alfajores y cuchuflis (barquillos rellenos de manjar). Vende sus productos en almacenes y en jardines infantiles. Lleva 4 años con este negocio.
Katherine es cosmetóloga, por lo que también hace terapias de relajación, digitopuntura y manicure a domicilio. Además cuando se ha enfrentado a momentos de crisis económica le pide la máquina de coser a su mamá y hace buzos para un colegio.
Invertirá este préstamo en manjar, chocolates, galletas para los alfajores y palitos para brochetas de chocolate.
Su meta es vender solo por cajas, ya que hasta ahora vende mayormente por unidad.
Su gran sueño es tener una tienda de disfraces.
Las motivaciones de Katherine son sus 2 hijos de 12 y 5 años y su esposo, el cual ha sido un apoyo fundamental para ella.
Lo que más le gusta de participar con Fondo Esperanza es que ha podido motivarse y valorar más su negocio, al saber que puede seguir con los préstamos, si  es responsable, cosa que procura concientemente.

La Florida es una comuna ubicada al  suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile,  Su población actual representa a todos los sectores económicos que hay en la Región Metropolitana, habiendo un sector de nivel alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo. La zona cuenta con modernos centros comerciales y es un comuna en crecimiento.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Triunfadoras sin Limite” and is made up of 12 members who are from the community of La Florida. They work mostly in selling cleaning products, clothing, jams, and custards (flan), hats, food, French fries, typical fried pastries, dressmaking and hairstyling. The member who was interviewed is Katherine, the education delegate. In the photo she is in the second row, shown standing second, going from left to right, and she’s wearing a blue sweater. She sells chocolate products, mostly candies and cuchiflis (bars filled with caramelized sweetened condensed milk). She sells her products in stores and child care centers and has been working in this business for 4 years. She is a beautician and she also does relaxation therapy, shiatsu, and manicures in people’s homes. Also when she is faced with times of economic crises, she borrows her mother's sewing machine and makes jerseys for a school. She will use the loan to buy the caramelized milk spread, chocolates, cookies to make the typical candies, and plastic sticks to make chocolate bars. Her goal is to sell only by the box, because now she sells mostly individually. Her biggest dream is to have a costume store. Katherine’s motivation for all this is her 2 children, 12 and 5, and her husband, who has been a basic support for her. What she most likes about participating with Fondo Esperanza is that she has been able to become motivated and appreciate her business more. She does this knowing that she can continue receiving loans if she is responsible, something that she is always working to achieve. La Florida is a community located in the southeast of Santiago, the capital of Chile. Its current population has all economic levels that are found in the metropolitan area: upper, upper middle, middle, and lower middle classes. The area has modern commercial centers and is a growing community.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chocolate, caramelized milk, cookies and plastic sticks.

loans.name: Yaima Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaima de 27 años de edad, labora como docente al Ministerio de educacion de Nueva Guinea desde hace 13 años, ella es una mujer bien trabajadora que ha luchado con su compañero de vida para que a sus hijos no le falte nada. 

Esta solictando su 10mo credito para construir una habitacion para su nuevo bebe que va ha nacer,  su esposo  tiene  un taller de mecanica en la comarca el Triunfo el cual lo ayuda con los gastos familiares. Yaima se siente muy agradecida con AFODENIC ya que por medio de los creditos a logrado comprar electrodomesticos y ha mejorado su vivienda poco a poco. 

Espera en el futuro poder ver su vivienda bonita y con las condiciones basicas para su familia.
texts.en:
Yaima is 27 years old and has worked as a teacher for the Nueva Guinea Ministry of Education for the past 13 years. She is a very hard-working woman who has struggled side by side with her life partner to ensure that her children do not lack anything they need. She is requesting her 10th loan to construct a room for her new baby who will soon be born. Her husband has a mechanic's workshop in the township of Triunfo which helps cover the family's expenses. Yaima feels very grateful to AFODENIC since through the loans she has been able to buy home appliances and has improved her home little by little. Her hope for the future is to make her home attractive, with the basic conditions her family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a room

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El  Sr. Pastor O. Z.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ciraty, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Vicencia Telma Z. Candia de 37 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos, todos en edad escolar.
 
       Posee una Oleria (fabrica de ladrillo) donde fabrican ladrillo y los producen para varias casas que se dedican a la venta de materiales de construccionen la ciudad de  Santani, el se encuentra  con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, señor muy trabajador.

             El cliente queire actualmente abrir un negocio de ventas de productos de uso domestico para que su señora pueda trabajar en el negocio y de esa forma  obtendrian mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Pastor O. Z. is from the Ciraty neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 45 years old, and is married to Vicencia Telma Z. Candia, who is 37. They have 2 children who are now school-aged. They have a brick factory where they make bricks for various businesses that sell construction materials in the city of Santani. He has regular customers, a good income, and good references, both personal and professional. He is a very hardworking man. Now he wants to open a store selling household products, so that his wife can work in the business and in this manner increase the family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, flour, dairy products, bread and other items

loans.name: Fredny Angelito

texts.es:
Fredny de 42 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (perímetro periurbano, que tiene una ecología en disolución). Tiene un taller de mecánica llamado “B.” 

Aunque al principio fue muy difícil tener su propio taller para poder mantener a su mama el tuvo que trabajar muy fuerte haciendo puertas, ventanas, rejas etc. Ahora el tiene su propio taller de cerrajería, trabaja con personas que contrata.      

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, piedras para adecuar mejor su negocio. En el futuro quiere construir una casa para alquilar departamentos.
texts.en:
Fredny is 42 years old and lives on the perimeter of Guayaquil (the suburbs that are somewhat rural in nature). He has mechanical workshop called “B.”. From the beginning it has been difficult to be a business owner. He has to support his mother. In order to support her he works hard each day making doors, windows, screens, etc. Now he has his own locksmith business also. He works with people that hire him. In order to continue with this business he would like to buy, with this loan, cement and stones. In this way he can improve his business. In the future he would like to build a house and rent out the rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: doors, screens

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El cliente Rosalio de 44 años de edad,labora para el MINSA desde hace 22 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad en sus funciones diarias.

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para comprar materiales de construccion y acondicionar mejor la cocina de su casa, construyendo pantry, poniendole el piso y otras cositas que pueda. 

Rosalio es un hombre responsable, ademas le gusta  estudiar pero por falta de tiempo no ha podido seguir estudiando ya que trabaja en turnos , es un hombre que le encanta ayudar a todos las persona enfermas que lo necesitan. Su mayor sueño es poder una vivienda bonita con las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Rosalio is 44 years old. For the past 22 years, he has worked for MINSA (Ministry of Health) and has been given the great responsibility of overseeing its daily functions.

He is requesting his seventh loan to buy construction materials so that he can renovate the kitchen in his house. Rosalio plans to build a pantry, install a floor, and perform other things that are needed.

Rosalio is a responsible gentleman. He also likes to study, but due to time constraints, he is unable to continue because he works in shifts. Rosalio enjoys helping sick people who are in need. His greatest wish is to have a beautiful home with all the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate his kitchen

loans.name: María

texts.es: María de 54 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus tres hijos y de su pequeño nieto que es su adoración. El trabajo que realiza es la venta de jugo de frutas, en donde lo prepara de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, es entonces que debe levantarse desde muy temprano por la mañana para preparar y llevar a domicilio sus juegos. Paralelo a ello, es una líder de su zona y por ello es muy querida y respetada, dentro de las actividades que realiza es la encargada de repartir alimentos a la gente de su comunidad. Es una mujer muy responsable y entusiasta, que además de los trabajos que realiza, también cuida de su nieto, y por él es que debe trabajar muy duro para brindarle todas las comodidades. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que siempre espera ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará frutas para la preparación de sus jugos.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her three children and her young grandson who she adores. She sells fruit juices that she prepares according to what her customers order. María wakes up early in the morning to prepare the juices to take out to sell. At the same, she is an admired and respected leader in her area since she is in charge of distributing food aid to people in the community. María is a responsible and enthusiastic woman. In addition to the activities she is involved in, she also takes care of her grandson, so she must work very hard to provide him all the comforts.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. As always, María expects to be prompt with all of her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits for preparing her juices.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits for preparing juices

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El  solicitante es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio San Jose, esta  casado. Tiene casa propia y es propietario de una despensa en su casa, con buena clientela y buen surtido de mercaderias.
 El señor Felix sueña con tener un local mas amplio y cómodo para todos sus clientes con buen surtido de mercaderías su negocio. 
 Nos comento que empezó a trabajar como vendedor ambulante en el mercado de Santani y que siempre  tenia en su mente  tener una despensa en su casa, ahora recurre a nuestra entidad para un apoyo de financiación para invertir en su negocio ya que desea ampliar su negocio, es una persona trabajadora, honesta, reponsable y muy servicial en su barrio.
texts.en:
Felix B. is from the San Jose neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is married and has his own house. He owns a store that is set up in his house. The store has a good customer base and is well-stocked with merchandise. Felix dreams of having a bigger location for his store that would be more comfortable for all of his customers and that has a good assortment of merchandise. He tells us that he began to work as a street vendor in the Santani market, and he always had in mind having a store in his house. Now he has turned to our entity for financial support so that he can invest in his business, since he wants to expand his business. He is a hardworking, honest, and responsible person who is very helpful to others in his neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo de 31 años de edad forma parte del banco comunal Los Tamarindos en la capital manabita Portoviejo, el señor Arturo esta recién casado y se dedica al comercio de ropa,realiza este trabajo desde hace 4 años en la ciudad de Portoviejo; hace 2 ciclos forma parte del banco comunal, le va muy bien con los créditos y el negocio lo ha sabido administrar muy bien,  cada mes viaja  la ciudad de Guayaquil a realizar las compras de la ropa. Por las noches es profesor de un colegio en el cantón  Rocafuerte motivo por la cual se ha tenido que ir a radicar en ese lugar de donde es su esposa, la cual también es maestra.

El señor Arturo con el crédito que va a recibir de la Fundación podrá surtir su negocio; durante estos años de trabajo todo ha marchado muy bien, tiene clientes fijos con los cuales trabaja a crédito dejándoles en dos y tres pagos dependiendo del monto que compren. Con los dos trabajos nuestro socio ha podido solventar los gastos en el hogar, el sueño de Arturo es tener un almacén propio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Arturo, who is 31 years old, is part of the Los Tamarindos communal bank based in the Manabi province capital of Portoviejo. Arturo recently got married and works as a clothing merchant in Portoviejo. He has been in this line of business for 4 years and has been a member of the communal bank for the last 2 seasons. He is doing really well thanks to the loans and his capable management of the business. Every month he travels to Guayaquil to buy clothes. In the evening he teaches at a school in the Rocafuerte region. Because of his job he has relocated to this area where his wife, who is also a teacher, is originally from. With the loan from Fundación Arturo will be able to stock up his business. Over the last few years his work has been going well. He has regular customers to whom he sells on credit, allowing them to pay him back in two or three instalments, depending on the amount purchased. With both jobs he has managed to cover household expenses. Arturo's dream is to have his own, well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses, t-shirts, trousers and children's clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca Flor tiene 66 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona que tiene un movimiento comercial moderado, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de golosinas, ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante todos los dias por la tarde y por la noche en el parque infantil de la ciudad. El negocio goza de buena acogida ya que este lugar es bastante frecuentado por los pobladores de la ciudad que acuden diariamente para recrear a sus menores hijos y pasar juntos un buen momento. Esta actividad le provee de algunos ingresos que utiliza en ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Blanca Flor desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más dulces, de modo que sus ventas puedan aumentar y que perciba mayor numero de ganancias, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Blanca Flor es una mujer hacendosa y que siempre se ha esforzado por sacar a sus hijos adelante. Actualmente todos ellos ya se han independizado y ello la llena de orgullo. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Blanca Flor, age 66, is married and lives with her husband in the city of Lambayeque. It is an area that has moderate commercial movement. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For six years she has been selling sweets. She sells as a street vendor everyday in the afternoon and evenings in the Parque Infantil (Children’s Park) in the city. The business is well-received. This is because it is a place that many people in the city go to entertain their young children and have a good time together. This activity provides income that she uses to help her husband support her family. Blanca Flor wishes to expand her business by purchasing more sweets. Then her sales can increase and she can get more sales. That is why she is asking, for the first time, Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 PEN to help her meet her objective. Blanca Flor is a hard-working woman who has always put forth effort to get her children ahead. All of her children are now independent, and that fills her with pride. The neighbors and acquaintances who live in her neighborhood consider her to be a level headed and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets to increase her itinerant sales business

loans.name: Flander

texts.es:
Flander C. M. es un señor de 40 años que vive con sui esposa e hijos en un pequeño pueblo en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades  tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el turismo, entre otros.

 La familia de Flander se ha dedicado toda su vida al negocio de la ganadería de doble propósito. Pero hace 2 años Flander decidió crear  su propio negocio, y fue así como nació la Carnicería La Garita. El asegura que a sido todo un éxito, y que por medio de su carnicería le ha podido dar una mejor vida a su familia.

Como resultado la de la calidad de los productos de su negocio, el necesita ampliar su carnicería por que la demanda es cada vez mayor y más exigente. Es por eso que el esta solicitando un préstamo de ¢150.000 (ciento cincuenta mil colones) para mejorar las condiciones de su carnicería e igualmente ampliarlo. De esta manera sus ingresos mejoraran y así la calidad de vida de sus hijos y esposa.

Don Flander   es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera mas activa con este  tipo de organizaciones
texts.en:
Flander is 40 years old and lives with his wife and children in a small town in Guanacaste called La Garita. It is on a very hot plain where activities such as cattle raising, agriculture, and tourism, among other things, take place. Flander's family has worked all their lives in the cattle business. But almost 2 years ago, Flander decided to create his own business, and this resulted in the birth of La Garita Butcher Shop. He reports that it has been a complete success, and that, thanks to his butcher shop, he has been able to provide a better life for his family. As a result of the quality of his business's products, he needs to expand his butcher shop, because demand is constantly growing and ever more urgent. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 150,000 colons to improve conditions in his shop and to expand it. In this way, his income will advance, as will the quality of life for his children and wife. Flander is a member of the Empresa de Credito Comunal (Communal Credit Enterprise) La Garita, one of the 100 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be Flander's first loan, and he hopes to be able to participate most actively in this type of organization.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING MATERIALS FOR EXPANDING HIS BUTCHER SHOP

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guiselle

texts.es:
Guiselle  C. V. es una señora de 43 años de edad, quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico, ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; la que es conocida como una comunidad muy tranquila y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Desde hace 2 años ella se dedica a la siembra de papaya y de papa China , por lo tanto dice que posee bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivos, tiene un  terreno en el cual ha sembrado papaya anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirla por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Guiselle  es un micro crédito de ¢629,000 (seiscientos veintinueve mil colones), para comprar fertilizantes, semillas y sembrar un hectárea de papaya, además de los  insumos  necesarios para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Guiselle forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico; una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido 2 microcrédito que le ha permitido tener un ingreso que le permita tener una mejor calidad de Vida.
texts.en:
Guiselle C. V. is a 43 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the rural Costa Rican community of Abanico, which is located in San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Alajuela Province. This community is known for being a peaceful area where the main industries are agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

For the past two years, Guiselle has been growing papayas and Chinese potatoes. She says she has enough experience in caring for and maintaining these types of crops. Guiselle has a plot land where she grows papaya. Given the good results she has achieved in the past, she now wants to expand her farm. Thanks to this business, the quality of life for her family has improved considerably.

At the moment, Guiselle is requesting a microloan of 629,000 CRC in order to buy fertilizers and seeds required to grow a hectare full of papaya. These supplies are needed to provide the best maintenance and care possible until it is time to harvest. In the end, she hopes to be rewarded for having very good production.

Guisella is part of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Abanico, one of 100 member organizations that form EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, she has received two microloans that have allowed her to generate income so that she can have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & seeds for growing papaya

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
El  Sr. Jose Domingo G. G.  es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio 8 de diciembre, tiene 65 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Ysolina Carrillo con 52 años de edad. Actualmente tienen 4 hijos, todos  mayores de edad.
 
       Posee una Oleria en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, tiene buenos ingresos, y buenas referencias comerciales y personales,es un señor muy trabajador.
El cliente con este crédito esta pensando comprar un terreno para construir un salón  para vender el mismo su materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Domingo G. G. is from the December 8th neighborhood in the city of San Estanislao. He is 65 years old and married to Sra. Ysolina Carrillo, who is 52. They have four children, all of whom are adults.

Jose operates a brick factory from home. He has an established customer base, a nice revenue stream, and good business and personal references. Jose is known for being an extremely hard worker.

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy land on which he can build a storefront where he can sell the construction materials that he produces.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land on which he can build a storefront for selling construction supplies

loans.name: Norgui

texts.es:
Norgui O. Z.	 es una señora de 35 años que vive con su esposo e hijos en un pequeño pueblo en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La Garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades  tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el Turismo Rural.

Desde hace varios  años Norgui   se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos.  Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

 Actualmente Doña Norgui está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil  colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. 

Doña Norgui  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera más activa en este  tipo de organizaciones
texts.en:
Norgui O. Z. is a 35 year old woman who lives with her husband and children in the small town of La Garita in Guanacaste. La Garita is situated on a plain that experiences very warm climate. The main business activities are livestock breeding, agriculture, and rural tourism.

For several years, Norgui has been raising chickens for fattening and egg production. She sells her products to neighbors in the community who have expressed their satisfaction. Norgui says she has the support of her husband, which makes it easier for her to continue with this activity. She also says her work is very interesting because she has seen business grow little by little and demand get stronger.

At the moment, Doña Norgui is requesting a microloan of 500,000 CRC in order to buy more chickens and hens, concentrated feed, and products for treating illness. This will help her expand and strengthen her business. She hopes the increased growth in her business will improve her quality of life. Currently her business is doing well, but she lacks the money to make it grow even more.
