Doña Norgui is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of La Garita, one of 100 member organizations that form EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan, so she hopes to continue participating as an active member within this type of organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, poultry feed, and medicines

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
María Julia tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en la ciudad D. Lambayeque, una zona D. movimiento comercial moderado, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. cinco años a trabajar como costurera, ella cuenta con una máquina D. coser en su vivienda. Allí elabora todo tipo D. prendas en base a pedidos, sus clientes son sus vecinos, conocidos y algunas instituciones locales, como por ejemplo, algunos hospitales. El negocio le ha brindado algunos ingresos con los cuales ha apoyado a su esposo, que es albañil, con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

María Julia desea iniciar un negocio que le brinD. ingresos adicionales con los cuales pueda ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, durante los untimos meses ha estado ahorrando dinero con la finalidad D. adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina que sirve para brindar servicio D. transporte D. carga y pasajeros), actualmente ya cuenta con una suma considerable pero esta no cubre el valor total del vehículo, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo y tener una fuente adicional D. ingresos.

La actividad D. servicio D. transporte en mototaxi tiene buena acogida en la zona ya que este medio D. transporte es bastante común. Una vez adquirido, el vehículo sería manejado por uno D. sus hijos.

María Julia es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre busca la manera D. sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donD. vive es bastante estimada y respetada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
María Julia is 43 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the city of Lambayeque, an area that experiences moderate business activity. This community is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, María Julia has worked as a seamstress. She has a sewing machine in her home, where she makes all types of clothing by request. Her customers are neighbors, acquaintances, and some local institutions, which incluD. a few hospitals. This business has provided some income by which she can help her husband, who is a bricklayer, with the family expenses.

María Julia wants to start another business to proviD. additional income to help move her family forward. Within the past few years, she has saved money so that she can acquire a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for transporting cargo and passengers). She has accumulated a considerable sum, but it is still not enough to cover the cost of a vehicle. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help achieve her goal and create an additional source of income.

Motorcycle taxis are very popular in the area since they are a common moD. of transportation. Once she acquires her vehicle, one of her children will be responsible for driving it.

María Julia is a hardworking woman who always looks for ways for her family to get ahead. In the area where she lives, she is admired and respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana tiene 55 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 30 años, Adriana se dedica en la confección D. prendas D. vestir. Es especialista en la elaboración D. buzos hechas en tela polar, material grueso que es muy utilizado para abrigar. En entonces que la elaboración D. estas prendas lo hace D. acuerdo al modelo o diseño que piD. el cliente, D. esa manera asegura la venta sin tener el riesgo D. quedarse con alguna mercadería. Sus compradores asiduos son los vendedores ambulantes que trabajan en los diversos mercados aledaños D. su distrito; puesto que les deja a un precio muy módico. Adriana trabaja  sola es por ello que no se da abasto para continuar, faltándole materiales para continuar y eso hace que pierda varios contratos. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su mercado y renovar su maquinas por otra multifuncional. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar  todas sus cuotas como hasta hoy, ya que sabe que este aporte le será muy favorable para aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa comprar telas polares, ya que por la estación D. invierno aumentó sus pedidos y D. ese modo continuará produciendo.
texts.en:
Adriana is 55 years old. She is a hardworking mother who lives with her husband and her three children in their own home. More than 30 years ago, Adriana started manufacturing garments. She specializes in sweaters maD. of fleece, thick material that is widely used for shelter. She customizes these garments according to the style or design that is requested by the customer, thereby ensuring the sale without risk of excess inventory. Her frequent customers are nearby vendors who work in various markets surrounding her district. This is because she offers them a very affordable price. Adriana works alone because she does not have the supplies to continue, lacking materials and losing various contracts for this reason. Her greatest desire is to expand her market and renovate her machines to be multifunctional. This is her second loan with MFP, and she agrees to pay all of her dues as of today, because she knows that this contribution will be favorable to increase her working capital. With this loan request, she plans to purchase fleece material, because she increased her orders for the winter season and will continue to produce them.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fleece material

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa de 57 años,  vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (perímetro periurbano, toda la gente que vive hay son pobres). Ella vende productos Yambal( empresa que da oportunidades a mujeres emprendedoras para vender productos a un bajo precio) .

Ella trabajaba vendiendo productos de uso personal para no depender de una empresa y tener sus propio negocio decidió invertir sus ahorros. Por esa buena decisión ha podido mantener a sus dos hijos hace tres años que se separo de su esposo. Para tener mas arreglada su casa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y bloques.   

En el futuro quiere tener su negocio en un local y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and lives in Paraíso in Guayaquil (a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway where all the residents live in poverty). She sells products made by Yambal (a company that provides women entrepreneurs the opportunity to sell merchandise at a low price).

Rosa sells products for personal use because she does not want to rely on a company. She decided to use her savings to start her own business. This turned out to be a good decision because she is now able to support her two children since separating from her husband three years ago. In order to make additional renovations to her house, she is requesting a loan to buy cement and blocks.

In the future, she wants to have a storefront for her business and finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & blocks

loans.name: Ysa

texts.es: Ysa, D. 48 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora y responsable, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta D. pollos desD. hace 7 años. DesD. entonces su trabajo empieza a las 6.00am para recibir los pollos, la cantidad necesaria D. acuerdo a la exigencia D. sus clientes, como es el caso D. los dueños D. restaurante donD. venD. pollo a la brasa, son quienes le hacen mayor demanda D. este producto perecible así como las amas D. casa. Años atrás trabajaba sola, pero hoy emplea a una persona para que le ayuD. en la atención D. sus clientes, pagándole a diario.  Su puesto D. venta se ubica a dos cuadras del mercado principal, trabajando desD. muy temprano hasta las 3.00pm D. la tarD.. Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que le deja utilidades. Su mayor anhelo es tener un puesto dentro del mercado. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar el capital D. su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará la compra D. pollos, D. ese modo aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ysa, a 48 years old mother with a family, is very hard working and responsible. She lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house. For the last 7 years her work has been selling chickens. Since then her work has started at 6:00 A.M when she picks up the chickens, in sufficient quantity to meet the needs of her clients, such as owners of restaurants where they sell roasted chicken. These owners place the largest orders for this perishable product, along with housewives. Some years back Ysa worked alone, but today she employs one person who is paid daily and helps her serve the clients. She works from very early until 3:00 P.M in the afternoon at her sales location which is located two blocks from the main market. She feels very pleased with her work which provides her with income. Her greatest wish is to have a location insiD. the market. This is her eighth credit with MFP and she knows that this loan will be very important to her in order to increase the working capital of her business. For this reason she commits to making all the payments on time. With the loan she is requesting she will increase the purchase of chickens, and in this way increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more chickens in order to increase her sales and income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou D. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de SAMBA 15 ans 1 depuis le 25 janvier 2003 et a bénéficié 14 fois de suite de crédit qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce au marché centre de son quartier où elle vend des condiments pour cuisine et des produits halieutiques. Avec son prêt actuel elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises, c'est-à-dire des poissons fumés et/ou séchés, du poivre, des oignons, du piment et des ingrédients de cuisine. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille par exemple la santé, la nourriture, l'habillement et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Oumou D. is a 44-year-old married mother of four dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SAMBA 15 ANS1 since January 2003 and has received credit 14 times. She has always repaid her loans without difficulty. She runs a small business in the central market of her neighborhood where she sells cooking condiments and fish products. With this loan she will increase her supply of goods, specifically smoked and/or dried fish, pepper, onions, chillis, and cooking ingredients. She participates in the care of the family--health, food, clothing, and the children's education.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital

loans.name: Residenciales El Campo 2 Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Residenciales El Campo 2 está integrado por tres socias, Reina Isabel P. P., Elbia O. y Santos Blacina P..  Las tres socias viven en Juticalpa, Olancho.  

Señora Reina Isabel P. P. tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda, y tiene 5 hijos.  Comenzó con una mini pulpería hace 12 años con un préstamo de 2,000 Lempiras.  Lo crecí a un mini súper en 2003 pero su esposo se enfermó y tuve que vender su negocio para pagar los gastos médicos.  Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano de forma ambulante.  Tiene una clientela buena y sus hijos le ayuda a vender la ropa.  Con el préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras comprará un fardo de ropa de segundo mano de primera clase.  También usará sus ahorros para comprar tres fardos más.  Con el préstamo podrá crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para suportar a su familia y salir adelante.  Sus sueños son que podrá construir su casa propia y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.  

Elbia O. venda verduras y usará el préstamo para comprar verduras por mayor y aumentar sus ganancias.

Santos Blacina P. venda productos cosméticos y con el préstamo comprará más productos cosméticos para crecer su inventario y aumentar sus ganancias para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Residenciales El Campo 2” (Residential Area 2) consists of three members: Reina Isabel P. P., Elbia O., and Santos Blacina P.. They live in Juticalpa, Olancho.

Sra. Reina Isabel P. P. is 50 years old, widowed, and has five children. She started a mini-grocery 12 years ago with a loan of 2000 HNL and it later grew into a mini-supermarket. In 2003, her husband became ill and she had to sell the business in order to pay for his medical expenses. Now she sells secondhand clothing as a traveling merchant. Reina has a good customer base and her children help with selling clothes. With a loan of 5000 HNL, she will buy a bundle of high-quality secondhand clothing. She will also use her savings to buy three additional bundles. This loan will enable her grow her business and increase her earnings so that she can support her family and get ahead. Her dreams include building her own home and seeing her children continue their studies.

Elbia O. sells vegetables and will use her loan to buy vegetables in bulk so that she can increase her earnings.

Santos Blacina P. sells cosmetics and will use her loan to buy more beauty products to expand her inventory and increase her earnings to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bundle of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials needed to improve his home

loans.name: Virgen

texts.es:
La señora Virgen es casada pero actualmente está separada de su marido, tiene 6 hijos,  desde hace 32 ciclos forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos en la bella ciudad de Portoviejo, nuestra socia se dedicada a preparar comida,  vende  desayunos y almuerzos en la sala de su casa la cual le ha adecuado con mesas y sillas para que sus clientes puedan servirse los alimentos.

Ella ha solventado su negocio con los créditos obtenidos en la Fundación. El esposo es chofer profesional y ella se ha dedicado a su negocio, tiene 20 clientes fijos que llegan todos los días ha su negocio, nuestra socia se dedica sola a  preparar los platos que son típicos de la región, cada mañana va al mercado central de Portoviejo a realizar las compras para los alimentos; el negocio le ha resultado muy bueno y  en ocasiones cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hijas.

Este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en comprar productos necesarios para preparar los alimentos y hacer algunos arreglos al sitio donde tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Virgen is married but currently separated from her husband. She has 6 children. She has been a member of the Los Tamarindos Communal Bank for 32 cycles, in lovely Portoviejo. Her business is preparing meals. She sells breakfasts and lunches in the dining room of her home, which she has set up with tables and chairs so that her customers can serve themselves. She has financed her business with loans from the Foundation. Her husband is a professional driver, and she has run her business. She has 20 standing customers who come to her location every day. She herself prepares dishes typical of the region, and every morning visits Portoviejo’s central market to purchase the food she needs. Her business has gone well, and at times she has help from one of her daughters. She will use this next loan to buy commodities needed to prepare her food, and to make some repairs in the site where she has her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, fish, rice, potatoes, bananas, yucca, etc.

loans.name: Santos Esxequiel

texts.es: El señor L. se dedica al servicio de Taxi con el ingreso que obtiene de este trabajo logra mantener la alimentación de su mamá y él, con CEPRODEL es su segundo crédito que solicita para la compra de amortiguadores, rotulo, muñequillas, roelling y cremalleras para mantener bien el vehículo el cual le provee sus ingresos
texts.en:
Sr. Santos L. provides taxi services. With the income he earns from this job, he is able to support and feed himself and his mother. He is requesting his second loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy shock absorbers, signage, crankpins, cogs, and rolling parts so that he can keep his vehicle well-maintained and continue generating income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts & supplies for his vehicle

loans.name: Sandra Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Sandra  forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos, se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita; nuestra socia está casada y tiene dos hijos, es profesora de la Universidad Técnica De Manabí y aparte de eso es vendedora de productos Avon desde hace varios años, junto a la Fundación ha podido hacer que su negocio crezca, ella compra  al contado los perfumes, bisutería y productos para el aseo personal  y los vende atreves de un catalogo  a sus amigas del trabajo, que en su gran mayoría le compran y le cancelan mensualmente.

La señora Sandra invertirá  este nuevo crédito en la compra de productos, cuenta que tiene varios pedidos por entregar y lo que más vende es perfumes para damas y caballeros, con este crédito también quiere probar suerte con las venta de productos Yanbal y espera que le vaya bien.
texts.en:
Sandra is part of the Los Tamarindos Communal Bank which meets in the city of Portoviejo. She is married and has two children. She is a professor at the Technical University of Manabí, and has also worked selling Avon products for a few years. With help from the Foundation she has been able to grow her business. She buys perfumes, costume jewelry, and personal care products at wholesale and sells them through a catalog to her friends at work, most of whom buy things and pay her every month. Sandra will invest this new loan in the purchase of products. She has several orders to be delivered and the best sellers for men and women are perfumes. With this loan she wants to try her luck with the sale of Yanbal products, and she hopes that it will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase makeup, perfumes, lotions, soaps, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger M. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old. Roger is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Roger owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase materials needed to provide service. Roger is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for the maintenance of his motorcycle. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Roger from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora M. M. tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, calzado, perfumes y otros, con esto les provee de alimentación y otros gastos a su familia además que la señora se apoya con el esposo ya que él tiene un taxi y le ayuda, esta solicitándole a CEPRODEL un financiamiento para la compra de blusas, pantalones de mujer, cosméticos y perfumes, sandalias y zapatos para varón deportivos ya que ella también vende por encargos, el sueño de ella es terminar de construir su casita para darle una vida digna a sus hijos quienes actualmente se encuentran estudiando.
texts.en:
Señora M. M. has a business selling clothing, footwear, perfumes and other items. Through this business, she is able to provide food for her family and to help with household expenses. In addition, Sra. M. Monga receives support from her husband, since he has a taxi and is able to help her out. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to purchase blouses, women's pants, cosmetics and perfumes, sandals and men's athletic shoes. She also sells by pre-orders. Her dream is to finish construction on her little house in order to give her children, who are currently students, a good life.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of blouses, women's pants, cosmetics and perfumes, sandals and men's athletic shoes.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Esta señora posee una pulpería que la abre a partir de las seis de la mañana para aprovechar las personas que pasan a sus trabajos y a los alumnos que van al colegio, con eso ella les facilita de educación, alimentación, recreación a sus menores hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian y uno no tiene edad todavía, ella les quiere brindar un gran porvenir por esa razón está solicitando un nuevo crédito a CEPRODEL para poder surtir un poco más su negocio y darle un mejor nivel de vida y así se puedan enfrentar al futuro.
texts.en:
This woman owns a corner store, which she opens at six in the morning to take advantage of selling to the the passersby heading to work and the students heading to school. Running this business makes it easier for her to provide her younger children with education, food and entertainment. Of her children, only two are in school; one is not yet old enough. She wants to give them a wonderful future, and that is the reason she is requesting a new loan from CEPRODEL- to stock her business a bit more and to have a better standard of living and thus be prepared to face the future.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, big cola, split firewood, oil and household goods.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey R. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 34 years old. Jeffrey is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeffrey owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from catching and selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Jeffrey has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeffrey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to buy fishing nets. Jeffrey is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to repair the pumpboat that he uses in catching fish. Jeffrey also wants to buy another, bigger pumpboat than he has now. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jeffrey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his pumpboat

loans.name: Enny Yericsa

texts.es:
La señora Enny es una de las socias que  forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Tamarindos en la ciudad de Portoviejo, está casada y tiene 27 años de edad,  fruto del matrimonio tiene una hija, nuestra socia es comerciante se dedica a la venta de bolsos, carteras, y prendas de vestir, sus compras las realiza en Colombia  país reconocido por ser una gran potencia comercial en ropa. Por el hecho de ser prendas traídas directamente de ese país obtiene buena utilidad en sus ventas, la mayoría de sus clientes son muy exigentes pero realmente le ha ido muy bien y  gracias a los créditos obtenidos por parte de la Fundación ha podido mantenerlo bien surtido.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Enny podrá viajar a Colombia a realizar varias compras como zapatillas, bolsos y cartera en general y por supuesto ropa especialmente ropa interior que es la que más vende.  Nuestra socia sale a recorrer la ciudad, así la mercadería se vende muy rápido y puede reunir el  capital  para seguir invirtiéndolo.
texts.en:
Enny is a member of Los Tamarindos Communal Bank, in Portoviejo. She is 27 years old, married, and has a daughter. She is a merchant, selling bags, purses, and garments, which she buys in Colombia, a country known as major source of clothing. Because the garments come directly from Colombia, she derives a nice profit from her sales. Most of her customers are quite demanding, but in truth, things have gone well for her, and with loans secured through the Foundation, she has been able to keep her business well supplied. With this next loan, Enny will be able to go to Colombia to purchase a number of items, such as slippers, bags, and purses in general, and of course clothes, especially underwear, which is the largest category of her sales. She travels throughout the city and thus her merchandise sells quickly, and she can accumulate capital to re-invest.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, zapatillas, carteras.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas R. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 46 years old. Felicitas is married. To make a living, Felicitas owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felicitas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

To make a living, Cherilyn owns & operates operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members; her husband does the driving of their motor vehicle. Cherilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Cherilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cherilyn from HSPFI. loans.name: Liricia Moserrate

texts.es:
La señora Liricia es casada aun no ha podido tener hijos pero no descarta la posibilidad de ser madre, tiene como socia 30 ciclos en el banco comunal Los Tamarindos, este banco se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo, trabaja como maestra de Parvulario de un  jardín de infantes en la mañana y en la tarde en un colegio,  aparte de eso ella se dedica al comercio de perfumes Yanbal y Perfumes Americanos de marcas reconocidas como Carolina Herrera entre otros, los productos  de Yanbal los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y los demás hace pedidos a sus familiares que viven en EE.UU.

Ella  vende por medio de pedidos, tiene 10 clientes fijos  y aparte  vende a los amigos de sus amigos, la señora Liricia  en cada compra que realiza invierte todo el crédito de la Fundación.

En los actuales momentos nuestra socia tiene un buen capital invertido en los perfumes y con este nuevo crédito podrá pagar varios de ellos, además surtir con mas productos de Yanbal,  nos comentó que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y se siente muy contenta con su negocio,  lo único que pide es seguir con salud para poder trabajar sin problema alguno.
texts.en:
Liricia is married and hasn't been able to have children yet, although she is not discounting the possibility of being a mother. She has been a member of the communal bank Los Tamarindos for 30 cycles. This bank meets in the city of Portoviejo. She works as a preschool teacher in in the morning and at a high school in the afternoon. In addition to that, she sells Yanbal perfume and American perfumes with recognizable brand names such as Carolina Herrera, among others. She buys the Yanbal products in Portoviejo and the rest she orders from her relatives who live in the U.S.A. She sells by order. She has 10 regular customers and she also sells to freinds of friends. Liricia invests everything into the loan from the Fundación with every purchase. At this time, our member has a good amount of capital invested in perfumes and with this new loan, she will be able to pay for several and also diversify with more Yanbal products. She told us that she has her husband's support and she is very happy with the business. The only thing she asks for is to stay healthy to be able to work without any trouble.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume and makeup to sell

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saveoun R. is a group leader who has been selected by four members in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Saveoun R. was born in 1981. She and her husband, Mr. Sothy Theib, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate crops to sell to support their family. They have a problem in that their home is too old to live in but they do not have enough money to rectify this. Mrs. Saveoun R. is, therefore, requesting a loan to build her own home. She is the mother of two children who are all too young to work or study.

loans.use: To build her own home

loans.name: Mrs. Saret Meng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has twelve people. Mrs. Saret M. is a village bank president located in Preaek Ta Mem village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 


Mrs. Saret M. is a fish seller in the local market where she can earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants expand. She is, therefore, asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell. Her husband, Mr. Korng M., is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates crops to sell to support his family. She is the mother of one child who is five years old.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has six members who live in Roluos village in Kandal province. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 


Mrs. Sokun K. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sochun S., is a construction worker. She currently has a problem because her field is infertile. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sokun K. is asking for a loan to bU. fertilizer. 


She is the mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are construction workers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios T. lives in the village of Lugait in Misamis  Oriental. She is 71 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. She makes a living running a retail shop where she sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp to people who live in her community. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue to improve her business.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea S. is a group leader who has been selected by six members located in Kok Til village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 


She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She has a problem because it is time to prepare her field but she does not have enough money to do this. Mrs. Kunthea S. is, therefore, requesting a loan to enable her to farm this current year. 

Her husband, Mr. Savoeurn Gnoung, is a security guard in a private company who earns a low salary to support his family. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local public school, while the youngest two are not yet enrolled in school.

loans.use: To operate her farm

texts.en:
Betty J. lives in the village of Manticao in Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Betty makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) retail store where she sells food and other products people buy daily. She has been in this line of work for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a new loan for 5,000 PHP which she will use to buy additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue made possible by the loan to continue to expand her small shop.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling lumber in the local community. Bernarda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Bernarda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Bernarda from PMPC.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Mrs. Siphan Um Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of seventeen people who live in Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Siphan U. is the group leader, selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. Mrs. Siphan U. is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She has a problem because her field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Siphan U. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers. Her husband, Mr. Rortha Segn, is a security guard at a private company. Mrs. Siphan U. is the mother of two children: one is employed at MFI in Cambodia while the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut M. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sri Cendana (PK-10172).


Ni Ketut is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Ni Ketut owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 600,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Ketut M. (0) merupakan 34 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sri Cendana (PK-10172).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 600,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita L. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two adult-aged children and one school-aged child. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling spices, vegetables, and daily use products in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2008, Carmencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kathleen Mae

texts.en:
Kathleen Mae B. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Kathleen Mae is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Kathleen Mae operates a family member's business venture in the services sector, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport like 'habal-habal' services. Kathleen Mae has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Kathleen Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kathleen Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Kathleen Mae is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Kathleen Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Jurefel

texts.en:
Mrs. Jurefel P. is from the village of P2 Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years of age and blessed with five children, a set of infant twins and three who are at school age.  Jurefel, together with her husband, is presently engaged in recycling junk scrap metals, plastics and bottles.  They have been engaged in this business for five years and earn approximately $88 a month from sales of their junk scrap metal, plastic and bottles.

 In 2007, Jurefel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for their buy and sell business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion, the children’s education and future house repairs and renovation.
 
 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Chamreoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamreoun N. is the group leader who has been selected by the four members of this group who live in Kampong Samnanh village in Kandal province. They will each use their portion of the loan for a different purpose to improve their business in the future.

Mrs. Chamreoun N. is a seamstress in a garment factory who earns a low salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sareth Men, is a motorbike and bicycle repairer.

Now, Mrs. Chamreoun N. has a problem because her husband does not have enough motorbike and bicycle supplies to use. So, to improve her husband’s business, she is asking for a loan to buy motorbike and bicycle supplies for him to use.

Mrs. Chamreoun N. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy motorbike and bicycle supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: In Chheu Teal village in Kandal province, this group with four members have selected Mr. Phal S. as group leader. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes but in general to improve their businesses for the future.  Mr. S. is 57 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Kim Ang, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops for selling to support their family. Now they have a problem because their field is time to do grow. So to improve production, Mr. Phal S. is asking for a loan to buy bamboo to make pea garden. He is a father of five children, three of whom are helping him to do farming, while the others are attending locale.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make a pea garden.

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut L. Y.  is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut is the group leader of a 19-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Melati (PK-10197).


Ni Ketut is married and does not have any children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut is requesting a loan from MUK for the first time in the amount of 1,300,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Ketut L. Y. (0) merupakan 44 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 19 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Melati (PK-10197).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 100,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,300,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia G. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Emelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelia owns & operates a grocery store. The main source of income for the business comes from retailing rice, selling canned goods and dairy products  in the local community. Aside from those products, Emelia  also sells a variety of vegetables and dried fish. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Consulacion

texts.en:
Consulacion S. is from the village of Southwestern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 51 years old. Consulacion is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Consulacion owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Consulacion has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Consulacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consulacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase breeding livestock. Consulacion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the second loan taken out by Consulacion from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Fanny Lorena

texts.es:
Fanny es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus sombreros elaborados artesanalmente en base a juncos. Se encuentra ubicada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Fanny es una mujer que ha trabajado incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus hijos, empezó vendiendo ropa a sus vecinos y con las ganancias de esta actividad fue instalando un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas. Luego, con mucho esfuerzo ha ido instalando un negocio de cabinas de internet con el cual se genera actualmente una fuente estable de ingresos queutiliza en solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio tiene muy buena acogida en la zona y sus principales clientes son los jóvenes y estudiantes de la zona que acuden a utilizar sus servicios. Actualmente Fanny ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en brindarle mantenimiento a sus equipos.

Fanny es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, en la zona se ha vuelto muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fanny is a 45 year-old mother who lives in the Cuidad Eten district, an area known at the regional level for its hats that are handmade out of reeds. It is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Fanny is a woman who has worked tirelessly to provide the best for her children. She started out selling clothing to her neighbors, and with the earnings from this activity she set up a small store selling sweets. Later, with a lot of effort, she established an internet cafe business which currently generates a stable source of income that she uses to cover the household expenses. The business is well accepted in the area, and its main customers are the youth and students in the area who come to use her services. Now Fanny has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to provide maintenance for her equipment. Fanny is a responsible and hardworking woman. She has become very well-known and respected by her neighbors. She has worked with our institution previously, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain the computers in her internet cafe

loans.name: Victoria Esther

texts.es:
Victoria es una madre de familia de 46 años que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo en la región La Libertad, ubicada a hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños al menudeo. Ella distribuye sus productos en su distrito y en diversas zonas del norte del país como Pacasmayo, Chachapoyas, Rodríguez de Mendoza y Chongoyape. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio se ha vuelto conocida en el rubro y ya cuenta con un grupo fiel de clientes en cada ciudad. Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio los utiliza en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Victoria desea adquirir prendas de vestir de temporada para ampliar su sotck, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Victoria es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 46-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the district of Guadalupe, province of Pacasmayo, region of La Libertad, located an hour and 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. She has made a living for more than five years selling clothes for men, women and children at retail. She distributes her products throughout her district as well as diverse areas in the northern part of Peru such as Pacasmayo, Chachapoyas, Rodríguez de Mendoza and Chongoyape. Thanks to the amount of time she has had the business she has become known in the trade and has a group of faithful customers in each city. She uses the income she makes to contribute to her family's finances. Victoria wishes to acquire more seasonal clothing to improve her inventory and increase her sales and profits, which is why she has requested a loan of 2000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to achieve this objective. Victoria is a hard-working woman devoted to her family. Her biggest goal is to keep making headway for her family. She has previously worked with this institution and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to increase her inventory

Dewa Ayu Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Dewa Ayu Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Dewa Ayu Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Dewa Ayu Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Juan Anderson

texts.es:
Juan tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus familia en el distrito de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral embotellada y demás bebidas de manera ambulante, el cuenta con una pequeña carreta con la cual sale a vender sus productos todos los dias. Su lugar de venta es en una calle cercana a la plazuela de su distrito, el lugar es bastante concurrido por los transeúntes por lo que su negocio siempre goza de acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y en ayudar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más bebidas para poder incrementar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juan es una persona honrada y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando y desarrollandose como empesario para poder tener su propia bodega, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien respetuoso y amigable.
texts.en:
Juan is 21 years old, single and lives with his family in the district of Guadalupe, province of Pacasmayo, region of La Libertad, located an hour and 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He makes a living selling soft drinks, bottled mineral water and other beverages. He has a small cart that he sells his products from every day. His sales post is on a street near a small square in his district, which sees a lot of foot traffic, so his business always stays active. He uses the money he makes to cover personal expenses and help his parents with household expenses. Juan wishes to expand his business by purchasing more beverages so he can increase his sales and achieve better profits, which is why for the first time he is requesting a loan of 800 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve this objective. Juan is an honest and hard-working person whose biggest goal is to keep working and developing as a businessman so he can have his own bodega. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him respectful and friendly.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more packaged beverages to expand his business

loans.name: Mrs. Youn Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Youn C., 56 years old, is the village bank president of this group loan and was selected by its sixteen members. The group is located in Saing Sarinn village in Takeo province. The members will use their portions of this village loan to support their individual business purposes. 

Mrs. Youn C. and her husband, Mr. Sor C., are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. In ths way, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. They have four children: two are seamstresses in a local garment factory and the other two are students as well as working as beauticians in the local village. It is to support their business endeavors that Mrs. Youn C. has decided to ask for a loan: she wishes to buy beautician supplies in order to support her children's business.

loans.use: To buy beautician supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta E. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living Julieta sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Julieta joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC which she used to to expand her business. She is requesting her fourth loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Altyngul's Group

texts.en: Daily life is so diverse, with its obstacles, surprises, wins and losses. Sometimes even a big purchase does not make us feel good whereas some slight help can make us very happy. We never know what feelings this or that occasion will inspire in us, but one thing is true: that regardless of the sum of money a person obtains as help, if it is done in time of need and difficulty, it certainly brightens his day and makes him feel that the world is not that bad, that there are many good and generous people out there, making him wish to become one of them in future. Altyngul T. is forty five and is the mother of four children. To provide for the family Altyngul’s husband works as a taxi driver. Altyngul also prefers to be occupied with something, so, using her skill of cooking delicious food, she has been cooking meals for sale in a small café. The meals she makes range from traditional to European and Oriental kitchens. During the past several years, Altyngul and her husband have worked hard and managed to buy a car and furnish their special kitchen/café, where Altyngul works. Now her monthly income is around 220 USD. Altyngul has raised good children: her eldest daughter is married while her two sons are helping her fetch the foodstuffs and prepare ingredients. Her little son goes to middle school. Altyngul has decided to apply for this loan as she needs money to buy flour, meat, sugar, olive oil and many other things needed for cooking. She knows that her business will grow even faster if she can invest in it a significant amount of funds to improve the design and interiors. Altyngul’s partners: Aijamal S., 31, is divorced and has an eight-year-old daughter. To provide for her small family she works as a bartender in a café. She needs this loan to buy a vacuum cleaner. Sabira K., 51, is a widow and has raised three daughters, all of whom are married and live separately. She needs this loan to buy a vacuum cleaner and an electric oven. Chynar A., 38, is a widow who has raised a daughter and two sons. The older son provides tractor services and earns 10,000 soms (approximately 217 USD) per month and the other children are students. Nine years ago Chynar, with an initial investment of 2,000 soms (approximately 43 USD) began to sell meat and, in this way, she earns 10,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to increase the turnover of her business. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, sugar, olive oil and many other things needed for cooking

loans.name: Mrs. Yeing Thea Village Bank Group

Mrs. Yeing T. and her husband, Mr. Khorn Chroeng, are pig breeders who are able to earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Yeing T. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy more piglets to support her pig breeding efforts. In addition to farming, Mrs. Yeing T. is a grocer and owns a small grocery store. They have five children: two are very young and the others are students at the local school. 

Mr. Sopheap Men is a group guarantor, so he is in the photo, too.

Ester is 51 years old and married with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living Ester sells scrap metal and other used-products like bottles. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 16000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ester joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC which she invested in her business. Ester is requesting her fourth loan, for 10000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mrs. Nan Ses Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan S. is 39 years old and has been selected as the leader of nine people seeking a group loan. The group members are located in Trapeang Kak village in Takeo province. Each member will use his/her portion of the group loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Nan S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Nan S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her farming crop. Her husband, Mr. Sam Some, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to help support his family's needs. This couple has six children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other five are students in the local school. All of them also support their mother's farming activities.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
Lucina es una madre de familia de 64 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de gaseosas, golosinas, refrescos y otros productos en los exteriores del hospital de la ciudad de Chepén, esta actividad le provee de algunos ingresos con los cuales apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la familia. El negocio goza de buena acogida, sus principales clientes son las personas que llegan a visitar a sus familiares enfermos y los transeúntes que circulan permanentemente por la zona.

Adicionalmente vende estos productos en su domicilio cuando no se encuentra en los exteriores del hospital. Lucina se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de más mercadería para ampliar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos.

Lucina es una mujer trabajadora, ella nos comenta que esta ocupación la hace sentirse activa y que desea seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su esposo a sustentar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucina is a 64-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the district of Chepén, an agricultural and commercial zone in the province of the same name, about an hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region of Lambayeque. She has made a living for a number of years selling soft drinks, refreshments, snacks and other products outside a hospital in Chepén. This provides her with income to help her husband provide for the family. Her business enjoys success, and its main customers are passersby and people coming to visit sick relatives. Additionally, she sells these products out of her home when she's not at the hospital. Lucina is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to use to acquire more merchandise to increase her sales and income. Lucina is a hard-working woman, and she tells us that her job makes her feel active and she wants to keep working so she can help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to increase her sales

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Chou Village Bank Group

texts.en:

Mrs. T. C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Borin Phoa, is a motorcycle taxi driver.This couple has three children, who all are attending in the local school.

With their two businesses they are able to earn sufficient income to support their family's living expenses.  Mrs. T. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy additional piglets for her new business. The will use the loan to increase their income and improve their family's standard of living.

loans.name: Mrs. Ngaet Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngaet H., 35 years old, is the village bank president selected by ten loan members who live in Trapeang Kralanh village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion for their own purpose and each hopes to increase their income and improve their family's living standard. 

Mrs. Ngaet H. and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Soeun, are farmers of a plot of land where they cultivate rice and earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Ngaet H. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her field crop.

The couple has five children; four attend the local school and the youngest is 5 years old.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Chequén del distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicado en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Nelida percibe ingresos vendiendo artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella pone al alcance de la mano de sus vecinos todo tipo de artículos de uso diario por los que tendrían que dirigirse hasta el mercado de la ciudad para adquirirlos. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, ya que con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Nelida desea adquirir mas productos parea ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer de mejor manera la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Nelida is a 30 year old wife and mother who lives with her husband and children in the Chequén sector of the Chepén district. This is a commercial and agricultural area that belongs to the province of the same name, located in the La Libertad region. The area is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Nelida receives income from selling basic necessity items and groceries in a store set up in her house. There she offers to her neighbors all types of items of everyday use that they would have to go to the city market to buy. This business is a big financial help for her family, since her income helps her husband with the family expenses. Nelida wants to acquire more products to increase her sales and satisfy her customers' demand better. That is why, for the first time, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to help her acheive her goal. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is for her children to become professionals and good men. In the area where she lives her neighbors esteem and respect her very much.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic neccesity products and groceries to expand her store.

loans.name: Group 1

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City. She is 58 years old. Carmelita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carmelita is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a "sari sari" (general store) business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling products like shampoo, and noodles in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
