loans.name: Groupe 3 De Djekafo Togo

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe 3 de l’association Djekafo de Togo sont des femmes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Togo dans la commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies culturales et de cultiver d’autres spéculations en plus du mil pendant l’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Les membres du groupe vont cultiver le mil, l’arachide et le niébé (haricot).
Madame Fatoumata  Coumaré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50kg de grains d’arachide de semence et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de désherbage pour son champ d’arachide. 
Elle se ravitaille en semences à la foire de Konodimini. 
Exploitant une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire 400kg de niébé, 10 sacs d’arachide et des fanes de niébé destinées à faire des bottes. 
Les bottes de niébé sont stockées et vendues pendant la période de soudure. 
Une partie de la récolte est auto consommée tandis que l’autre moitié est stockée et vendue petit à petit pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien.  
Madame Fatoumata  Coumaré à l’image des autres femmes du groupe a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans leurs foyers.
texts.en:
The five members of Group 3 of the association Djekafo of Togo are married women in large traditional families.  The women average 38 years of age and three children each and all live in the village of Togo, in the rural community of Sakoïba, region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community.  With the goal of expanding their cultivated acreage and growing other crops in addition to millet over the wintertime, the group members turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle.  They are going to grow millet, peanuts, and niébé(black-eyed peas). Ms. Fatoumata Coumaré intends to use her loan for buying 50 kg of peanut seeds and recruiting laborers for plowing and weeding the peanut field.  She gets her supplies of seeds at the Konodimini fair.  Working an area of two hectares, she hope to produce 200 kg of niébé, ten sacks of peanuts, and some niébé stems to be baled.  The bales of stems are stocked and then sold during periods of shortages. Part of the harvest is consumed at home, while the other part is stocked and sold a little at a time in order to manage the day-to-day expenses of the household.  Ms. Fatoumata Coumaré, like the other women in the group, has the goal of being self-sufficient in food for their households.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying peanut seeds and paying for field hands

loans.name: Nhong

texts.en: Mrs. Nhong K. is a 56-year-old villager who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Nhong K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine, fertilizer, and pesticide, and to pay for laborers to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Doem Teang, is a teacher in the local school where he receives a small income to support his family. Mrs. Nhong K. is a mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a laborer, and the other is attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio C. is from the village of Lingating Baungon, Bukidnon. He is 65 years old. Sergio is married. To make a living, Sergio runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Sergio has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Sergio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sergio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sergio is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Sergio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sambour

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambour E. is 49 years old and is a villager who lives in Roluos village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sorn Nget, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land and own a plowing machine to support their farming crop. For this farm, Mrs. Sambour E. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her farming crop. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Sorn Nget is also a plowing machine driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while others are students in the local school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena G. is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Elena is single and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Elena runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Elena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. S. was born in 1972; she is married and blessed with four children, all of whom are students in the local public school. She has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Her husband, Heang, is 40 years old. He appears in the photo and has a machine that he uses to provide a battery charging service. Besides their work, the couple always takes time to cultivate rice crops for their own food. The coming rainfalls are good for planting; however, S. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. She is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting

loans.name: Katumba

texts.en:
Katumba is married to a mechanic and they have five children all together. All of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She owns a food stall in the Kanyanya market and sells varieties of foodstuffs like Irish potatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, clusters and bunches of bananas, and fruits like mangoes and oranges. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more sweet and Irish potatoes, mangoes, bunches of bananas and bags of cassava. Katumba has been in this business for more than 20 years and with MCDT for five years.  

Besides this food-stall business, she is now a part-time artist. Katumba works seven days a week. She buys her foodstuffs from Kalerwe Market and uses public transport to and from Kalerwe to her place of work in Kanyanya. Her customers are people who own restaurants. 

Katumba's business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to see her business grow big and to start selling on a wholesale basis only.  She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged compared to other MFIs in the area. 

Katumba resides in and owns  a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include market dues, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes, cassava, bunches of bananas and mangoes

loans.name: Kei

texts.en: Mrs. Kei U. is 28 years old, married, and lives in Daeum Rumdael village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Met Morn, are farmers who own 1.30 hectares of land and a plowing machine to support their farming. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Kei U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. gasoline, pesticide and to pay for rental of a water machine. Aside from farming, Mr. Met Morn is also a plowing machine driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has two children who are too young to study or work. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: purchasing gasoline and pesticide; renting an irrigation machine

loans.name: Sao Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sao Rorn S. is 29 years old. She is a villager who lives in Ta Non village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokea Moeuy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farmer, Mrs. Sao Rorn S. is also silk weaver who is able to earn a small income to support her family's living costs. Although they try to work hard with these businesses they still earn to little income to support the family's costs of living. Thus, in order to increase income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Sao Rorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has a child who is just 5 years old. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Queennie Anne

texts.en:
Queennie Anne L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Queennie Anne is single and has 2 young children. To make a living, Queennie Anne runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Queennie Anne has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Queennie Anne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Queennie Anne is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Queennie Anne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en: Anarkul S. is the leader of this group. She is 46, married, and her husband works as a teacher at the vocational school, receiving 2,500 soms per month. Anarkul has a kiosk where she sells convenience goods. She started this activity eight years ago with the initial investment of 300 soms and now she makes 2,000 soms per month. There are three children in their family: two sons and a daughter. The first son works in construction, the second son went to Russia to work to earn some money, and the daughter studies at school. When the daughter is free, she helps her mom in the kiosk. With money received from the loan, Anarkul wants to purchase a variety of goods: 20 kg of rigatoni, 10 kg of sugar, 20 bars of soap, 20 packs of juice, 3 blocks of cigarettes and 20 packs of powdered detergent. In the future she wants to expand her business and open a big store. Zarylkan E. is the treasurer of the group. She is 63 and a widow. Thirteen years ago, with the initial investment of 3,000 soms, she bought a calf and, since that moment, started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase hay for her cattle. Mukaddas S., 40, is married. She makes and sells bread while her husband works as a taxi driver. Mukaddas started to sell bread eight years ago with the initial investment of 30,000 soms and now she makes 19,000 soms per month. There are four children in her family and all of them are students. If any of the family members has free time, he or she helps Mukaddas with her activity. With money received from the loan Mukkadas wants to purchase 50 bags of flour. In the future she plans to build a big house for her children. Dinara D., 21, is married and her husband works as a driver earning 2,500 soms per month. Dinara applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a washing machine for her mom. Roza O., 53, is a widow. She has two sons: the older son is a bus driver and the second son is a student. Roza works as a nurse and earns 6,000 soms per month. She also breeds cattle, which she has been doing for thirty years. She now she wants to obtain a loan to purchase a calf and hay for her cattle. In the future she wants to save some money to contribute to her son’s wedding. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for her kiosk

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha has been operating her green stall for twenty years. She is married and has five children, all attending school. Her husband is a mason by profession and he financially contributes to his family's basic needs.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Furaha wants to buy a sack of tomatoes, vegetables and fruits and also to build a bigger stall. She sells from home to her immediate neighbors and also supplies to restaurant operators and cafes.
 
Furaha faces the major challenges of produce seasonality and high transport costs. She hopes to open a grocery someday to make more profits and to improve her standard of living. She decided to join Yehu because of their transparency and for accessibility to financial services to boost her business. Furaha rents a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of  tomatoes,vegetables,fruits and also to build a bigger stall.

loans.name: Lurn

texts.en: Mrs. Lurn S. is 33 years old and is a villager who lives in Knhaok Pong village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Seiha Heng, are white wine makers who are able to earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. Aside from being a white wine maker, Mrs. Lurn S. also sells Khmer cheese in the local market. In order to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Lurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple has three children; one is attending in the local school while the others are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna C. is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Elna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elna runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elna has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Elna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ma. Rita

texts.en:
Ma. Rita F. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Ma. Rita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Rita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ma. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ma. Rita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19000 PHP from HSPFI. Ma. Rita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Ma. Rita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeun S. is 26 years old married woman and is a villager who lives in Daeum Rumdael village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Thoun Houn, are farmers who own a 2.30-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice who able to earn for their family's standard of living. For this farm, Mrs. Yoeun S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crop. This couple has two children, who all are attending in the local school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en:
Jealyn S. is from the village of Pagalongan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 26 years old. Jealyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jealyn provides transportation services to local community members. Jealyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jealyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jealyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jealyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a hardworking professional teacher with a zeal to especially teach the young ones. She is pictured at her school (Modern Infants School).

Sylivia is the single mother of three children and she looks after a total of four people with whom she lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She says she is working so hard to see to it that she constructs her own residential house so as to shift from renting.

Sylivia has a nursery school and also a retail shop which she has operated for five years. She started the nursery school as a voluntary project then started collecting a little money as fees from those parents who could afford it. For the retail shop, she started with very little capital but which is now increasing in stock with time.

Sylivia says she faces a challenge of delays in the payment of school fees and also defaulters. She expects to see her businesses grow over time as she struggles hard with work. She intends to use the loan funds to construct a wooden classroom for her nursery school and also to purchase sugar, rice, maize floor, soap, and soft drinks for her retail shop.

loans.use: To construct a wooden classroom and purchase sugar, rice, soap and soft drinks for her retail shop

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en: Mrs. Loeng N. is 60 years old and is a villager who lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Yong Sam, are farmers who own a 3.80 hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. They are able to earn a small income, in this way, to support the family's costs of living. For this farm, Mrs. Loeng N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop. Aside from farming, Mrs. Loeng N. is a Khmer cake seller in the local market while her husband is a fisherman. This couple has a child, who is a farmer. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is married and has three children, aged 18 yrs, 16 yrs and 12 yrs. All of her children attend school. She has been operating her business of selling beans, ground nuts, sunflower and maize in a shop, to her neighbors and passersby. Her husband is employed at a restaurant and he supports his family financially.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a sack of beans, groundnuts and sunflower seeds. She faces the main challenges of theft and high competition. Dorcas hopes to have a wholesale business in the future and to supply her products in large volumes. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and improve her living standards. She rents a house with electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of beans, ground nuts, maize and sunflower.

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel A. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Lezel is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Lezel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lezel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lezel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lezel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lezel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lezel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion M. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old. Adoracion is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Adoracion owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Adoracion has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adoracion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adoracion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Adoracion is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Adoracion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en: Mr. Thim S. 58 years old and is a villager who lives in Saom village in Takeo province. He is a village chief, which allows him to receive a small income to support his family's costs of living. His wife, Mrs. Than Paen, is a farmer who owns 1-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mr. Thim S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his farming crop. This couple has three children; one is a seamstress in the garment factory and one is a beautician while the youngest one is a student in the local school. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Mrs. Phoem C., 63, lives in Roluos village, Takeo Province, where she and her husband, Mr. Muth Poan, are farmers who cultivate rice on a small plot of land they own to earn a small income to support their family living.  Phoem is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and a cow for breeding. This couple has two children, both staff workers in a casino club. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and a cow

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique was born in 1986. She is married with one child who is 3 years old and one dependant. Monique's husband helps her so that they give good service to their customers. Monique sells various products such as rice, sugar, salt, and so on. This business is profitable as her community needs foodstuffs from her shop. Monique has four years of experience in this business. Her hours are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day, except for one day in the week.

Monique is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more products. This expansion will help Monique to attract more customers which will be one way of earning more profit.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Erlinda is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun P., 35, lives in Mreah Prov village in Takeo Province where she cultivates rice upon a plot of land that she owns. She is also a grocery seller, and both enterprises enable her to earn a small income to support her family living. In order to increase family income, Savoeun wants to start a new business and is therefore requesting a loan to buy chickens and equipment to construct a chicken stall to support her new venture.

Savoeun's husband, Mr. Chan Mom, shown in the photo with her, is a construction worker earning a small salary. This couple has three children, all students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy chickens and equipment to make a chicken stall

loans.name: Alain

texts.fr:
Monsieur H. N. Alain est un jeune de 24ans, qui est née à Gikondo dans le district de Kicukiro, ville de Kigali. Il est célibataire, il vit avec sa mama et quatre autres frères. Il a un diplôme de niveau A2 en comptabilité.
Il est employé d’une compagnie de sécurité au poste de gardien. Client de l’IMF Amasezerano Community Banking sa depuis 2008,
Il prend un prêt aujourd’hui pour payer le minerval, deuxième trimestre de sa deuxième année de gestion d’université. L’expérience avec ACB, il a soldé neuf  prêts, et celui-ci et le dixième prêt contracté avec ACB. Dans l’avenir, il veut être un bon gestionnaire du Rwanda. Monter de classe jusqu'à terminer l’université. Sa famille en bénéficiera car il trouvera un nouvel emploi autre que gardien. Aidera ses frères de payer les frais de scolarité (minerval et matériels scolaire), à la longue il se mariera et peut avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. H. N. Alain is a 24 year old, born in Kikondo in the district of Kicukiro in Kigali town. He is single and lives with his mother and other 4 brothers. He has a level A2 diploma in Accounting. He is employed by a Security Company as a watchman/securityman. He 's been a customer of IMF Amasezerano Community Banking since 2008. He is requesting a loan today to pay for tuition for his second semester, second year Management program in college. Having experience with ACB, he settled 9 loans, and this one is his tenth loan with ACB. In the future, he wants to be a good administrator in Rwanda, climbing from class to completing college. His family will benefit because he will find a new job other than a watchman/securityman. He will help his brothers pay for tuition ('minerval' and other school items). In the long run, he will marry and can have children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of tuition ( minerval)

loans.name: Kasusu Twekambe S & C Group

texts.en:
Christine is a 30-year-old lady married to a driver and together they have three children, ages 9, 4 and 1 year old. She lives with eight people in her family and has a dream of constructing a permanent house so they can move out of the semi permanent one they are currently occupying. Christine is a tailor and also has a small retail shop. She has been in business for 10 years now, having started by selling tomatoes, yellow bananas and old clothing before becoming the tailor she is today. She says that taxes are high and an untrustworthy clientele also affects her business operations. She intends to purchase cloth for making T-shirts.

Christine is in a group called Kasusu Twekambe Savings & Credit Group which has 12 members. They use a solidarity kind of borrowing where each of the members is a guarantor to the others to ensure that they all meet their obligations on time and in equal amounts. In the picture, Christine is raising her arm.

loans.use: To purchasing clothing material for men's shirts

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 32 years old. Josefina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. Just like any other mother, her dream is to see all of her children finish college.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Josefina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Mrs. Yan Yorng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yan Y. is a 29 year old married woman. She is the village bank president, having been selected by the group's eight members, located in Ta Koem village, in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Yan Y. and her husband, Mr. Vutdy Uy, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, they are also silk weavers at home who are able to earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. For silk weaving, Mrs. Yan Y. decide to ask for a loan to buy more yarns to support her silk weaving. The rest of the loan will be used to buy piglets for her new business. This couple has three children: two are students in the local school while another one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy more yarns to support her silk weaving.

loans.name: Ngaol's Group

texts.en: This is a group loan, which consists of four people located in Cheav Bdei Kaeut village, Takeo province. Mrs. Nyaol K. is 51 years old and is the leader of the group loan, having been selected by its members. The members of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mrs. Nyaol K. and her husband are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Nyaol K. is now requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer, and to pay to rent a water machine to support her farming crop. Her husband is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family's costs of living. This couple has three children: one is a farmer, while the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 53 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Linda owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.

Linda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Linda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Linda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Now H. is a 22 year old married woman and is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Sla village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. Mrs. Now H. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice, while her husband, Mr. Pov Ang, is recycle middleman who is able to earn a small income to support his family's costs of living. In order to support the farm crop, Mrs. Now H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay laborers to plow her farming crop. This couple has four children: two are students, one is monk and the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T., 44 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Lucia owns and operates a farming business,  primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 17 years. She also dreams to have all her children finish college and find decent jobs for themselves.

In 2006, Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and fertilizers. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lucia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mr. Khom L. is 46 years old and is a villager who lives in Choes village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sam Hun, are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. They are able to earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. In this farm, they face a problem because the field has infertile soil and there is not enough water to support their farming crop. Thus, Mr. Khom L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to support his farming crop. This couple has two children who all are seamstresses in the garment factory. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a water machine.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P., 60 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 9 adult-aged children. She has been involved in farming for more than forty years already. At her age, she still manages to perform farming duties with the help of her husband and older children. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest around her community. She still has children who go to school and she hopes to be able to sustain their education.

Lydia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for the seeds she acquired and to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lydia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the seeds she acquired and to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: C3545 Abakundanye Group

texts.en:
Clementine is 36 years old and married with three children: the firstborn is 18 years old, the next is 17 years old and the last one is 10 years old. Clementine's husband helps her with her salon. Both work hard for the development of their family. Clementine will use this loan to buy modern equipment for her salon which will allow her to attract and serve more customers. With her expanded business, Clementine will be able to earn more profit which will allow her to buy her own house and pay the school fees of her children.

Clementine is the leader of a group of six people, mostly women with one man. All of them they have salon businesses. Clementine and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy some equipment for her salon

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna L. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Lorna is single. To make a living, Lorna runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2006, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ser

texts.en: Mrs. Ser M. is 53 years old and is a villager in Choes village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ser Chann, are farmers who own a 1-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Ser M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to buy a cow to add her old one to support her farming crop. Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Ser M. is also a sugar palm seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family's costs of living. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the others are farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to buy a cow to add her old one.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and married. She is involved in farming and has been planting rice crops for more than a few years now. She helps her husband maintain their farm. While her husband does the major farming duties, she also manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells sugar, oil and other basic necessities people in her neighborhood regularly look for. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

Merlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. 

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Merlyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand it.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom S., 50 years old, lives in Krang Ta Chan village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Men Mok, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children; one is a construction worker while the other two are seamstresses in the garment factory. In order to help her children, Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport them to their working place. Mrs. Sokhom S.'s husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children's transportation to work

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Merlyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing trisikad  (pedicab) services to local community members. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia O. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Dorotia is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Dorotia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the buying and selling of banana products in the local community. Dorotia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Dorotia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorotia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dorotia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dorotia from HSPFI. loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. S. Sophat, 43 years old, lives in Chheal Phlouh village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soy Yiv, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to increase their income to improve and support the family's standard of living, Mrs. S. Sophat decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her new business. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her farming crop. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a farmer and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en:
Z. Muharram is a hard working woman. She is married and has two children. For the past 14 years, Muharram has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business after her husband's employment contract with a construction company ended. With her husband’s income missing, bills started to pile up and she decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Muharram has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 TJS to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. This is an important matter for this family's well-being. Please help Muharram’s business grow. She truly appreciates your generosity.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach L., age 46, lives in Prambei Mom village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ron Prak, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mrs. Thach L. is also a Khmer noodle vendor, which allows her to earn a small additional income to help support her family. 

In order to make it easier for her to transport Khmer noodles door-to-door, Mrs. Thach L. has decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for transport. 

This couple has five children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the younger three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr:
Léonie N. est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo en Province Cibitoke  à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de manioc sec au Marché de Rugombo.Elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer cette activité commerciale. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est  divorcée il ya de cela 8 ans. Elle est maintenant  au 3e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 8enfants ; 2 garçons et 6 filles âgés de 25ans, 23 ans, 19 ans, 17 ans, 15 ans, 13 ans, 10 ans et de 8ans. Quatre de ses enfants étudient. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour augmenter  la quantité de manioc sec qu’elle achète pour revendre aux clients. Elle affirme qu’elle fait face au ralentissement de son activité pendant la saison pluvieuse parce que son activité consiste à sécher le manioc pour l’écouler au marché. Elle a l’espoir qu’avec le crédit de Turame, elle  sera a mesure de supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et mener sa vie heureusement.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Maombi ».
texts.en:
Léonie N. is a 40 year old business woman who lives in Rugombo commune, in the province of Cibitoke which is in the west of Burundi. She sells dried manioc in Rugombo's market. She was a farmer before she started this business. She has never been to school. She has been divorced for the past eight years. This is her third loan with Turame. She is the mother of eight children: two boys and six girls, aged 25, 23, 19, 17, 15, 13, 10 and 8. Four of her children are in school. She is asking for a Kiva loan to increase the amount of dried manioc she can buy to sell to her clients. She has a hard time drying enough manioc during the rainy season. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to pay her children's tuition fees and lead a happier life. She is a member of the Maombi community group.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried manioc to sell at market

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
M. Joséphine est une femme de 48 ans, veuve, née à Rubavu  un des districts de la province de l’Ouest du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est négligeable mais elle sait lire et écrire. Elle a mis au monde quatre enfants, le plus âgée a 27 ans et son cadet a 13 ans. Deux de ses enfants ont étudié jusqu’au niveau de secondaire.

Cette famille vit de l’agriculture et l’élevage des bovins et son milieu de vie est favorable pour l’élevage car c’est tout près du lac Kivu ou le pâturage ne manque pas même dans la saison sèche. Client d’Amasezerano Community Banking depuis 2009, elle a contracté un prêt avec celui-ci pour acheter une vache de la race améliorée. Grâce à ses épargnes elle a pu payer le minerval pour ses deux enfants, et mettre le pavement dans sa maison qui n’était pas pavée. Elle veut avoir dans l’avenir dix vaches de race amélioré car elles sont bénéfiques que les races locale et améliorer l'aimantation par le lait. Les épargnes venant de ces bénéfices lui permettra d’amener les deux autres enfants qui restent a l’école.
texts.en:
Joséphine M. is a 48 year old widow who was born in Rubavu district in Rwanda's Western Province. She has little schooling, but she can read and write. She has four children; the oldest is 27 and the youngest is 13. Two of her children have been to high school. This is a family that lives from agriculture and raising cattle. They have a good location near Kivu lake where there is always pasture even during the dry season. Mrs. M. received a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in 2009 to buy a cow of a better breed. Thanks to her investment, she has paid the tuition fees for her two children and put flooring in her house, which had a dirt floor before. She hopes to acquire 10 better breed cows in the future because these are more profitable than local cows and produce milk, which improves nutrition. The return on this investment will allow her to support the other two children who are still in school.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a breeding cow

Alice has an experience of nine years in her laundry business. The hours of her business are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day except Sunday.

So far, Alice is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through buying modern equipment to be used in her business. Once her vision is reached, she will be able to serve more customers which will be one of her ways of earning more profit.

loans.name: Kilapei Ole

texts.en:
Kilapei Ole K. is 37 years old. He is married to Naramat K. and is the father of three children who are going to school.

Kilapei is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET from a market awareness done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to prepare his ten acres of land for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions and also a market is readily available as a local miller comes to buy the produce from the farms. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Kilapei dream is to do large scale farming and buy some farm equipment. 

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend on ploughing, harrowing, seeding, fertilizing and planting his ten acres of maize.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta T. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old and married. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business planting bananas, selling plant seedlings and young crops to local farmers. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional agricultural materials needed for the farm. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to generate additional supplies for the continuation and further development of the farm. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Violeta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural supplies

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis E. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 29 years old. Dennis is married and has three school-age children. 

Dennis owns a business in which he buys and sells scrap materials in the local community. Dennis has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dennis joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dennis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dennis is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline L. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Evangeline is widowed and has eight adult children. 

Evangeline owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop which primarily sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: John Sakana Ole

texts.en:
John Sakana Ole K. is 57 years old. He is married to Tintai K. and is a father to three school-age children.

John is a farmer and works on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET from a market awareness project done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He plans to spend the money on land preparation, seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by plowing a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

John's dream is be a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery.

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: For land preparation, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides

loans.name: Rakita Ole

texts.en:
Rakita Ole K. is 32 years old. He is married to Esther K. and a father to two school-age children.

Rakita is a farmer who has his own piece of land which he has been cultivating for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET from a friend who is a registered client of KADET in his community. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to prepare his ten acres of land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by leasing a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

Rakita's dream is be a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery.

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare his land for wheat production

loans.name: Rebeccah Wangari

texts.en:
Rebbeccah Wangari N. is 45 years old. She is married to Joseph Ologolimot and is a mother of three children.

Rebbeccah is a farmer who operates a poultry business, which she has been doing for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her community. This will be her second loan which she is planning to use to increase the number of broilers and to lease a bigger room where she can keep more chicks. Poultry keeping has been a good business since most of the hotels get their orders from her.  She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her poultry farming activity from small scale to large scale.

Rebbeccah's dream is do large scale poultry keeping and be the main supplier of chickens for the entire town of Narok. 

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy more broilers and lease a bigger room to keep more chicks.

loans.name: Matias

texts.en:
Matias H., from the village of Tumpagon Cagayan de Oro City, is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Matias owns and operates a business venture selling specialty food products such as chicken and pork al a carte in the local community. Engaged in his business for over a year, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Matias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, he is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP for the same purpose. Matias plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Patrick Nepatao

texts.en:
Patrick Nepatao K. is 57 years old. He is married to Naitayiana Kuyioni and is a father of three school-going children. Patrick is a farmer, and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from a market awareness effort conducted by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare his 10 acres of land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by renting a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

Patrick's dream is to be a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend on land preparation, seeds and planting, and to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Kinampet Ole

texts.en:
Kinampet Ole K. is 48 years old. He is married to Ntoron K. and is a father of four school-going children. Kinampet is a farmer and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from a market awareness effort conducted by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 on land preparing, 15,000 on seeds and planting, and the remaining 15,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by renting a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

Kinampet's dream is be a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To use on land preparation, seeds and planting, and to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Kanyinke Ole

texts.en:
Kanyinke Ole K. is 48 years old. He is married to Nalayian K. and is a father of two school-going children. Kanyinke is a farmer and has been farming his own piece of land for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from a friend in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare his 10-acre land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

Kanyinke's dream is be a large-scale farmer with his own farm machinery. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend on ploughing, hallowing, buying fertilizer and seeds, and planting

loans.name: Bonivie

texts.en:
Bonivie P. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Bonivie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Bonivie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Bonivie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. She chose to request a loan of 4,000 PHP as the second cycle because she said it would be easy for her to pay back.

In 2009, Bonivie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonivie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bonivie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Bonivie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kinanda Ole

texts.en:
Kinanda Ole M. is 30 years old. He is married to Mary M. and is a father of two school-going children. Kinanda is a farmer, and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last six years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who was already a registered member of KADET. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 on ploughing, 10,000 on harrowing, 20,000 on seeds and 10,000 on planting his 10 acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by acquiring more land to increase his wheat production.

Kinanda's dream is to do large scale farming and to buy his own farm machinery. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend on ploughing, harrowing and seeds, and on planting his 10 acres of wheat

loans.name: Lampei Ole

texts.en:
Lampei Ole O. is 34 years old. He is married to Doris O. and is the father of three children.

Lampei is a small-scale farmer. He does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET through a market-awareness exercise done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant more maize, which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Lampei's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. 

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: He is planning to plant 5 acres of maize
